Le groupe de solidarité SOPECHEIKH MAKHFOU a vu le jour en décembre 2009. Il est composé de 10 femmes issues du même quartier. Elles liées par des liens affectifs, de parenté et par voisinage. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de DVF GUEOUL

Madame Fatou N., debout au second rang sur la photo est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 34 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge de 2 autres enfants confiés par des proches. 

Elle fait du commerce. Elle se rend à Dakar acheter des articles divers pour revendre lors du marché hebdomadaire de son quartier. 

Avec son crédit elle va acheter des pochettes, des sacs à main pour dame, des chaussures etc..

Ses bénéfices lui permettent de renforcer son épargne et de perdre en charge ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Sopecheikh Makhfou has been created in December 2009. It is composed of 9 women all living in the same neighborhood. They are all neighbors and relatives or friends. The group belongs to the Banc Villageois of DVF Gueoul. Mrs. Fatou N., second row (standing) in the photo, is the group’s leader. She is 34 years old. She is married and the mother of 6 children. She also has 2 other children in her care, entrusted to her by family members. She is an entrepreneur. She travels to Dakar to purchase miscellaneous items to resell them at her local weekly market. With her credit, she would like to buy plastic pouches, women’s handbags, shoes etc. Her revenues allow her to bolster her savings and to provide for her personal needs.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing her business capital

loans.name: Angel Brever

texts.es:
Ángel de 46 años, es mecánico de motocicletas y también vende repuestos, vive en una zona  periurbana en la Perimetral de Guayaquil. tiene dos hijos de 19 y 17 años. 

El tenia una tienda de víveres pero como quería el y su esposa tener mas ingresos decidieron vender repuestos de motocicletas. Poco a poco Ángel aprendió a reparar motocicletas y a vender los repuesto, ahora trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 17h00pm todos los días. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar una caja de cambio y válvulas para las motocicletas, en el futuro quiere incrementar su negocio y construir mejor su casa.
texts.en:
Ángel, age 46, is a motorcycle mechanic and also sells spare parts. He lives in a periurban area on the outskirts of Guayaquil. He has two children ages 19 and 17. He used to have a grocery store, but since he and his wife wanted to have more income they decided to sell spare motorcycle parts. Bit by bit Angel learned to repair motorcycles and sell the spare parts. He now works from 8 am to 5 pm every day. With this loan he wants to buy a gearbox and valves for the motorcycles. In the future he wants to expand his business and improve the structure of his home.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: gear box, ball valve

loans.name: Walter

texts.es: Walter, de 29 años, vive en casa de sus padres en compañía de ellos y de sus hermanos, todos juntos habitan en una modesta vivienda de material noble ubicada en un populoso barrio al norte de la ciudad. Este emprendedor joven se dedica a brindar el servicio de taxi, durante el día, dice que escogió este horario porque trabajar en la noche es más peligroso. Aunque no tiene hijos aún se esfuerza a diario, para ayudar en algo a sus padres en los constantes gastos del hogar, y también para terminar con la construcción de su casa. Trabaja con clientes fijos y nuevos, por rutas cortas, ya que sabe que así se obtiene mayores ganancias, y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es compartir experiencias con sus ocasionales pasajeros, además se distrae bastante viendo las calles y las personas. Tiene grandes planes por concretar, uno de ellos es, comprar un auto para rentarlo, de esta manera espera obtener mejores ganancias. Es el segundo crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente para no defraudar a todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Walter tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en el mantenimiento mecánico de su auto, ya que lo requiere con urgencia para poder trabajar tranquilamente.
texts.en:
Walter, 29, lives with his parents and siblings in their house which is a modest house made from substantial materials located in a crowded neighborhood in the north part of the city. This enterprising young man provides taxi services during the day. He says he selected this work schedule because working at night is more dangerous. Although he doesn’t have any children he works hard daily to help his parents with the constant household expenses and to finish building their house. He works with both new and regular customers on short routes because that means higher profits. What he likes best about his work is sharing experiences with his passengers and he enjoys looking at the streets and the people. He has a lot of plans in the works. One of them is to buy a car to lease it out thereby earning better profits. This is his 2nd loan with MFP and he promises to repay punctually so as not to disappoint all the people that made the loan possible which will allow him to keep working in search of progress. Walter will use the funds for vehicle maintenance and repair because it has some urgent work that needs to be done in order to be able to work worry-free.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For vehicle maintenance and repair.

loans.name: Teresa De Lourdes

texts.es:
Teresa de 46 años, es vendedora informal de confites y dulces en la parte delantera de su casa. Vive con su hijo de 12 años en una zona urbana caracterizada porque la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales.

Comenzó con su negocio ya que todos los días le tenia que comprar para la escuela a su hijo confites, opto por comprar en una cantidad grande confites y dulces y venderlos para tener un ingreso adicional. Poco a poco a podido incrementar su mercadería. Trabaja todos los días desde muy temprano hasta el anochecer para darle una mejor vida a sus hijos. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar lácteos, confites para surtir mas su negocio. En el futuro quiere tener de alquiler locales para tener un ingreso adicional.
texts.en:
Teresa, 46, sells sweets and candy informally in front of her house. She lives with her 12 year old son in an urban zone noted for most of its inhabitants being informal merchants. She started her business because she had to buy her son snacks daily to take to school. She opted to buy a large quantity of snacks and candy to sell and have an extra source of income. Gradually she was able to increase her merchandise. She works every day from very early in the morning until nightfall to provide her children with a better life. The loan will be used to buy dairy products and sweets to better stock her business. In the future she’d like to have locales to rent as an additional source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For dairy products and sweets.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is a 54-year-old married man with 6 children and has 4 other dependents. He lives in his own residential house with 4 family members. His family goal is to have educated children and a farm. His home address is Masindi, Uganda. 

He is into the transportation business and has been running it for one year. He bought the vehicle using his retirement package. He faces a challenge of high fuel prices and obtaining vehicle spare parts. In future he wishes to have a fleet of trucks and he wants the loan to purchase new tyres for his vehicle.

loans.use: Buying tyres for his vehicle for transport business

loans.name: United Women For Development Group

texts.en:
Ruth Kabbeh, who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called United Women For Development. She is 41 years old, married, and has four children who are between the ages of 8 to 26 years. She was only able to attend school through 11th grade due to a lack of financial support. She describes herself as a faithful woman.

For 5 years, she has been selling drinks (liquor) in Coca Cola Factory Community outside of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 6,000 LRD portion of this 30,000 LRD group loan to buy more crates of drinks. Her dreams are to improve her business and build a house.

loans.use: To buy more crates of drinks.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina E. is a rice vendor, buying and selling rice at both the wholesale and retail level. Her husband, Raymundo E., age 44, works as a rice mill Operator to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have two children who are 14 and 17 years old. The family lives in Sitio Cantonog, Brgy. Linao, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental

Gina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 because she aspired toward something better for her family. With the help of her past 13 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Gina has been working hard and incrementally lifting her family out of poverty. Her previous loan of PHP 20,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 12,000, thus raising the family's standard of living. This time, for her fourteenth cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 23,000, which she intends to use to purchase more stocks to sell so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children and meet her family needs. 

Gina E. is truly a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Dungganon is a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable." Through this alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities they could not even have dreamed of. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase a stock of rice to offer for sale

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
This is Cheryl A., 40, resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Leonardo, a pedicab driver, and together they have a child who helps her with the business. By the grace of God, Cheryl has managed to support her child's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Cheryl operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go for to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling at piecemeal rates. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php200 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Cheryl dreams of being able to finish college education of her children with all of her work with the business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more quantities of products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen N. lives in the Busega neighborhood of Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has one child who is not in school. 

Hellen sells charcoal. She has been in this business for 2 years and she works 7 days a week. Hellen sells her products from home. Hellen has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more charcoal.her main business challenge is transporting the charcoal from Natete to her home in Busega.  She hopes to start going to villages of Luwero for charcoal. Hellen lives in a home that she owns with electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expense is food.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal

loans.name: Colombus

texts.en: 28 year old Colombus R. is a courteous, hard working and good natured business man. For the last 10 years he has been selling bananas in Kanywambogo Market-Ibanda. Before that he was selling mostly goats. Colombus is happily married and has 1 child.  To supplement his 180,000 monthly profits, he also sells goats. With this loan, Colombus says he is going to purchase more bananas to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more bananas to sell

loans.name: Daisy

texts.es:
Daisy forma parte del banco comunal “Creciendo hacia el Futuro” de la ciudad de Rancagua.  Ella tiene un kiosco en un colegio de la ciudad, el cual atiende desde hace 1 año. También ofrece servicios de banquetería y comida típica en una parte del terreno de su casa, desde hace unos 10 años. Daisy le da trabajo a su prima para que le ayude en sus dos negocios y a una compañera,  cuando tiene que atender algún evento. Todas son parte de Fondo Esperanza. Además cocina, para vender en esta época de Navidad, pan de pascua y pavos asados, por encargos. A fines de diciembre reemplazará los pavos por mote con huesillos. 
La casa de Daisy, la cual es muy antigua, sufrió varios daños debido al terremoto del pasado 27 de febrero, por lo que la está reparando de a poco. 
Con este préstamo comprará cerámica para su cocina,  alimentos  e ingredientes para preparar sus productos.
Daisy trabaja todos los días de la semana y es el único sustento económico de su hogar. Tiene una hija que está en 3º año de la universidad y estudia ingeniería comercial. 
Su sueño es hacer un centro de eventos en su casa, ya que por la extensión del terreno que ocupa, tendría capacidad para atender a 200 personas. Ahora por falta de infraestructura, puede atender solo a 50 personas.
Para Daisy Fondo Esperanza ha sido un gran apoyo material y emocional, ya que gracias a los préstamos ha mantenido su negocio.
Rancagua pertenece a la región del Libertador Bernardo O´Higgins. Es una moderna ciudad que regula el principal proceso productivo y exportador agrofrutícola y vitivinícola de Chile. Es también una ciudad minera, debido a que en su cordillera se encuentra la mina subterránea más grande del mundo “El Teniente”, con 4.500 km. de túneles.
texts.en:
Daisy is a member of the "Creciendo hacia el Futuro" (Growing towards the Future) community bank which is located in the city of Rancagua.  She has a kiosk in a local school where she has been working for 1 year.  She has also been offering catering services and traditional meals on her property for 10 years.

Daisy employs her cousin to help her in her two businesses and a friend when she has to serve at an event.  They are all members of Fondo Esperanza.  Daisy also bakes panettone and roast turkey to order to sell during the Christmas period.  At the beginning of December, she replaces her turkeys with 'mote con huesillos' (a traditional Chilean summer drink).

Daisy's home, which is very old, suffered damage in the February 27th earthquake and she is repairing it bit by bit.  She will use this loan to buy ceramics for her kitchen and food and ingredients for preparing her products.  Daisy works every day of the week and she is the only one who financially supports her household.  She has a daughter who is in her third year at university, studying commercial engineering.

Daisy's dream is to set up an events center in her home because her plot of land is large and she would have room for 200 people.  Right now, as she lacks infrastructure, she can only serve 50 people.  For Daisy, Fondo Esperanza has been a great material and emotional support since their loans have enabled her to keep her business running.

The city of Rancagua is located in Libertador Bernardo O'Higgins region.  It is a modern city that controls the main production and export process for Chilean agricultural and wine products.  It is also a mining city.  The biggest underground mine in the world, 'El Teniente' is found in its mountain range, with 4,500km of tunnels.

loans.use: Ceramics, food and ingredients

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen N. is 45 years old and married with four school-aged children who all attend school. Stephen has a mixed farm in Nyamira town, western Kenya that produces tea, milk, vegetables and maize that are all sold locally. He has been in the farming business for eighteen years now. He mainly depends on the income from his farm to cater to the basic needs of his family.

Stephen has requested a loan of 35,000 KES through Kiva’s partner Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help improve his family's living conditions. He would like to expand his tea plantation and own at least four dairy cows in the next five years.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Mrs. Sinat Auk Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan consists of thirteen people who are living in A Cheang village in Takeo province. Mrs. Sinat A. is a village bank president who has been selected by the other members who will use their portion of the loan for varied ways to improve their family's living situation. She is a noodle seller in a local village where she is able to earn some profit to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Norn Ai, is a construction worker. She wants to start selling fish, but does not have a bicycle for transportation. Mrs. Sinat A. is taking a loan to buy a bicycle. She is a mother of two children, one of whom is enrolled in a local school. The youngest child is one year old.

loans.use: To buy a bicycle for transportation to sell fish

loans.name: Felicia

texts.es:
Felicia tiene 48 años de edad, tiene tres hijos y vive en la ciudad de Cusco, Perú.  Felicia se dedica a la venta de fruta que trae de la ciudad de Yanatile. Ya son 7 años que tiene el negocio y le va muy bien,  ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para hacer el mantenimiento de su casa. Su sueño de Felicia es abrir un restaurante.
     
Felicia pertenece al banco comunal “Unión, Fuerza y Amistad” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Felicia is 48 years old, has three children, and lives in the city of Cusco, Peru. She sells fruit that is brought in from the city of Yanatile. Felicia has been in this business for seven years and has done very well. She is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to maintain her home. Her dream is to open a restaurant.

Felicia belongs to the Communal Bank “Unión, Fuerza y Amistad” (Unity, Strength, and Friendship). She is grateful for the opportunity provided and promises to complete her payments on time.

loans.use: Pay for home maintenance

loans.name: Kaiyrgul's Group

texts.en:
Kaiyrgul K. is the treasurer of this group. She is 24 years old and divorced. She has a newborn baby and she also looks after two younger brothers and a sister. All of them study at school.

Five years ago, with the initial investment of 30,000 KGS, she started to sell flour for making money. Now her monthly profit is approximately $212. This profit made it possible for her to purchase a refrigerator and to improve the family’s living conditions. 

With money received from the loan she wants to increase the turnover of her business and purchase more flour for resale. In the future she plans to purchase a truck in order to reduce transportation expenditures. 
  
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Micro-finance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Micro-finance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. 

To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase more flour to sell

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is a member of the Kitekitu group in Faulu Kenya. He operates a boda boda (motorbike) transport business. George has two years of experience in the business and employs two people. Since he became a member of Faulu Kenya, George has been motivated to work hard in his business. He is looking forward to opening other business outlets. He has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to buy spare parts for his motorbike.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his motorbike

loans.name: Rustam

texts.en:
Rustam is married and is a father of three children.  He is the only income earner for his family.   His wife is not working and is bringing up their children at home.  Rustam is engaged in animal husbandry. He has been in this business for 5 years. He purchases cattle and feeds them for a certain period of time, then sells them in the markets of Yavan, Sultonobod and Rudaki.   Rustam would like to get a loan of US$1000 to purchase more cattle, which will allow him to expand this business. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: buy more cattle for his business

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma C. is from the village of Bantuanon, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 41 years old and married, with 9 adult-aged children. To make a living, Norma operates a specialized retail store, where she sells medicinal wine and a variety of powdered juice drinks. Norma has been engaged in her business for more than 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

Norma joined HSPFI this year to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Norma is requesting her first loan, for 5000 PHP, to be used to purchase additional products such as beverages and canned goods. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as beverages and canned goods

loans.name: Aynur

texts.en:
Aynur Q., age 45, carries out her daily work herding her grazing cattle in an area near the city of Bilasuvar, where she is from. She and her husband have been dedicated to this occupation for the last six years. This is the only financial income for the family. Aynur is the dedicated mother of three children.

Aynur wishes to buy calves for breeding and so that she can increase monthly turnover. She is therefore asking for a loan of 1,000 AZN. She promises to repay on time.

loans.use: to purchase two calves for breeding

loans.name: Clarisse

texts.en:
Clarisse is a 30-year-old mother of a two-month-old and a four-year-old, the latter child already attending school. Clarisse owns a restaurant serving a variety of foods; she also charges phones in exchange for money and also owns a small shop selling items such as biscuits, soap, sugar, etc. Operating these businesses for the past two years has enabled her meet the needs of her family.

Clarisse is now requesting a loan to buy more food for her restaurant and plans to buy a cow as a source of milk. She hopes to soon begin building her family home.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa is 46 years old and live in West Point. She has two children aged 25 and 30. Only one of them attends school. For the past seven years Hawa has been selling traditional cloth (lappa) in the local market. She enjoys her work there. She is requesting a loan to purchase more lappa for her business; she plans to buy some land and build a house on it in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more Lappa (a traditional cloth) for her business.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 34 años de edad convive con oscar  de 32, con quien tiene dos bellas hijas que, son los regalos mas preciados que lo pudiera haber dado la vida, y por quienes esta dispuesta a  luchar y dar la vida si es que fuera posible. Ellos viven en su casa propia ubicado en el centro poblado de natividad del distrito de Pichari. Cuando hace 20 años el país atravesaba un crisis social,  rosa aún era una niña de 14 años y en ese tiempo perdió a sus padres, por lo que dejó los estudios y tuvo que trabajar como empleada del hogar  para poder sobrevivir, especializándose en la preparación de comidas. Hoy se ha convertido en su fuente de ingresos económicos, es así que prepara diversos potajes, por lo que sus clientes no dudan en ir a consumir uno de ellos. Día a día trabaja y crea nuevos platos,  dándoles a sus comensales un trato amable y cordial deseándoles un pronto retorno. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP por lo que espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para continuar con la preparación de comida. Rosa  es una mujer que le pone ese entusiasmo y espíritu de emprendedor en su banco comunal. Con los tres mil nuevos soles comprará utensilios de cocina y mejorar el ambiente de su restaurante.
texts.en:
Rosa is 34 years old and in a common-law marriage with Oscar, age 32. They have two beautiful daughters who are the most precious gifts she has in life and for whom she is willing to fight and provide the best life possible. Rosa and her family live in their own home in the central village of Natividad in the District of Pichari. Twenty years ago, when the country was enduring a social crisis, Rosa was 14 years old when she lost her parents. She had to quit school and work as a housekeeper in order to survive. As part of her job, she learned how to prepare food and now she uses that skill to earn an income. Rosa prepares different dishes and her customers do not hesitate to try at least one of them. She works every day and creates new dishes. Rosa provides her customers with friendly service in hopes that they will return soon.

This is her second loan with MFP. She hopes that everyone will support her so that she can continue preparing her food. Rosa is an enthusiastic woman and a spirited entrepreneur in her Communal Bank. Her loan of 3000 PEN will be used to buy cooking utensils and pay for improvements to the ambience of her restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase cooking utensils and to make improvements to her restaurant.

loans.name: Nexaida

texts.es: Nexaida de 22 años de edad, convive con Richard de 25 años de edad quienes habitan en una casa alquilada. Por sus venas corre sangre de agricultor, ya que generalmente en su comunidad todos se dedican a dicha actividad. Actualmente se dedica a cultivar cacao, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de sus 4 hijos y durante el tiempo de cosecha tiene que contratar peones. Normalmente su producto lo vende en los Centros de Acopio, en la  localidad de Pichari. En adelante piensa comprar más terrenos, para así producir en grandes volúmenes y por consiguiente vender su producto a un  buen precio. El único inconveniente que ella tiene es que su parcela se encuentra en un lugar accidentado que no tiene acceso de movilidad y le es muy forzoso el  trasladar sus productos cosechados. Este será su segundo crédito con MFP por lo que ella se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 2.000 nuevos soles contratará peones para que realicen la limpieza de su parcela agrícola.
texts.en:
Nexaida is 22 years old and in a common-law marriage with Richard, age 25. They live in a rented house. The blood of a farmer runs through her veins since almost everyone in her community engages in agriculture. Nexaida currently grows cacao. Occasionally she has the help of her four children, but she must hire workers during the harvest season. She normally sells her products at the collection centers in the town of Pichari. Going forward, Nexaida plans to buy more land so that she can produce in greater volumes and continue selling her products at a good price. Her only challenge at the moment is a parcel of land that she owns that is located in a rugged area not accessible by vehicle. As a result, she is not able to transport her harvested products.

This will be her second loan with MFP. Nexaida promises to submit her payments on time. The loan of 2000 PEN will be used to hire workers to clear her parcel of farmland.

loans.use: to pay workers to clear her farmland.

loans.name: Lisungi Plus Group

texts.en:
Charlotte is the leader of the Community Bank named “Lisungi Plus”, which is composed of 15 members united in solidarity to receive Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.
Charlotte is 46 years old, a widow and the mother of ten children, whose ages range between 9 and 28 years old. Six of her children attend school. Charlotte has been part of the micro-enterprise world since 2007. She operates a general store and sells prepaid cards in the mid-west of Kinshasa. She works hard and employs good management skills in order to realize her dream of someday becoming a main provider in her environment. She would also like to achieve financial independence through her business, which currently earns her $100 per week. Charlotte has already obtained and correctly repaid 11 loans from microfinance institution and Kiva partner, HOPE DRC. She will increase her stock of merchandise with her next loan by buying one sack of flour, one sack of sugar, vegetable oil and some prepaid cards in bulk to resell at a profit.

loans.use: to increase her store’s stock by buying one sack of flour, one sack of sugar, vegetable oil and some prepaid cards in bulk for reselling at profit.

loans.name: Erwin

texts.en:
At the very young age of 20, Erwin engaged in planting and harvesting rice for future sale. He has been doing this for over a year. As a farmer working in the Philippines, he earns the average of 60,000 PHP (~$1410) every harvest season. He plants and harvests rice twice a year, every April and November.

Erwin is asking for a loan to buy farm supplies such as seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and insecticides for his farming to improve his crop production. In the future, he hopes to strengthen his business and generate more income from farming to maintain economic stability.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies such as seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and insecticides.

loans.name: Mesías Hugo

texts.es:
Mesías tiene 28 años vive en T. junto a su madre y hermano, no tiene hijos y se describe como una persona trabajadora, tranquila, amistosa, dedicada y preocupado por su familia.

Trabaja en agricultura en el cultivo de papas solo, empezó a trabajar como jornalero y cuando tuvo experiencia decidió trabajar su propia tierra, empezó con su labor hace 11 años.

Realiza créditos a FODEMI desde hace 2 años este sería su tercer crédito, este prestamo lo va a utilizar en la compra de abono para el sembrío de papas que están de 4 meses de siembre.

Con la ayuda de este préstamo mejoraría su producción y sus ventas y a la vez mejoraría la calidad de vida de el y el de su familia, aspira llegar a comprar una casa ya que ellos viven arrendando, también comprar electrodomésticos para su casa.
texts.en:
Mesías is 28 years old and lives in T. with his mother and brother.  He doesn't have any children and is described as a hard worker, quiet, friendly, dedicated and concerned about his family.

He works in agriculture in the cultivation of solely potatoes.  He began working as a laborer and when he had experience he decided to work his own land. Mesías began his work 11 years ago.

He has been getting loans from FODEMI for 2 years, this would be his third loan.  He will use this loan to buy fertilizer for planting potatoes that are within 4 months of sowing.

With the help of this loan, Mesías would improve his production and sales and also improve the quality of life for his family.  He aspires to buy a house because they are leasing.  He also wants to buy appliances for his home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for planting potatoes.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. 

Aida has a retail shop where she sells home products like kitchen utensils, curtains & bed sheets. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy home products for sell.

Aida is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Aida hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy home products to sell.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 36 years old and lives in the town of Hoima in the Mbarara region of Uganda.  He is single and has 2 children. Both of his children are currently in school.  Paul has a business of a small retail shop, which he has had for 2 years.         

To help expand his business, Paul has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase essential commodities like salt and sugar for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, he hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children.  In the future, he hopes to expand his business.    Paul is a member of BRAC’s Small enterprise (SEP) program, which has helped his prospects for the future by increasing his capital.

loans.use: to purchase essential commodities like salt and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Met

texts.en:
Met is a weaver, while her husband is a farmer. They live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 2000 and have two children, a son and a daughter. Both children are in school. 

Met is applying for another loan of US$500 to buy one more cow to raise. 

Photo: Met and her husband.

loans.use: To buy one more cow to raise.

loans.name: Joann

texts.en:
Joann is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 3 children.  Joann has a shop that sells vegetables & spices. She has had this business for 5 years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy vegetables & spices to sell.  Joann has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Joann hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables & spices to sell

loans.name: Lubna

texts.en:
Lubna is a 34-year-old young woman. She is married and has three sons. Her husband has a store for selling generators where there is high demand for generators. This is the only source of income for the family. Lubna wants to help her husband in the purchase of more generators for sale but she does not have enough money so she needs to take a loan from FATEN. When Lubna gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, she will be able to help her husband to sell more, increase his income and provide his family with better living conditions. Lubna is a conservative woman so her husband is photographed instead next to his store.


About this loan product:
 FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: To purchase more generators for sale.

loans.name: Rem

texts.en:
Rem, 43 years old, sells vegetables, earning $8 per day. Her husband plants vegetables, earning $1 per day. The couple has five children: four are in school and one works in the garment factory, earning $3 per day. Each month, Rem spends $60 on food, $5 on electricity, $20 on school fees, $20 on transportation and $20 on other expenses.

Rem would like to request a loan of $700 to buy vegetables to sell. She wants to expand her vegetable store to sell more kinds of vegetables when she has enough money. Rem wants to support her children to study until they finish university.

loans.use: To buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Ntetia

texts.en:
Ntetia is a very hard-working woman who practices mixed farming in Olokurto-Narok, Kenya. She has been in this business for over five years and earns a monthly profit of KES 5,000. 

She is 34 years old and married to Jackson, also a farmer. They have two children.

She is applying for her first loan. She plans to use part of the loan to buy farm inputs and other items to use in business. 

She intends to use the additional income from the proceeds of this loan to buy cattle for fattening and to pay her children's school fees. She hopes to develop her business and to be financially stable in the future

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Daysi Tatiana

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal María Del Carmen se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi (Portoviejo). Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla, ciudad de clima fresco y con muchos atractivos turísticos naturales propios de la zona.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Daysi, tiene 24 años de edad está casada y de  esta relación tiene dos niñas de 9 y 4 años de edad la mayor estudian en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.
 
Ella realiza el crédito  para ayudar a su esposo con su negocio, él se dedica a la venta de pescado,  todos los días en la madrugada él se desplaza hasta las playas para comprar el mejor pescado para luego llevarlo a Montecristi lugar que recorre en un triciclo para poder vender todo lo que lleva y con esto lograr ganar lo suficiente para que no falte nada en el hogar. Lleva como 13 años en este negocio y le va bien a pesar de que a veces es escaso el pescado.

Este crédito es para comprar pescado. Lleva seis ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos.
 
Su sueño es que su esposo compre un carro para que realice sus ventas.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the 'María del Carmen' community bank meet in Montecristi canton (Portoviejo).  This is the home of the famous Panama hat.  It is a cold-climate city and there are many natural tourist attractions in the area. 

Here we meet Daysi.  She is 24 years old, married, and has two daughters from this relationship who are 9 and 4 years old.  Her eldest attends school.  Her husband is a salesman.

Daysi is taking out a loan to help her husband with his fish selling business.  Early every morning, he goes to the beach to buy the best fish which he then transports to Montecristi, on a three-wheeled vehicle, to sell.  This allows him to earn enough that his family don't want for anything.  He has been in this business for 13 years and it is doing well in spite of the fact that fish is sometimes scarce.

This loan will be used to buy fish.  Daysi has been a member of her community bank for six loan cycles and she likes it for the help she gets from the loans.  Her dream is for her husband to buy a car for his work.

loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Lay

texts.en:
Mrs. Lay, 64, is in the business of raising pigs. She has been engaged in this business, from which she is able to yield an income of $2.00 per day, since 2004. She has a life partner in her husband, who earns a living by selling the firewood, using animal’s force to haul his firewood-trailer. 

Presently, Mrs. Lay needs some funds in the sum of KHR3,800,000 from HKL and Kiva to purchase an additional buffalo to support her husband’s business. This loan will help her family’s living conditions improve. She wants to expand her pig-raising business in the future. Now she lives with 3 single children and her husband in Baray district.

loans.use: to purchase an additional buffalo to support her husband’s business.

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.es: Wilmer, de 31 años vive en casa de sus padres junto a su pareja Yasmina de 23 años y su pequeña hija Angeli, a quien desea un mejor futuro. Hace 08 meses que Wilmer, empezó a trabajar como conductor para una empresa de taxis. Desde entonces, Wilmer se levanta muy temprano para poder ir a su trabajo, él hace transporte dentro de su localidad. Lo que mas le gusta de trabajo es llevar a la gente y conversar con los pasajeros sobre las experiencias que cada uno de ellos tienen. Con el tiempo desea abrir un cafetín en el colegio para que su pareja pueda trabajar junto a su pequeña hija y así ayudar con los gastos de su familia. Este será su préstamo número 04 con MFP; por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con su objetivo; asimismo se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con el pago de sus cuotas como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. En su banco comunal es una persona responsable y solidario con sus compañeros. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles, invertirá abriendo un cafetín en el colegio de su localidad y comprará productos como: galletas, caramelos, gaseosas, etc.
texts.en:
Wilmer, 31, lives in his parents’ house with his spouse, Yasmina, 23, and his little girl, Angeli, that he wants a better future for.  

Eight months ago Wilmer started working as a driver for a taxi company.  Since then, Wilmer rises very early to go to work; he provides transportation within his location.  What he likes best about his work is moving people and chatting with his passengers about the experiences each one of them has had.  In time, he wants to open a snack bar in a school so that his spouse can work near their little girl and help with household expenses.

This will be MFP loan #4 and he hopes he’ll get your cooperation to reach his goal; he promises to continue making his payments like he’s done with previous loans.  He is a responsible, supportive member of his communal bank.  He will use the 2000 new soles to open a snack bar at his local school.  He will buy merchandise like: cookies, candy, soft-drinks, etc.

loans.use: to buy cookies, candy and soft-drinks.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.fr:
Née le 04 Mars 1975 à Loutana Préfecture de Sikasso, Madame Mariam  est mariée et mère de 7 enfants et réside avec son époux et leurs enfants dans une grande famille traditionnelle à Sanoubougou I Kapel Kourou, un des  quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso.
Après plusieurs activités sans succès, elle s’est initiée depuis plus de dix années à cette activité de petit commerce notamment à l’achat et à la vente d’habillements  de pagnes wax, sacs à main, tissus brodé, etc. Elle achète ses marchandises à Bobo Dioulasso (au Burkina Faso) avant de les revendre à sa place au marché de leur localité où ses marchandises sont beaucoup sollicitées de sa clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes de ménages et  de revendeuses.
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis plus d’une année. Elle a bénéficié deux crédits  tous correctement remboursés.  Ainsi, elle sollicite un troisième crédit pour augmenter son fonds de commerce afin d’acheter,  25 pièces de pagnes wax, 15 complets de tissus brodés et 24 sacs à main. 
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce premier crédit un bénéfice mensuel de 180 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born March 4th, 1975, in Loutana, Sikasso Prefecture, Mariam is married and a mother of seven.  She lives with her husband and their children in a traditional extended family in Sanoubougou I Kapel Kourou, one of the neighborhoods on the outskirts of the city of Sikasso.
Over ten years ago, after several unsuccessful businesses, she started this small-scale business, specifically buying and selling wax print fabric for traditional wrap skirts, handbags, embroidered fabric, etc.  She purchases her merchandise at Bobo Dioulasso (in Burkina Faso) before reselling them at her stall in the market of their town, where her products are highly sought-after by her customers, consisting largely of housekeepers and retail saleswomen.
Over a year ago she decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, in hopes of better satisfying her growing clientele.  She has been able to take advantage of two loans, both of which have been fully paid back.  She is therefore asking for a third loan to increase her business capital in order to purchase 25 lengths of wax print skirt fabric, 15 outfits of embroidered fabric and 24 handbags.  She plans on using this loan to generate a monthly profit of 180,000 CFA francs, which will essentially be used to contribute to family expenses, pay interest on her loan and invest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 40 years old and lives in Olo, Siquijor, Philippines.  She is married and has two school-age children.  Delia sells fish in the market everyday to earn a living.  She earns approximately PHP 2,500 each month doing this type of work.  

She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase fresh catches of fish from fishermen and to deliver them to the market.  Delia has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for six months.  In the future, Delia hopes to have savings for the better education of her children.

loans.use: To purchase fresh catches of fish from fishermen and to deliver them to the market

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is married and has four children ranging from eight and twenty-five years of age. She describes herself as a focused and generous woman. She has been selling maize and beans for the last two years. In addition, she also sells chickens and milk to add to her sources of income. Jane's business challenge is the high cost of maize. She will use the loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more maize. Her dream and hope is buy a center for distributing maize in major towns in the next five years.

loans.use: To buy more  maize to sell.

loans.name: La Nueva Esperanza 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Emilio is one of the members of the group La Nueva Esperanza (New Hope 2 & 3). This group is comprised of micro-entrepreneurs dedicated to selling clothing, natural goods, shoes, working as educators, and other professions. Members work in the city of San Pedro de Macoris, a city famous for its athletes and sugar industry. Emilio is receiving his ninth loan, almost five years after receiving his first. He has successfully invested and repaid his previous loans. Emilio runs a business where he sells miscellaneous items such as shoes, cosmetics, clothing, and other products.

Emilio is planning to use his loan to buy clothing, cosmetics, and shoes. He will save his profits to continue building his house. Emilio enjoys listening to music, and his goal is to faithfully repay his loans to continue investing in his business. His dream is to improve his social condition and to buy a large vehicle, like a truck or a pick-up truck.

loans.use: to buy shoes, cosmetics, clothing, and other items

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.es: Eusebio, tiene 30 años de edad es bachiller, soltero sin hijos trabaja como agricultor y como comerciante de ropa, vendiendo cinco días de cada semana trasladando su mercadería de pueblo en pueblo en su humilde vehículo, como agricultor tiene plantaciones de naranja, mandarina y yuca en su propio terreno agrícola ubicado en sindicato siglo xx, se dedica a la agricultura los otros dos días restantes de la semana aprovecha para mantener y cosechar sus naranjas , mandarina y yuca siempre trabaja solo y no cuenta con la ayuda de nadie para mantener sus plantaciones y cuando estén listos para su comercialización los comercializa siempre en la zona local, el sr. Eusebio desea mejorar sus ingresos económicos para ello necesita la ayuda de este crédito, porque quiere ampliar sus cítricos (naranja y mandarina) para mejorar el nivel de vida que tiene mejorando también su producción y calidad de sus cítricos para así poder quizás formar una familia.
texts.en:
Eusebio, 30, is a high school graduate, single and has no children.  He works as a farmer and also sells clothing.  Five days a week he goes from village to village in his modest vehicle to sell his merchandise.  As a farmer he grows oranges, tangerines and yucca plant on his own farmland which is in the "Siglo XX" trade union area.  On weekends, he takes care of his crops and always works alone, with no one to help maintain the plantations.  When the crops are ready for harvest he sells them in the local area.

Eusebio wants to improve his income and is requesting a loan.  He plans to expand his citrus crop (oranges and tangerines) to improve his lifestyle.  He also wants to improve citrus production and quality, so he can form a family one day.

loans.use: To buy supplies to increase citrus production.

loans.name: Rosemary's Group

texts.en:
Rosemary’s group has six farmers, each of whom is a group leader for several other farmers. They are located in Kakamega North District.  The group leaders in this group represent a total of 52 individual farmers (not pictured). Each of the farmers is asking for an average loan of 5,349 Kenya shillings. Each of them will use his or her loan to purchase a One Acre Fund package, sufficient to cultivate one-quarter acre of maize and one-quarter acre of sorghum or millet.

As the representative of this Kiva group comprised of farmer-leaders, Rosemary is pictured on the right of the group with her hand raised.  Rosemary is a reliable member of the community.  She is married and has two children.  She is 56 years old, and she has been working as a farmer for the past 21 years to support her family.  In addition to this, Rosemary is very active in her community, including involvement in the women's group and savings group.  The 2013 Long Rains season won’t be Rosemary’s first season with One Acre Fund.  She first joined One Acre Fund in 2011.  She has continued working with One Acre Fund, in order to get the best seed prices, to learn new farming methods, and to get fertilizer and hybrid seeds.  She described her harvest last year as "Good."  She hopes to continue working with One Acre Fund and to continue enjoying the success she has been having with the One Acre Fund farm packages. 

As an active member in her community, Rosemary also chose to be a group leader and Kiva representative, because she wants to help more farmers.  Rosemary plans on using future profits from the harvest to send children to school and to save for the future.  She has improved her life by working with One Acre Fund, because she has more farm training and she is able to feed the family. 

Rosemary and her group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers, with the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings along to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

The field officer is included in the photo with the farmer-leaders, and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Hamida's Group

texts.en:
Hamida is a member of this group from Iraq. Hamida is 55 years old widow mother of two . She is one of the many entrepreneur Iraqi women that started their own business to meet the financial needs of their families.
She has twelve years of experience with her sewing business activity. When she heard about Izdiharona's qard hassan product (without interest) for widow women she took a loan to buy iron and sewing machine to increase her products.
She is aiming to develop her business and increase her profits by open big factory and hire jobless women.
They preferred to blur their face for cultural reason.

loans.use: A portion of Hamida's Group's $ 3,000 loan helps a member to buy iron and  sewing machine.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: El señor Santos es casado y tiene 4 hijos, estudio hasta tercer grado pero antes de empezar a estudiar Santos trabajaba con su padre en labores de agricultura. El señor Santos trabaja actualmente en una finca de un señor, trabaja junto con su esposa sembrando granos básicos y ordeñan vacas, dos de sus hijos menores están estudiando los mayores ya trabajan. El señor Santos apoya mucho a sus hijos en los estudios para que sean personas preparadas. Con mucho esfuerzo el señor Santos a ido mejorando poco a poco su casa, pero en la comunidad donde vive no hay luz eléctrica es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de un sistema solar el cual será de gran beneficio para toda la familia. El señor Santos les agradece de antemano por la oportunidad que le puedan brindar en este préstamo para la compra de este sistema solar.

loans.use: Sistema Solar de 65 Watts con 4 luminarias instalado.

loans.name: Kokouvi

texts.en:
Born in 1985, Kokouvi D. finished middle school in Tsévié before entering an apprenticeship because his parent no longer had the money for more schooling. He currently lives in Kpatéfi, where he manages his uncle’s shop selling general grocery items. He is single with no children, and his socio-economic situation is nothing to envy. Mastering his work and having an instinct for management, he would like to be on his own.

To achieve this, he is requesting a loan of $750 for opening a shop and establishing his own business. The loan will allow him to take care of educating his little brothers and to ensure that things improve, particularly the lives of his elderly parents.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Né en 1985, Monsieur D. Kokouvi a fait ses études primaires et secondaires à Tsévié avant d’entrée en apprentissage car les parents n’ont plus de moyens pour lui assurer sa scolarité. Actuellement, il vit à Kpatéfi où il gère une boutique de vente d’alimentation générale d’un oncle. Célibataire sans enfant, sa situation socio économique n’est pas à envier. Maîtrisant ses activités et ayant le sens d’une bonne gestion, il souhaite aujourd’hui mener ses propres affaires.

A cet effet, il sollicite un crédit de $750 qui va lui permettre d’ouvrir une boutique et s’installer à son propre compte. Ce qui permettre de s’occuper de la formation de ses jeunes frères et d’assurer de l’amélioration des conditions surtout de ses parents en âge avancé.

loans.use: To open his own shop

loans.name: Wartisem

texts.en: W. is a 45-year-old mother with one child, aged 20. She has been selling cooked foods in a small restaurant for 20 years. She usually earns $10 per day. She opens her small restaurant from 5pm – 2am everyday. Her husband, Dakir, is a fisherman. He sells fish in the fish market, earning $2 per day. She is a member of MBK and requests a $50 loan to expand her business. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Small Restaurant

loans.name: Kayi

texts.en:
Born in 1971 in Aklakou, Mrs A. Kayi is married and the mother of four children. She is also responsible for two grand-children. Her daily activity is the sale of peanuts and also cereals. Nicknamed "Mother AZITO", Mrs Kayi started her business from her small peanut field. With 12 years of experience in this area, "Mother AZITO" knows her business well. She is asking for a loan of $1,000 to be able to buy peanuts from other growers and resell them. The profits will allow her to provide for the numerous and increasing needs of her family.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1971 à Aklakou, Madame A. Kayi est mariée et mère de quatre enfants. Elle compte aujourd’hui à sa charge, outre ses enfants, deux petits fils. La vente de céréales et surtout d’arachide est son activité quotidienne. Surnommé « Maman AZITO », Mme Kayi a commencé son commerce à partir de son petit champ d’arachide. Douze ans déjà dans cette activité « Maman AZITO » cerne tous les rouages du commerce. Elle sollicite un crédit de $1000 pour pouvoir aller dans les zones de production d’arachide, en acheter et venir les revendre. Les bénéfices lui permettront de subvenir aux nombreux besoins qui ne cessent de s’alourdir dans la famille.

loans.use: puchase, storage and resale of peanuts

loans.name: Ahou

texts.en:
K. Ahou E. is a dynamic 30-year-old woman. She lives in Port-Bouët, a township in the southern area of Abidjan. E. is a tailor and she has been working for herself for more than 6 years. She operates in the Port-Bouët open market where she makes children's garments.

E. wants to acquire electric sewing machine and purchase a stock of textiles to make school uniforms for September and October. E. joined the AE&I microcredit program in June, 2006 and has benefited from a micro-loan that she reimbursed in good manner. E. is well organized and ambitious.

loans.use: Konan Ahou Eugenie will use the loan  acquire an electric sewing machine

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
Betty Adriazola, is separated and has 2 children. She is a part of the association Wara de Villa Tejada in the city of El Alto. Her main activity is the sales of every day grocery items in the zone of La Ceja in El Alto. Generally she sells by request, to people she knows and trusts, to whom she sells on credit and afterwards charges a small amount of interest.

Betty started with Pro Mujer, requesting a small credit that enabled her to buy a few grocery items in this way, and generate resources by selling them. At this time, she will use the capital to increase her merchandise, taking advantage of wholesale prices which are definitely the most profitable with sales.

Betty A., separada y madre de dos hijos, pertenece a la asociación Wara de Villa Tejada en El Alto, su principal actividad es la venta y comercialización de víveres en la zona de la Ceja de El Alto, generalmente ella trabaja a pedido, entre aquellas personas ya conocidas y de confianza, a quienes vende al crédito y posteriormente cobra con un pequeño interés. Betty se inició con Pro Mujer, solicitando un crédito pequeño que le permitió la compra de algunos víveres y de esta manera generar recursos tras la venta de los mismos. Actualmente, Betty se precisa de capital para poder incrementar su mercadería, principalmente aprovechar la compra al por mayor, que definitivamente es más rentable al momento de la venta. CREDITO : $1500

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: To buy more merchandise and take advantage of wholesale prices.

loans.name: Silva

texts.pt:
Silva U. was born in the province of Sanga in Niassa, on January 30th 1967. He supports a family of 5. He was raised by his family with his twin brother. When he was 14 years old left home to join the military. He received a scholarship to go to Hungary where he finished High School and studied Economy and management. Years later he returned and started working for CMGM. He was introduced to lhuvuku by friends.

He joined the credit program hoping to improve his home. Silva works at CMGM and pays for the schooling of his children, supports his family and pays for the construction of the house. With the loan of 60.000mt, he plans on finishing the wall and painting the home In the future he wants to request another loan to pay for his twin brother’s wedding.

Translated from Portuguese Mariana Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Localizaçao: Maputo matola texlom Actividade: Habitaçao Valor empréstimo: 60.000,00MTN Aplicação do empréstimo: Compra de material de construçao Início: 06-11-07 Fim:28-02-09 Silva U., nascido em Sanga Provincia de Niassa a 40 anos aos 30 de Janeiro de 1967, sustenta 5 pessoas e reside na casa propria que adquiriu em 2002. Cresceu e viveu num ambiente familiar onde tina 10 irmaos e sendo ele gémeo. Quando tinha 14 anos separa-se da familia para cumprir o serviço militar obrigatório a vida foi dificil nos primeiros dias mas porque o estado organizava-se, sensibilizava e encorajava os novos soldados em prol da defesa do país, acabou se adaptando e é assim que o tempo foi passando. Teve uma bolsa de estudos para hungria onde ,prosseguiu com os estudos fez o ensino médio e depois licenciou-se em economia e gestao.

Anos mais tarde voltou ao pais e foi afecto no CMGM como gestor administrativo . ate que um dia ouviu falar da lhuvuku através de colegas seus que trabalhavam numa escola de fuzileiros navais. Decidiu também procurar a instituição e solicitar um emprestimo para melhorar a sua casa. Assim durante a sua actividade não tem tido dificuldades porque esta la a esposa a velar por tudo que lhes diz respeito, assim como tem controlado a obra e dar o relatório diariamente ao seu esposo porque este sai de muito cedo de casa e volta bastante tarde devido aos estudos no perodio pós laboral. Actualmente para além de trabalhar no C.M.G.M, faz assinatura de contas em varia instituições e que com o salario consegue pagar os seus estudos ,escola dos filhos e manter a casa assim como poupar para a obra.. Com o empréstimo de 60.000,00 ( secenta mil meticais)pretende concluir o murro e fazer a pintura de casa. A sua perspectiva futura e terminar o crédito e fazer um outro empréstimo para fazer um casamento comum com o seu irmão gémeo.

loans.use: to buy construction material to finish up his house

loans.name: Mamur

texts.en: Mamur R. lives in Mastchoh. Mamur R. has been a client of MicroInvest since 2007 and he recommends himself as a serious and strongly-motivated client. His loan sums are permanently increased which shows his business's stability and his income increase. He has the wide-side business including livestock raising and selling, milk production and work out. He dreams of purchasing a horn pedigree bull and a milk cow for further meat and milk and sour-milk goods production (its supply to the bazaars and his family is secure by the milk and sour products). He plans to include in the assortment the following milk and sour products: pasteurized milk, sour milk, sour cream, curd and etc. Now he requires a loan in 1600 STJ for a horn pedigree bull and a pedigree milk cow which will allow him to significantly increase his family's income and will also permits him to plan further business and a wider assortment of milk goods.

loans.use: Mamur would like to purchase a horn pedigree bull and a pedigree milk cow.

loans.name: Suon

texts.en: Mrs. Suon I., 42, works wI. her husband on a piece of land growing various kinds of vegetables, such as tomatoes, cucumber, chili, radish, and lettuce. WI. this business, the couple can collectively earn around $3 each day from selling their output to market. Additionally, this couple has six children. One of them is employed in a factory; three are construction workers and the rest are married and stay separately. Mrs. Suon I. hopes to use this loan to purchase another piece of farmland to enable her to expand a number of her crops.Her current farmland is quite narrow so it’s so hard to grow more crops to meet her client's demand.

loans.use: To purchase another piece of farmland to expand her crops.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia D. D. T. has a general store in the town of Jepelacio, San Martin. She started the store in 1988 as an investment to help her family. Amelia is friendly, charismatic, and loves to work. The store is now the largest in Jepelacio. She sells a large variety of goods, ranging from baby products, medicines, clothes, and school supplies.

Amelia is 60 years old, happily married, and has 4 children. All of her children are adults so she now focuses on helping her grandchildren as much as possible. Amelia is so happy and proud she started her business and what she has accomplished. Over the years, she has maD. many friends and now has a voice in her community.

A member of the community bank Mujeres Responsables, Amelia is requesting a loan of $625 (s/1800) to repay over 4 months. With the loan, she would like to stock her store with school uniforms and school supplies as the new school year begins soon.

loans.use: She would like to stock her store with school uniforms and school supplies.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence I. is from Edo State, Nigeria, and she is married with 6 children. She is 40 years old. She sews and sells clothes. She has been in business since 1993. She needs the loan amount of $875 to buy clothing materials for sale.

loans.use: To buy clothing materials for sale

loans.name: Barrio El Calvario Ii Group

texts.es:
Within this communal bank, one can find determined women with the entrepreneurial spirit very typical of businesswomen from the coast of Guatemala. All of the women belonging to this bank have a least two businesses.

They invest the money borrowed in different economic ventures like breeding bulls and pigs and selling chicken, vegetables, baked goods and other foods. The also sell firewood, cosmetics and heliconia leaves (used to make tamales).

It was impressive to see the entire group of women so decided about how they would be using the money that they were borrowing. Norma M. commented that she was going to use a part of her loan to sell cosmetics while the other part would be invested in fruit to sell in the market. Juana S. said that as soon as she received her loan, she was going to purchase 300 kg of chicken to sell in the market. María P., like the large majority of the group, was going to buy 150 bunches of heliconia leaves to then sell to distributors. While the women sell one bunch of leaves for seven quetzals, a distributor can sell in the cities for double the price. María P. was going to invest her money in her tortilla business and in the purchase of firewood.

When asked why they like to work with Friendship Bridge, the women said that it was primarily because it gives them a chance to save money. The inability to save is one of the reasons people can’t get out of poverty. Additionally, they said that the low interest and the timeframe the institution offered for repaying the loans help them with their businesses. Also, working under the bank’s methodology is something they like very much.

The women believe that within the Barrio El Calvario Communal Bank they are all equal. Not only that, but there is a lot of communication and understanding within the communal bank. It seems that working with Friendship Bridge has changed their lives. They are very grateful to the institution and to those who invest in them through Kiva because people have believed in them. They are sure that they will not let us down. That’s why helping this and many other groups of women is important, because one gives them a chance and a ray of hope.

Translated form Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

Dentro de este banco comunal uno puede encontrar mujeres corajudas y con una visión empresarial muy característica de las empresarias de la costa de Guatemala. Todas las clientas dentro de este banco tienen dos negocios como mínimo.

Ellas invierten su crédito en distintas actividades económicas, tales como la crianza de toros y cerdos, venta de pollo, venta de comidas, venta de verduras, venta de leña, venta ambulante de cosméticos, panadería y la venta de hojas de mashan (las cuales son usadas para envolver los tamales).

Fue impresionante ver a todo un grupo de mujeres tan decididas en que utilizar el préstamos que se les iba a otorgar. Norma M., comentó que ella iba a usar parte de su préstamo para la venta de cosméticos que los iba a vender de manera ambulante, mientras que la otra parte la iba a invertir en la compra de fruta para venderla en el mercado. Juana S., dijo que a penas recibía su préstamo lo iba a invertir en la compra de tres quintales de pollos destazados para su venta en el mercado. María P., como la gran mayoría del grupo, iba a comprar 150 racimos de hojas de mashan para luego venderlo a los intermediaros. Ellas venden un racimo a siete quetzales, mientras que un intermediario puede llegar a venderlo en las ciudades por el doble del precio. María P., va a invertir su crédito en su tortilleria y en la compra de leña.

Cuando se les pregunto porque les gusta trabajar con Friendship Bridge ellas comentaron que era primordialmente porque les daba un espacio para ahorrar. La falta de capacidad de ahorrar es uno de los motivos por los cuales las personas no pueden salir de la pobreza. Adicionalmente, dijeron que los bajos intereses y el plazo que les ofrecía la institución las ayudaba con su negocio. También, trabajar bajo metodología de bancos comunales les gusta mucho.

Las señoras opinan que dentro del banco comunal Barrio el Calvario todas son iguales. No solo eso, sino que hay mucha comunicación y comprensión dentro del banco comunal. Al parecer trabajar con Friendship Bridge les ha cambiado la vida. Ellas agradecen mucho a la institución y a las personas que invierten en ellas desde Kiva por que confiaron en ellas y están seguras de no nos van a defraudar. Es por eso que seguir apoyando a este y a muchos gruP. de mujeres es importante, ya que uno les da un respiro y una luz de esperanza.

loans.use: Breeding bulls and pigs; sale of chicken, vegetables, baked goods and other foods; sale of firewood, cosmetics and heliconia leaves

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas O. is 40 years old, married with 5 children. She sells local gin and palm oil. She hails from Edo State, Nigeria and needs a loan $350 to buy more palm oil to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more oil and local gin to sell

loans.name: Ema Laufiso's Group

texts.en:
The seven members of this group from Savaii work in their different farming businesses. They are one of SPBD's new groups and they attend their weekly meetings and save both in their individual passbooks and in their group savings account. They are looking forward to their next loan for their children's school fees and for home improvements.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural equipment and supplies.

loans.name: Roldan

texts.es:
The sale of churros is the daily activity of señor Roldan who works hard and smoothly to get ahead. He gets up very early to prepare and sell his sweets. Roldan is a very determined man, but above all kind and jovial with is customers. At 43 years of age, he is the father of 5 children with three of them who are already independent and taking care of the last two. They study and are the motivation for don Roldan to continue growing to provide them with what is necessary for them to be decent men. His wife, señora Enith, also works independently and supports him in his decisions. Roldan wants to prepare a place to give his clients attention that could have a mat or branch roof that will protect them from the weather. Then he also wants to enlarge his business and later he would like to buy another cart to make the sweets and that way generate work for those who need it since it is a dessert that is in great demand in his zone. However, to make this father's goal a reality, he needs an amount of money that he is asking you for as a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

La venta de churros es la actividad diaria que tiene el señor Roldan, quien trabaja duro y parejo por seguir adelante. Se levanta muy temprano para preparar y vender su dulce. Roldan es un hombre muy decidido, sobre todo amable y jovial con sus clientes. A sus 43 años es padre de 5 hijos, siendo tres de ellos ya independientes, quedando los dos últimos a su cargo, ellos estudian y son el motivo de don Roldan de seguir surgiendo para brindarles lo necesario para que logren ser hombres de bien, su esposa la señora Enith quien trabaja independientemente lo apoya en sus decisiones.Roldan quiere acondicionar un lugar para la atención a sus clientes, que pueda contar con techo de estera o ramas que los proteja del clima, desde luego también desea crecer en su negocio ya que posteriormente quiere comprarse otro carrito para la elaboración de este dulce y así generar trabajo a quien lo necesite ya que es un postre que tiene mucha acogida en su zona, sin embargo para hacer realidad el objetivo de este padre necesita de una cantidad de dinero, que es la que solicita en préstamo a ustedes.

loans.use: Acquire a place for his clients to stay while they consume his product and a new cart in which to make the sweets that he sells.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.fr:
Mrs. Jacqueline A. was born on 2 October 1962 in Cotonou. Divorced, she is the mother of two children, both educated. Mrs. Jacqueline A. has been selling ready-to-eat meals at the Cotonou hall of arts and culture since 1 January 2008. She has 15 years of experience in the sale of food. She sells rice, beans, boiled maize flour paste, and cooked yams. She is asking for this loan with the hope of better satisfying her customers, composed mostly of visitors to the hall of arts.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Dame A. Jacqueline est née le 02 Octobre 1962 à Cotonou. Divorcée, elle est mère de deux enfants tous scolarisés. Dame A. Jacqueline vend du repas prêt à manger au hall des arts et de la culture de Cotnou depuis le 01 Janvier 2008. Elle a 15 ans d'expérience dans la vente de nourriture. Elle vend du riz, du haricot, de la pâte de farine de maïs bouillie et d'igname cuite. Elle sollicite ce prêt dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle composée pour sa majorité des visiteurs de hall des arts.

loans.use: To buy one 25 kg bag of rice, 25 kg of beans, and various condiments

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr: Abra A. tient depuis 3 ans une boutique d’alimentation générale à Kpalimé, une ville située à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Elle est âgée de 55 ans, mariée e mère de 5 enfants. Elle espère par ce crédit approvisionner sa boutique en achetant des sacs de riz, des cartons de sucres, de laits et autres boîtes de conserves. Cet approvisionnement va entraîner une augmentation des ventes et par conséquent une hausse des gain ; ce qui lui permettra de bien subvenir aux besoins de la famille
texts.en:
For three years, Abra A. has been tending a general store in Kpalimé, a town located about 120 km from Lomé, the capital of Togo. She is 55, married, and the mother of 5 children. She hopes to use this loan to replenish the inventory of her store by buying sacks of rice, cases of sugar, milk, and other tinned foods. This improved range of goods will lead to increased sales and thus, an increased profit, which will allow her to better support her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of sacks of rice, cases of sugar, milk, and other tinned goods

loans.name: Aqil

texts.en:
Aqil H. is only 20 but he already owns of a small business. His primary activity and only source of income is selling foodstuff like pastries, cookies, candies, condensed milk, tea, caned meat, mayonnaise, soft drinks, and other items in a store that he rents. Aqil started his business in the beginning of 2008 and now his business going very well. Because of his personality and easy-going character, he has gained the respect of a wide variety of clients. He is very polite and his store is very popular with local residents, whose patronage allows him to earn a good income for his family. Aqil covers the needs of his old parents who are on a pension and his brothers and sisters, who are students. 

Aqil has applied for a loan of $1000 USD and will use the loan to buy more items to sell. This will allow him to earn more and meet the needs of his family.  Aqil thanks you for your support and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell

loans.name: Roselyn
