texts.en: Roselyn, who bakes snacks such as egg rolls, meat pies, and fish rolls in her house, is 45 years old and married with five children. Very determined to eradicate her family’s poverty and increase the prosperity of her business, Roselyn is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of flour, vegetable oil and one oven so that she can continue to develop her enterprise and meet customer demand. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders and LAPO MICROFINANCE.

loans.use: To buy flour, vegetable oil and one oven for her business

loans.name: Luisa Amanda

texts.es: La Sr. Luisa de 43 años de edad, casada,  habita en reparto España un barrio de la capital de Managua, su esposo trabaja vendiendo autos usado. Doña Luisa tiene 4 años de vender fritanga por la noche, alquila teléfono y ofrecer clases de danzas a niños y adultos. Siendo una forma más de generar ayuda económica para su casa y así cubrir las necesidades. Inicio su negocio con lo que ganaba como profesora de danza en su casa de habitación. Sus planes son aumentar sus ventas de fritangas con nueva variedad de comida para vender. Agracia a los prestamos de Afodenic lograra comprar en mayores cantidades y  eso le generar mayor ganancia. Dándole un mejor futuro a su familia.
texts.en:
Luisa is 43 years old, married, and lives in Reparto España, a neighborhood in the capital of Managua. Her husband sells used cars. For four years, Luisa has sold fried snacks at night, rented telephones, and offered dance classes to children and adults. This has been a way to generate financial support for her household and cover the necessities. She started her business with the money she earned as a dance instructor in her home. Her plans are to increase her sales of fried snacks by selling a new type of food. Thanks to the Afodenic loans she will be able to buy in larger quantities, and this will generate greater profits for her, providing a better future for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy meats and products to sell

loans.name: Chadulu H Group

texts.en:
Enitha has been a vegetable and charcoal seller in the Ipagala neighborhood of Dodoma for one year. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more inventory to grow her business and pay school fees for her children.

Enitha is 40 years old and married with six children who are between the ages 7 and 27. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members Evodia, Lucy, Salma, and Verian. Each woman also has her own small business in Dodoma.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell in her business.

loans.name: Primary School In Makeni Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of a Primary School in Makeni. It was founded in 1974. Today, it has a total of 750 pupils with a staff of twenty-three teachers. Since its inception in 1974, the school has produced many of the professionals in town and the country at large.

This Primary School continues to prove itself in both the academic arena and in sport. Ninety-eight percent of the pupils they sent last academic year for the National Primary School Exams (NPSE) had clear passes. This academic year, they expect to have a 100% passes at the NPSE.

This is the first loan the school is seeking from SMT.  With this loan, they will be able to invest in some petty-trading in order to supplement their monthly salaries. Some however will use theirs to either buy pieces of furniture or in constructing houses. This loan will definitely improve the economic status of these teachers. 

John B. C. (left) is the head teacher of this school. Mr. C. was born in Kamalo village, about forty-seven miles from Makeni. He is fifty-five years of age, married with six children between the ages of two and thirty-four. John is currently building a second home for himself.  He will use his loan to buy building materials to continue with the building process. This house will consist of three bedrooms, a parlor, a store and a toilet. Once he is finished building it, it will be an estimated value of Le 10,000,000 – Le 11,000,000 (approx. US$ 3000 – US$ 3600).

loans.use: Buy building materials

loans.name: Yandaa

texts.en: Yandaa B. is a 70-year-old woman who lives with her daughter, daughter-in-law and granddaughter. She has been receiving her pension for the last 15 years; in addition, she runs her little business, as her pension is enough only to just scrape by and she doesn't want to ask her children for money. She rents a stall for clothing sales at the local market, specifically selling children's clothes for newborns. She has a total of four children. One of her children who lives with her helps her to buy clothes from a wholesale market. Yandaa's repeat clients are mostly mothers who just gave birth. (It is a Mongolian superstition not to buy anything for an unborn child). She is one of XacBank's repeat borrowers who has a very good credit history. She told XacBank's credit officer: "I don't want to be a trouble for my children; therefore, I'll keep my little business as long as I can."

loans.use: To buy clothes for newborns for her clothing sales

loans.name: Kann

texts.en: Kann T., 44, is married and resides with her husband in the Siem Reap province. Since 1999 she has been selling wood to earn a living. She is able to earn about US$2 per day. Her husband works as a farmer growing rice. He plants rice two times a year and makes US$10 per day. Mrs. Kann T. would like to take out a loan to purchase a grinding mill which she can rent to the local farmers and increase her profit.

loans.use: To purchase grinding mill.

loans.name: Lubajja Traders (C) Group

texts.en:
Huruna has been in the business of supplying coffee beans to factories in Mityana for about 10 years. He sells the beans from his 10-acre operation as well as coffee that he gathers from smaller operations. From his 10 acres, he is usually able to get two sacs of coffee per week.

Getting the coffee ready to sell is a time-consuming and laborious process. After picking the coffee pods, he lays them in the sun to dry. After they are dry, Huruna must crack open the individual pods and extract the coffee beans. Then he must pack these beans into large sacs and transport them to the factories to sell them.

Huruna has eight children ranging from 6 to 16 years old. They are all in school, so he and his wife have to search for ways to manage the large task of providing school fees for all of them. All of his children attend private schools. This is a sign that his business is making a difference in his family.

Huruna is requesting a loan of 2 million USH (UGX) to purchase sacs of coffee to resell. He says that if his business takes off, he would like to build some houses to rent to people in his community. His biggest dream is to travel around the world.

loans.use: To purchase sacs of coffee to resell

loans.name: Hatuyumbi Group

texts.en:
Mosi is a tailor and owns a small clothes shop in the Darajabovu neighborhood of Zanzibar. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $55. Every day she works at her business for 12 hours.

She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes for her shop. She is hoping that, through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business, improve her home and pay school fees for her children.

Mosi is 27 years old, divorced, and has two children: aged 8 and 6.

Mosi will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Suma and Amina. Each woman also has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her shop

loans.name: Ngozi

texts.en: Ngozi is 37 years old and married with no children. She sells shoes and clothes. She has been in this business for  the past four years. Ngozi hopes for a loan of  N50,000 to purchase more clothes and shoes to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny lives in the village of Barangay Natappian West Solana, Cagayan. Her husband works as a simple farmer. While free from farming duties, Jenny operates their old “kalesa” transport business that still exists in Solana, Cagayan. A “kalesa” is a cart which is pulled by a horse. Its use dates back to the Spanish regime in the Philippines. Jenny says that the “kalesa” is helpful to their daily living. It does not require the expense of gasoline, which is also a great contribution to the environment. She further said that this type of transportation will last for a long time and is something they can rely on.

She is asking for a loan of PHP 13,000 for business necessities such as improvement of the cart used in their transportation business. The cart they use is old and is in need of repair in order to give their passenger comfort as they ride. Jenny is 24 years old and soon will have a child to support with its education and basic needs.

loans.use: Business improvement

loans.name: Ever

texts.es:
El señor Ever M. G. vive en casa en alquiler, en la zona  de Llojeta, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz.
El señor Ever es constructor, realizando trabajos en construcciones particulares con los que se mantiene.
Sus ingresos no son muy buenos y el pago de alquileres mensuales hace que no pueda ahorrar. 
El crédito solicitado es para la adquisición de un anticretico de una habitación, que le permitirá pagar menos que el alquiler mensualmente y que al cabo de un año tenga ahorrado el monto del anticretico.
Esta es la primera vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Ever M. G. lives in a rented home in the Llojeta zone on the east hillside of the city of La Paz. Ever is a construction worker and supports himself by working on particular construction jobs. He does not earn a lot and his monthly rent payments make it so that he cannot save. The loan that he is requesting it to acquire a room on anticredito (a system by which the tenant pays a fixed sum considered a loan to the property owner which they receive back in full when the rental period is over); this will allow him to pay less than the monthly rent and after a year he will have saved the anticredito amount. This is the first time that he has made a loan request and because he has favorably met the financial analysis criteria he has been approved for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The loan will be used to acquire a room on anticredito, which will allow him to not have to pay rent and to be able to save.

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
La señora Guillermina G. S. tiene 72 años, vive en el distrito del Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella no estudió, no tiene  hijos que dependen económicamente de ella.
Guillermina se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y cerveza en su bodega, cuando inicio con Manuela Ramos ya tenía su negocio, los productos los obtiene de un mercado del distrito y las bebidas son abastecidas directamente por la empresa que las elabora, su negocio lo desarrolla en su mismo domicilio.
El primer crédito que recibió fue de S/. 300 soles, el cual invirtió en la compra de productos como galletas, gaseosas y cervezas.
Este crédito de 800 soles, lo invertirá en la compra de cervezas y otros productos como galletas, gaseosas, arroz, azúcar.
Guillermina  tiene como sueño continuar con su bodega e implementar mas y trabajar conjuntamente con su esposo para  crecer como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Guillermina G. S. is 72 years old and lives in the District of Porvenir in Trujillo Province, in the La Libertad region of Peru. She never went to school and doesn’t have any dependent children.
Guillermina sells groceries and beer from her general store. She had already set up her business when she started working with Manuela Ramos. She gets her products from the district market and obtains the drinks directly from the company that makes them. She runs her business in her home.
The first loan she received totalled 300 PEN and she used it to purchase products like biscuits, soft drinks, rice and sugar. She will use this 800 PEN loan to purchase beer and other products like biscuits, soft drinks, rice and sugar.
Guillermina dreams of maintaining her business, increasing her stock and working together with her husband to grow as a microentrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beer and other products like biscuits, soft drinks, rice and sugar

loans.name: Gissel Del Carmen

texts.es: Gissel del Carmen S. Martínez tiene 29 años de edad. Es madre soltera. Tiene 1 hijo a su cargo. Gissel tiene 6 años de dedicarse a este negocio. Su actividad económica es la venta de cosméticos. Ella es una joven muy activa y dinámica, le gusta mucho su trabajo gracias a una amiga que le enseñaron lo esencial con esta actividad, fue que ella se instruyó para mantener su negocio y salir adelante, todos los días por la mañana elle recorre los diferentes lugares que tiene que visitar para ofrecer sus productos. Por lo que tiene que estar por la tarde, ya que tiene que pasar por su hijo en la escuela. El destino del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de cremas, perfumes, desodorantes y pinturas de uñas. El sueño de ella ha sido establecer una tienda en la que ofrezca una variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Gissel del Carmen S. Martínez is 29 years old. She is a single mother. She has 1 child under her care. Gissel has dedicated herself to this business for 6 years. Her business is in the sale of cosmetics. She is a very active and dynamic young woman, and she enjoys her work very much. Thanks to a friend that taught her what was essential in this business, she was able to teach herself to manage this business and get ahead. Every day in the morning she travels to different places that she has scheduled to visit to sell her products. She has to be back in the afternoon, given that she has to pick up her son from school. The loan will be used as work capital to purchase creams, perfumes, deodorants, and nail polishes. Her dream has been to establish a store in which she can offer a variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital (to purchase creams, perfumes, deodorants, and nail polishes).

loans.name: El Guanacaste Group

texts.es:
El grupo Guanacaste está integrado por Roxana Judith P. Flores, Jaqueline Marveli L. y Eloisa M., ellas viven en la comarca Guanacastillo y pertenecen a la Iglesia Menomita la que les ayudado a poder construir sus humildes casas.

Este es el primer préstamo para este grupo conformado por mujeres emprendedoras, trabajadoras y capaces de salir adelante tan solo las detiene la falta de capital para poder invertir en sus negocios.

La coordinadora del grupo es la joven Roxana P. de 20 años de edad. Esta muchacha comenzó hace dos años  vendiendo ropa para adulto y niños en pequeñas cantidades pero actualmente tiene mayor demanda que no puede solventare por la falta de dinero para reinvertir. 

Las otras integrantes del grupo son  Jaqueline L. de 21 años de edad quien trabaja vendiendo ropa para adultos por pedidos  como  camisetas, pantalones, blusas y ropa interior a un precio favorable. Mientras Eloisa M. de 43 años de edad tiene una pulpería donde vende todo tipos de producto para la canasta básica de los pobladores.
texts.en:
The Guanacaste group consists of Roxana Judith P. Flores, Jaqueline Marveli L. and Eloisa M.. They live in the Guanacastillo region and belong to the Mennonite Church which has helped them build their humble homes. This is the first loan for this group of hard-working, entrepreneurial women who are capable of being successful but they are lacking the capital to be able to invest in their businesses. The coordinator of the group is 20 year old Roxana Picada. Two years ago she began selling adult and children’s clothing in small quantities but today she has high demand and she can’t meet it because she lacks money to reinvest in her business. The other members of the group are 21 year old Jaqueline L. who works selling adult clothing by order such as tshirts, pants, blouses, and underwear at a favorable price. 43 year old Eloisa M. has a convenience store where she sells all kinds of products to meet the basic needs of the community members.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a variety of shirts, blouses and pants

loans.name: Chaker

texts.en:
Chaker is a 44 year old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Chaker has been working as a carpenter for nine years. Chaker requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a new tool for his work. This is the first time that Chaker has requested a loan.
Chaker is special in his work because he does it well. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t have a lot of cash. Chaker decided on doing his business because of his experience since he learned when he was young. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase a new tool for his work.

loans.name: Louise

texts.fr: Louise P. est une femme de 67ans, veuve et mère de 3 enfants. Elle fait de l’embauche porcine qu’elle aimerait développer. Son objectif est d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Louise P. is a 67 year old woman who is a widow and the mother of 3 children. She would like to develop her business fattening pigs. Her goal is to improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fattening pigs

loans.name: Seang

texts.en: Seang R., 51, is married and lives with four of her children in the Phnom Penh. To earn a living, she has been selling food and beverages from home. She typically makes about US$15 per day, while her husband works in Ministry of land, making US$1.5 a day. One of the children is a construction worker and makes US$5 every day. Seang R. would like to take out a loan of US$1000 to reinvest in her businesses. She will purchase more chairs and tables.

loans.use: To purchase more chairs and tables.

loans.name: Assiongbon

texts.fr: Ce monsieur a appris le métier de couture ; il a ouvert dans le quartier de Baguida à Lomé son atelier de couture. Depuis un certain temps, son atelier ne reçoit plus de clients comme par le passé ; c’est pour cette raison qu’il a acheté en 2006 une moto pour faire taxi ; il conduit lui-même son taxi-moto et confie la gestion de son atelier à un apprenti tailleur expérimenté. Grâce à cette nouvelle activité bien rentable pour lui, il a ouvert une petite cabine de téléphone cellulaire dans son atelier. Avec ces deux activités, il arrive à s’en sortir. Il voudrait avoir un crédit de WAGES pour acheter des cartes de recharge pour sa cabine cellulaire ; le reste du prêt servira à réparer son taxi moto tombé en panne. Il est marié et a un enfant à sa charge.
texts.en:
This man learned the sewing trade. He opened his own sewing workshop in the neighborhood of Baguida in Lomé. For a while, his store has not received customers from foot-traffic. It is for this reason that in 2006 he purchased a motorcycle to use as a taxi. He drives the moto-taxi himself and has given the management of his workshop over to an experienced tailor's apprentice. Thanks to the profitability of this new business, he opened a small cellular telephone booth in his workshop. With these two businesses, he is able to properly handle his finances. He would like a credit from the micro-finance group WAGES to purchase cell-phone credit re-fill cards; he will use the remainder of the loan for repairs of his moto-taxi. He is married and has on child in his care.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase phone credit refill cards and to repair his moto-taxi.

loans.name: Saidat

texts.en:
Saidat is a 27 year old woman who is married with three children. She resides and owns a four room house where she is staying with four people. She takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity but, unfortunately, no running water.  

Saidat owns a stall selling second hand clothing. She works in Owino Market, one of the busiest markets in Kampala. On average she receives 10 customers a day. She has been in this business for seven years and with MCDT for seven years; she is currently on her fourteenth loan, working with the same group mates. Her monthly expenses include school fees and medication. Her challenges include defaulters and the rainy season because when it rains very few customers come to her stall since it is in a muddy place. Saidat wants to use this loan to buy more second hand clothes. She aspires to expand her business and eventually sell only wholesale.

loans.use: purchasing more second hand clothes

loans.name: Fatima Ii Group

texts.es: El grupo “Fátima II” esta representado por la señora  Elsa y conformado por 15 miembros los cuales realizan diferentes actividades para el sustento D. sus familias como la venta D. artículos D. la canasta familiar en pequeñas pulperías, venta  D. comida al paso, refrigerios,  servicio  D. moto taxi, venta D. cosméticos  y el servicio mecánico. Dentro del ámbito comercial y D. servicios el nivel competitivo es alto en especial para los socios que tienen poca mercadería  y no pueden competir con las grandes tiendas  que pueden abaratar sus costos y seguir en la competencia, pero las socias tienen mucha experiencia y ganas D. trabajar con el incentivo D. sacar adelante a sus familias que es el impulso para salir adelante. El destino del préstamo es para incrementar su mercadería así como la compra D. insumos y materiales que ayuden a obtener un mejor capital D. trabajo para hacer frente a la competencia. En cuanto a la experiencia las socias van cursando su primer ciclo por lo que no tienen mucha experiencia en grupos solidarios pero tienen muchos deseos D. crecer y este deseo les impulsa a seguir adelante para brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
The “Fátima II” Group is represented by Elsa and is comprised of 15 members who support their families in different ways such as selling basic foods at small local stores, selling street food, selling snacks, moto-taxi [motorcycle with attached cab for passengers] service, cosmetics sales, and mechanic service. In the world of commerce and services there is a high level of competition, especially for those who don't have much merchandise and can't compete with the large stores that can reduce their costs and stay competitive. But the members of the “Fátima II” Group have a great desire to work, with the incentive of providing for their families which is their motive for trying to get ahead. This loan is to be used to increase their merchandise supply as well as to buy food and materials that will help them get better working capital in order to take on the competition. As far as experience, the members are going through their first cycle, so don't have much experience in community banks, but they have many hopes of growing and this is what drives them to keep going forward to proviD. their families with the best quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Shimmin, KI. Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Abiola

texts.en:
Abiola is 40 years old and married with two children. She lives in Ogbomoso, Oyo State, Nigeria. Abiola sells foodstuffs and also has a grinding machine. With the profits from these combined businesses, she hopes to meet the needs of her family. She has been in business for a long time.
Abiola has been with Kiva partner LAPO for two years. She is now requesting a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita S. is from the town of Gamu. She is 58 years old. Pacita is married and has 12 adult children. To make a living, Pacita owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting vegetables for sale. Pacita has been engaged in her business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Pacita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pacita is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure, and young crops to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure and young crops to raise

loans.name: Mary Joy's Group

texts.en:
Mary Joy A. is from the village of Brgy. Tuao North, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 23 years old. Mary Joy is the group leader for a seven-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or default.

Mary Joy is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Mary Joy owns and operates a business making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from preparing and selling pork and chicken barbeque. Mary Joy has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.


In 2008, Mary Joy joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Joy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from ASKI. This loan was used to to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Mary Joy is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand the range of products offered. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Mary Joy from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 


ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. 


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand the range of products offered

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Mr. Sophal T., 36, is a horse cart driver, and has been married to Mrs. Bunna Nao, 30, since 1994. They are living on an island on the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. His wife sells fish in the local market. 

The house where they stay is old and breaks down. It’s difficult for them to live there. Sophal is asking for his first loan of $600 to add to his own money to build a new house.

loans.use: To add to his own money to build new house.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita M., is already 64 years old but still works on her farm to earn an income. She grows rice. Her husband also tills the farm. Both of them are happy working together because the income they make in their rice farm will pay for the needs of their children, though most of them are already married.

Rosita would like to ask for a loan of Php 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies and fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and farm supplies

loans.name: H.g.

texts.en:
M. is a 24-year-old woman living with her husband along with their only child. Her husband has a small masonry goods supply business and M. helps him in his work.

They want to expand their business as their family size is getting bigger now. They need money for their child’s education and other basic needs of daily life.

loans.use: To buy stone, bricks, sand and cement for her husband's business

loans.name: Enecita

texts.en:
Enecita B. is from the village of P-10, Puerta, Lurugan, Valencia City. She is 51 years old, separated from her spouse, and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Enecita owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Enecita has been engaged in her business for over 13 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from these activities.
In 2009, Enecita joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Enecita is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her third from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

location.town: P-10, Puerta, Lurugan, Valencia City, Bukidnon

loans.name: Blanca Mayra

texts.es:
Blanca Mayra Ramírez R.  tiene 31 años, es casada, y  tiene cuatro hijos.  Vive en el cantón de Guaranda en la provincia de Bolívar.

El socio es  miembro de la ventanilla rural Grupo Enmanuel es un recinto que se encuentra a cuarenta y cinco minutos del Cantón Guaranda capital de la Provincia de Bolívar.  Son 17 socios en total, es una comunidad Agrícola y Ganadera son indígenas hablan Quechua en su totalidad 
Blanca trabaja en la agricultura para incrementar la economía de la familia.  Los cultivos que más sobresalen son el maíz, cebada, trigo y papas  además se dedica a la cría animales en la casa como chanchos, cuyes y borregos  los productos vende en la casa y lo que siembra vende en el mercado mayorista de Guaranda cada seis meses.

La cultura principal es el carnaval que se celebra todos los años en febrero.  También, a Blanca  le gusta lavar cocinar y coser en los tiempos libres. 

El socio solicita el crédito para comprar insumos para el trabajo del campo y sobre todo para fertilizantes y abonos.  Su meta es tener una buena actividad económica para la familia.  Los desafíos que enfrenta son los problemas climáticos y las enfermedades que afectan a los cultivos.
texts.en:
Blanca Mayra Ramírez R. is 31 years old, married, and has four kids. She lives in the Guaranda cantón [a territorial unit or subdivision, below a province] in the province of Bolívar. She is a member of the solidarity group Group Enmanuel. It is an enclosure that is 45 minutes from Guaranda cantón, the capital of Bolívar. There are 17 group members total. Guaranda is an agricultural and livestock community where the indigenous speak Quechua. Blanca works in agriculture in order to boost the economy of the family. Her crops that stand out are corn, barley, wheat, and potatoes. In addition, she raises animals at home, like pigs, goats, and sheep. She sells her products at home and what is left over is sold in the major market of Guaranda every six months. The main cultural event is carnaval, which is celebrated ever year in February. Blanca also likes to do laundry, cook, and sew in her free time. This solidarity group member asks for a loan to purchase inputs for her field work, and above all for fertilizer and manure. Her goal is to have good economic activity for the family. The challenges that she faces are climate problems and diseases that affect the crops.

Translated from Spanish by Flavia Garcia, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of inputs for agricultural work

loans.name: Julian

texts.es:
Julián tiene 32 años, es casado y tiene 4 hijos. Vive en la localidad de “Quimbiri”, ubicada en la ceja de la selva peruana, donde tienen su casa propia.

Anteriormente era únicamente agricultor, pero en el presente se dedica al sector transporte, específicamente al transporte de pasajeros en su motocarro. Su recorrido empieza a las 6 AM y termina a las 10 PM. Este trabajo le gusta mucho, pues le brinda la oportunidad de socializar con sus clientes y  además obtiene buenas ganancias. 
Para el futuro, piensa reincorporarse a la actividad  agrícola, sin dejar de lado su trabajo actual, para que así tenga ingresos paralelos.

Este es su quinto préstamo con MFP, donde se compromete a cumplir con sus respectivos pagos mensuales; además hace hincapié en la buena organización que existe en su banco comunal, por lo que se siente satisfecho de ser parte.

Con el dinero solicitado comprará terrenos de cultivo para café, también hará el mantenimiento de su motocarro, con el propósito de trabajar con  mayor seguridad y confianza para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Julián is 32 years old, and is married with four children. He lives in Quimbiri, in the Peruvian jungle, where he has his own house. Previously, Julián was working in agriculture, but now he works in the transportation sector, transporting passengers in his mototaxi. His workday begins at 6AM and ends at 10 PM. He enjoys this work, as he has the opportunity to chat with his clients and also earn good money. In the future, Julián would like to renew his agricultural work without giving up the mototaxi. In this way, he would have two parallel income streams. This is Julián’s fifth loan with MFP, where he commits to making his monthly payments. Also, he makes an effort to help with the good organization of his communal bank, and he is happy to be a part of it. With this loan, Julián will buy land for the cultivation of coffee. He will also spend some money on maintenance of his mototaxi, so as to provide more security and confidence for his customers.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy land for agriculture and do vehicle mainenance

loans.name: Hawanatu

texts.en: Hawanatu W. has been a client of LAPO Sierra Leone for almost two years now, and she has taken three previous loans. She used the previous loans to expand her shop. Hawanatu is forty-five years old and married with eight children; she has four sons and four daughters. Her eldest child is in college, two are in secondary school, and the younger five are in primary school. Hawanatu's husband is a building contractor, and they live in Laka where she has a building-material shop. Hawanatu is asking for a loan of 3,000,0000 SLL to enable her buy more of items for sale.

loans.use: This loan will be used to purchase building materials for sale.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.es: Ronald tiene 31 años, vive con sus padres en casa de un familiar. Hace más de 8 años se dedica en la venta de productos básicos para el consumo humano, para ello se asoció con un familiar en el invirtieron para alquilar un local comercial, ubicada en una calle muy céntrica de su ciudad. Desde entonces vende al por mayor y menor gran variedad de productos de primera necesidad, además se organizan para atender su clientela. Paralelo a esta actividad, durante los fines de semana se dedican a vender animales y también a la agricultura, éste último le ayuda para su consumo propio, en donde siembra maíz y papa. Su negocio en la venta de productos le ha sido muy rentable, por lo que desea mas adelante ampliar su negocio y emprender uno nuevo e independiente.  Este es su séptimo crédito con MFP, por tanto se compromete a ser muy responsable con sus pagos. El crédito que solicita, invertirá para abastecerse de más productos y además en la compra de abono para su siguiente siembra de papa.
texts.en:
Ron is 31 years old and lives with his parents in the family home. Eight months ago he began selling basic consumer products. For him, he associated with a partnership to invest in renting a local business located on a very central street in the city. Since then, he sells a wide variety of wholesale and retail products that include basic necessities. In addition, he organizes them according to his client's needs. Parallel to this activity, on the weekends he sells animals and agricultural products; the later helps his own efforts in planting corn and potatoes. His business selling products has been very favorable, for his desire to move his business forward, and to become a new independent business owner. This is his seventh loan with MFP, and he promises to be very responsible with his payments. With the loan he's requesting, he will invest in building a supply of more products and even more so, buy fertilizer for his subsequent potato plantings.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build up a supply of products for his business

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
La Sra. Silvia, vive en casa propia en la zona de Villa Nuevo Potosí, tiene 47 años de edad y se encuentra casada con don Victor  con el que tiene 3 hijos que se encuentran estudiando en la universidad; ambos trabajan juntos en la confección de chamarras.

El Esposo de la Sra. Silvia y sus hijos son los que se encargan de la confección de las chamarras y doña Silvia se encarga de la venta de las chamarras, la misma que lo realiza de la siguiente manera, las lleva a vender en los departamentos de Potosí Tarija y Sucre.

El crédito solicitado es para la compra de tela paño por rollos en diferentes colores ya que de esa manera puede reducir el costo del material y por ende incrementar el margen de ganancia por chamarra, la sra. Silvia se encuentra muy contenta ya que toda la familia trabaja en este negocio es una persona muy trabajadora siempre piensa en el bienestar de toda su familia, esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Sra. Siliva lives in her own home in Villa Nuevo Potosí. She is 47 years old and is married to Don Victor. They have three children who are studying at the university. Her family works together manufacturing jackets.

Silvia’s husband and her children are responsible for manufacturing the jackets, while she is in charge of selling them. She takes her products to the Departments of Potosí Tarija and Sucre to sell.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy rolls of woven fabric in different colors so that she can reduce the cost of the material and increase her profit margin per jacket. Sra. Silvia is very happy that all of her family works in this business. She is a hardworking woman who is always thinking about the welfare of her entire family. Silvia is extremely grateful to Emprender and Kiva for demonstrating their confidence in her by providing this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rolls of fabric

loans.name: Lorta Uaquene

texts.pt:
Lorta Uaquene N. nasceu em Inhambane, província do mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique, solteira e mãe de 4 filhos, dos quais 3 perderam a vida um ainda vivo e empregado numa empresa privada. Vive na casa própria com seu filho, nora e seus 3 netos que vão a escola.   

Com 15 anos Lorta inicia seus estudos, faz a 2ª classe do antigo sistema e de seguida esta fica gravida. Fica muito desesperada após a morte dos seus filhos no tempo da guerra, sua irmã convida lhe para morar com ela no Distrito de Namaacha na fronteira da suazilândia, após sua chegada começa a trabalhar como empregada doméstica. 

Com o fundo colectado ela inicia seu próprio negócio e constroi sua casa com o rendimento ganho nos negócios, mas devido aos preparativos do casamento do seu filho ela fica na beira da falência e pede empréstimo a Hluvuku no valor de 8.000.00mt para reforçar o seu negócio. tem vendido 2 vezes por semana quartas e sabados no Mercado Informal onde há intercâmbio de produtos vindo de paises fora tem de lucro 5.000.00mt que gasta nas dispesas da casa e ainda consegue poupar algum.

 Este é o terceiro empréstimo de Lorta na Hluvuku e segundo com Kiva.O primeiro 8.000.00.mt foi usado para reforçar o seu negocio, o segundo de 10.000.00mt foi usado para aumentar a quantidade do seu stock, e este terceiro de 15.000.00mt serao para a mesma finalidade que é a compra de fardo de roupa usada diversa. Esta confiante que vai reembolsar antes do tempo previsto e pedir um novo empréstimo para concluir a casa do seu único filho.
texts.en:
Lorta Uaquene N. was born in the district of Inhambane, in the province of the same name in the south of Mozambique. Lorta is unmarried and had 4 children. Three of her children died, but one still lives and is employed at a private firm. She lives in her own home with her son, her daughter-in-law, and her 3 grandchildren, all of whom attend school. At age 15, Lorta began her studies, and finished the 2nd year of secondary school under the old education system. After this she became pregnant. After her children died during the Mozambican Civil War, she became despondent. Her sister invited Lorta to live with her in the district of Namaacha on the border with Swaziland. After moving there she began to work as a domestic servant. With her earnings, Lorta started her own business, and then built a house with the profit from that enterprise. However, due to expenses related to her son’s wedding she is close to bankruptcy. For this reason she is asking for a loan in the amount of 8000 meticais to shore up her business. She works two days a week, Wednesdays and Saturdays, selling at an unofficial market where people trade in imported goods. She earns about 5000 meticais per month and uses this income to cover household expenses. She also saves some each month. This is Lorta’s 3rd loan with Hluvuku and her 2nd with Kiva. The first loan, in the amount of 8000 meticais, was used to help shore up her business. The second, in the amount of 10,000 meticais, was used to increase her stock of merchandise. This third loan, for 15,000 meticais, will be used for the same purpose, to buy packs of used clothing for resale. Lorta is confident that she will repay this loan even sooner than required so that she can get another loan to finish building a house for her son.

Translated from Portuguese by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of packs of used clothing

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en: Faustina A. is single and has no formal education. She is a hairdresser in Abura. She has been a hairdresser for 13 years. She uses her revenue to take care of herself. She is going to use this loan to purchase more hair products for her customers' hair.  Faustina plans to save the new profits from her expanded business to buy a steam dryer.

loans.use: To purchase more hair products to use for her customers' hair

loans.name: Mrs. Srorn Port Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twelve people make up this village bank loan located in Koun Chreae village in Kandal province. The group loan is headed by Mrs. Srorn P., a village bank president. All the members will use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their family's living conditions. 


Mrs. Srorn P. is 45 years old and is a Khmer cake maker. She is also a farmer who owns a half-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to supP. her family. She currently faces a problem in that it is time to grow rice but she does not have enough money to do this. She is, therefore, applying for a loan to buy rice seed, fertilizer and to hire a plow. 


She is a widow with two children, one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory, while the other is attending the local public school.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and fertilizer, and to hire a plow

loans.name: Oripha

texts.en:
Oripha is 48 years old. She is a widowed mother of 2 children, ages 12 and 16, with both children attending school. She has been operating her mixed farm for 10 years in Kisii town, Western Kenya. She solely depends on the income from her farming activities to cater for the needs of her family.

Her biggest challenges have been lack of animal feeds, natural calamities and diseases, and the high competition in the market which affect her production.

Oripha has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of KES. 60,000 to purchase a water tank for collecting water for her dairy cows. She believes that this water tank will help increase her production. 

In the future, she hopes to purchase a quality dairy cow that will produce 60 litres of milk daily. She is grateful to Juhudi for the financial support.

loans.use: To purchase a water tank.

loans.name: Rosio

texts.es:
La señora Rosio L. M. tiene 28 años y está casada hace 5 años con el señor Willy Andres Ruiz Vaca con el cual tienen dos hijos Wendy de 9 y Rodrigo  de 3 años. Viven en su casa propia ubicada en el Barrio Noel Kenf Mercado en la calle Los Tajibos en la ciudad de Santa Cruz.

Esta pareja tienen una pequeña vidriera y ambos trabajan en la misma desde hace dos años haciendo trabajos de carpintería de aluminio y otros. Ella trabaja con su hijo en el lugar ya que no cuenta con niñera y los ingresos no le alcanzan para poder costear una y no se anima a dejarlo solo por su corta edad. Por el incremento en el precio del vidrio y del aluminio no les ha alcanzado para comprar material y su producción está empezando a estancarse por este motivo necesita el préstamo para poder comprar material y así poder satisfacer todos los pedidos que tiene.

El Mayor sueño que tienen es poder incrementar sus ingresos y de esa manera poder darle a su hijo todas las comodidades que ellos no pudieron tener de pequeños.
texts.en:
Rosio L. M. is 28 and has been married to Willy Andres Ruiz Vaca for five years. They have two children together, Wendy age 9 and Rodrigo, age 3. They live in their own home on Los Tabijos road in the Noel Kenf Mercado neighborhood in the city of Santa Cruz. This couple has a glass and window shop where they have both worked for the past 2 years performing carpentry and aluminum work amongst others. She works with her child alongside since the shop since they can't afford a baby sitter and she fears leaving him alone because of his age. The increased cost of glass and aluminum has made it difficult to buy material and their production is starting to drop off. For that reason they need a loan to buy material and fill all their orders. Their greatest dream is to increase their income and so be able to give their son all the comforts they didn't have as children.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase glass and aluminum for shop

loans.name: Faimasasa

texts.en:
Faimasasa S. is 51 and married with seven children.  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Faimasasa has 3 years of experience in this business.  Faimasasa needs a loan of WST 1000 to purchase general farm supplies & equipment.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 320 talas or US $133 per week) to financially support immediate members of her family.

In 2010, Faimasasa joined SPBD.    This is her 1st loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Faimasasa's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 

In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  

http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Yessica

texts.es: Yessica V. B. y su esposo desde hace un año se dedican a la venta de pan de elote y de maíz que ellos mismo preparan, su producto lo ofrecen en cada negocio del centro de la ciudad, este es llamado comida campirana que provienen de la ciudad que vivían. Este préstamo lo desea utilizar para comprar más ingredientes para seguir preparando este suculento pan.
texts.en:
Yessica V. B. has been selling corn bread for the past year, together with her husband. They make the bread themselves and they sell their product to the businesses in the city's downtown. This food product is a country food staple, traditional to the region from where they used to live. This loan will be used to purchase more ingredients to keep making this delicious bread.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Enedina

texts.es: Enedina tiene 53 años, vive con su esposo  y su hijo en su casa propia. Toda la vida ha estado dedicada a la agricultura y a la crianza D. animales que con mucho esmero ha venido realizando con su esposo con el fin D. sostener a su familia. En la actualidad mantiene las mismas fuerzas y energías para que pueda obtener una excelente cosecha y generen las rentas necesarias. Afirma que le agrada trabajar en esta actividad ya que es lo único que sabe hacer desD. que era un niño, ahora en lo posible comercializa su producción en el mercado mayorista, lugar donD. obtiene mejores ganancias, es por esta razón que desea mejorar sus futuras cosechas. Es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta D.  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra D. sacos D. abono ya que empezará una nueva temporada D. siembra.
texts.en:
Enedina, 53, lives with her husband and her son in her own house. She has been a farmer and has raised animals her entire life. She and her husband have been working very hard to support their family. She still has the same strength and energy to continue working to have an excellent harvest that will produce the necessary profits. She affirms that she likes working in this activity since it’s the only thing she’s known how to do since she was a child. Whenever possible, products are sold in the wholesale market where profits are best. For this reason, she’d like to improve future crops. This is her first loan with MFP and she is very happy to know that she can count on financial support. Besides, she likes being part of a communal bank because all the members are people she knows; they are responsible and mutually supportive. She is grateful to all those people who will fund the loan she is asking for that will be so useful for her business’ progress. She will use the requested funds to buy sacks of manure because the new planting season is about to begin.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of manure.

loans.name: Comfort Aba

texts.en: Comfort Aba K. A. is married. She sells locally-made buicuits at Elmina. She has junior high educational background. Her husband is a farmer. Comfort uses the income she makes from her sales to help in providing the basic needs of the family.  Comfort will use the loan to purchase more ingredients to prepare her biscuits for sale. With the new revenue from her expanded business, Comfort plans on reinvesting into her business.

loans.use: purchase more ingredients to use to prepare her biscuits for sale

loans.name: Agenlina

texts.en: Agenlina A. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes and onions and is requesting a loan to stock more tomatoes to sell. Agenlina is 30 years old. She is married and her husband is a business man. She has 5 children and 2 of her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business.

loans.use: To stock more tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Oyunchimeg

texts.en:
Oyunchimeg R. is 40 years old and lives with her husband and four children in Tosontsengel province, Mongolia. She and her family have been living in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian housing tent and fence, for the past 18 years. One of her children attends university and another child studies at the local school. Her husband works as a loader in the meat-processing factory. Oyunchimeg currently operates a small bakery in her town. 

In 2004, she started her bakery business at first making only breads to sell in her home. Today she produces between 20 and 25 types of breads and baked pastries. Her child helps in her business. After years of successful operation, she has managed to expand her business and purchased a new oven for her bakery production. Her earnings have enabled her not only to provide for her family, but also to pay her son's tuition fee. Over the last few years, she was able to improve her family's standard of living by purchasing carpets, a TV set, a ger's cover, etc. 

She is a hard-working woman who is focused on the future growth of her business. She says, “ I have a plan to expand my business and to create a more efficient workplace in the future”. Oyunchimeg is requesting a 600,000 MNT loan to purchase and maintain a large amount of flour and supplies for her bakery production.

loans.use: To purchase flour and bakery supplies

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris is 38 years old, married and the mother of four, aged between 10 and 22 years, all attending school.  She has been a mixed farmer for twenty years. She has one employee. Her products are maize, millet, milk and chickens which she sells locally.

She has requested this loan of Kshs. 30,000 from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a dairy cow. Income generated from this loan  will cater for the children's school fees.  In five years she aspires to acquire a plot of land to build both a house and rental business.

The challenge she faces is poor road infrastructure and low market prices for the milk.  She thanks Juhudi for introducing loan facilities to her.

loans.use: buy a cow

loans.name: Mrs. Reab Chheun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Reab C. is the village bank president who has been selected by the nine people who make up the village bank loan. This loan can improve their family living. They are located in Prey Ba Soeng village in Takeo province. 

She is a knitter who earns some money to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Sitha Bev, is a farmer who owns a one-hectare plot of land to grow rice to sell to support his family. On this plantation, it is time to grow rice but she does not have enough money to support the crop. So to improve production, Mrs. Reab C. is seeking a loan to do farming this current year. 

She is a mother of two children who are both too young to work or study.

loans.use: To do farming

loans.name: Raphael Kagonye

texts.en:
Raphael is 38 years old. He is married to Ruth and they have four children. He has been in the motorcycle transport business for about five years and earns an income of approx Kshs. 12,000 per month.

He is applying for a second loan from KADET LTD after successfully repaying the first one. He intends to use the loan funds to buy spare parts for his motorcycle. He to use the anticipated profit to expand his business by adding more motocycles. He hopes to improve the living standards of his family and give his children a quality education.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Mame Fatou Wade Group

texts.fr:
Le Banc Villageois de MAME FATOU W. a vu le jour lors de son premier financement le 27 Décembre 2010. Il est composé de 40 femmes du même quartier. Elles ont monté leur Banc Villageois par proximité et par relaition de solidarité. 

Madame MAME DIOR C. debout à gauche sur la photo et mise en médaillon est présidente du Banc Villageois. Elle est âgée de 35 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants en charge.

Elle fait un petit commercer de tissus et de parfums. 

Le nouveau prêt contracté auprès de CAURIE-MF lui permettra de mieux se lancer dans ce domaine d'activité 

Son objectif est de participer à la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
The Banc Villageois "Mame Fatou W." was set up on December 27, 2010, when it entered its first loan cycle. It is composed of 40 members, all living in the same neighborhood. They have set up their Banc Villageois due to ties of neighborhood and solidarity.

Mrs Mame Dior C., standing left in the photo with the locket, chairs the Banc Villageois. She is 35 years old, married and the mother of two children in her care. She has a small cloth and perfume store. Her new loan with Caurie Microfinance will enable her to better progress in this activity. Her objective is to participate in household expenses.

loans.use: To buy cloth and perfume

loans.name: Buri

texts.ru: Нодиров Бури проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 61 года. Женат. Имеет 5 детей. Сын на заработках в России. Сам Бури более 10 лет занимается животноводством. Разводит скот у себя дома. Он разводит скот в дальнейшем для перепродажи. В этом ему помогает жена. На сегодняшний день у него имеется три коровы и два теленка. Его семья обеспечена молоком и молочными продуктами. Еще он занимается продажей молока. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота, чтобы увеличить их количество.
texts.en: Buri N. lives in the region of Yavan. He is 61 years old. He is married and has five children. His son is working in Russia. Buri has been doing animal  husbandry for more than ten years. He breeds cattle at home for future resale. His wife helps him in this business. Currently he has three cows and two calves. His family is supplied with milk and milk products. Buri also sells the milk. He is taking out the loan to buy large cattle and increase their quantity.

loans.use: To buy large cattle

loans.name: Elgiza's Group

texts.en:
Elgiza O. is the treasurer for this group. She is 26 and married. Her husband works as an excavator driver. Together they bring up a son and two daughters. Their son goes to school and their daughters are still of pre-school age (under seven). 

Five years ago, with the initial investment of 2000 soms, Elgiza and her husband bought four goats for breeding. Since that time, the family has been  engaged in livestock breeding. With the money received from this loan, Elgiza wants to increase their number of livestock. In the future, Elgiza wants to purchase a vehicle.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Remegia

texts.en:
Remegia P. is from the village of Bobongan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 59 years old. Remegia is widowed and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Remegia owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general services to local community members. Remegia has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Remegia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Remegia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Remegia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 27-year-old married man from Bint Jbeil. He works in agriculture planting several fruits and vegetables. He also sells olive oil that he gets from his olive trees, in addition to selling firewood in the winter season.
Ali is requesting a loan for the first time from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to buy an electric saw for his business and renew his license to cut trees. Ali is a hard worker who seeks the best for his family by working more than one job. When he first set up in business, he had problems making contacts and expanding his business. Now he is well known, and most of his customers recommend him. He hopes to expand his business more and more in the future.

loans.use: To buy an electric saw and renew his license to cut trees

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Pauline has operated a tailoring business for the past ten years; neighboring members are her potential customers. Pauline faces a major challenge of seasonality. During festive season, the demand is high while during the months of January to May, the demand is low. Pauline will use this KES 20,000 loan to purchase cloth materials for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is a 26-year-old, hardworking woman who lives in a rented house in Hoima, Uganda. She is a banking officer and earns a salary from her job. She has not faced any challenges at her work place. Her dream is to educate her siblings and to develop her career. Ruth needs this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Delia Caritina

texts.es:
La Sra Delia. tiene 48 años D. edad, está casada con el señor  Estanislao S. quien es carpintero y le ayuda con  los gastos del hogar, son Curuguateños antiguos. Tienen cinco hijos mayores todos independientes, a quienes han criado con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio.
Delia tiene un copetin, desD. hace mas D. 5 años.  Su esposo era el único que generaba ingresos en la casa,  y con un pequeño capital que había juntado pudieron montar dicha actividad. Hoy día ambos generan ingresos y aportan a la canasta familiar.
Actualmente posee clientela formada, pues su negocio está ubicado frente a Identificaciones donD. concurre mucha gente cada dia.
Necesita el crédito para la compra D. mercaderias como carne, huevos, bebidas y otros.
texts.en:
Delia is 48 years old and married to Estanislao S., a carpenter, and she helps him to pay their living expenses: they are old Curuguateños. They have 5 grown children who all live independently, who were raised with great effort and sacrifice by their parents.

Delia has been running a snack bar for 5 years. Her husband was the only one bringing money into their home, and with the small amount of capital that they had saved, they were able to establish this business. Today they both earn money and contribute to the family bills.

Currently she has a regular client base as her business is located facing the Identificaciones building, where there is a lot of passing traD. each day. She needs the loan to purchase goods such as meat, eggs, drinks and more.

loans.use: For the purchase of goods such as meat, eggs, drinks and more.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en: Justine N. lives in the Kisaasi neighbourhood of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has 2 children, neither of whom is in school. Justine has a business of a retail shop.  She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 7 days each week. She also generates additional income through  selling piped water.  Justine has requested for a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of rice, sugar, cooking oil, and baking flour. The main business challenges for Justine include transportation and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van and also to own a fully stocked supermarket.  Justine lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and  piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include utility bills and food.

loans.use: to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, and baking flour.

loans.name: Nizbel

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Urubamba donde se encuentra el Santuario Histórico de Machu Picchu (Machu Picchu es considerado como una de las octavas Maravillas de la Humanidad). Cada treinta días se reúne el Banco Comunal “Saywa - Chichubamba”. Este lugar es conocido por sus centros arqueológicos, paisajes hermosa, que son muy visitadas por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros, ofrece diversidad de lugares hermosos y una rica variedad de platos típicos de la región.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Nizbel que nació en Espinar (Cusco, Perú), tiene 29 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tienen dos hijos. Ella trabaja en el Poder Judicial de la ciudad de Urubamba en el área de limpieza desde las 5h00 de la mañana hasta las 13h00 de lunes a viernes.   

Ella también tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa en la cual trabaja junto a su esposo, allí venden todo tipo de productos, como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, entre otras cosas, el esposo atienda en las mañanas y su esposa por las tardes, además de estos productos también venden verduras y útiles escolares, los productos los compra en la ciudad del Cusco ya que allá le salen más baratos, ciertos productos los recibe en su local.  

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Banco Comunal hace varios años y le gusta por la confraternidad que hay en el grupo.

Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y convertirlo en un minimarket también su sueño es construir su casa de material noble.
texts.en:
The city of Urubamba is home to the historic sanctuary of Machu Picchu, which is considered one of the eight Wonders of the World. It is also where the "Saywa - Chichubamba" communal bank meets every thirty days. It is a place known for its archaeological centers and beautiful landscapes, which are widely visited by many domestic and international tourists. It offers a variety of beautiful places and a rich variety of typical regional dishes.

This is where you would meet Ms. Nizbel. She was born in Espinar (Cusco, Perú), is 29 years old, married, and has two children from her marriage. She works from 5:00 AM to 1:00 PM from Monday to Friday, as a janitor for the Judicial Power of the city of Urubamba

She also has a grocery store in her house, which she runs together with her husband. They sell all types of products, like rice, sugar, oils, detergents, and other items. Her husband tends the store in the mornings and Nizbel does so in the afternoons. Aside from the aforementioned products they also sell vegetables and school supplies. They buy products in the city of Cusco, where they sell for cheaper. They also obtain some products locally.

Nizbel is going to use this loan to better stock her store. She will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, sausage, and other staple products. She has been in her communal bank for several years and she enjoys it because of the fellowship that exists amongst the group.

Her goals are to continue moving forward with her business and to convert it into a mini-market. She also dreams of constructing her house of more stable materials.

loans.use: stock her store with rice, sugar, oil, detergents, sausage, and other staple items

loans.name: Walter

texts.en: Walter is a 24-year-old business man.  He is married and blessed with a one-year-old child.  He was previously selling clothes before he started a hardware shop.  It's one year since he started the business.  He hopes to grow his business in the future.  He has requested 50,000 KES to buy paints, iron sheets, nails and cement.

loans.use: to buy paints, iron sheets, nails and cement.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
La señora Cecilia es socia del banco comunal Ricardo Palma del Distrito de Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y tiene tres hijos.
En los ocho años que viene trabajando con Manuela Ramos ha podido abrir un pequeño negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de artículos de abarrotes.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 1 caja de leche, 1 paquete de harina, 3 casillero de huevos, 1 caja de aceite de medio litro, 1 bolsa de detergente, 1 bolsa de lejía en cojín, 1 saco de azúcar, 1 saco de arroz, 1 bolsa de fideo.
Todo su dinero lo invierte en su negocio para poder tener más productos para ofrecer a sus clientes, su esposo es profesor de profesión y también ayuda en la atención del negocio.
Manuela Ramos ha sido quien le dió la oportunidad de iniciar su negocio y le  agradece por ser quien confió en su sueño del negocio propio.
texts.en:
Cecilia is a member of the 'Ricardo Palma' community bank which is located in Calleria district, in Ucayali department.  She is 42 years old, married, and has three children.

During the eight years that she has been working with Manuela Ramos, Cecilia has been able to open her own small business selling groceries.

With her new loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles, she will buy: 1 crate of milk, 1 packet of flour, 3 trays of eggs, 1 crate of half-liter bottles of oil, 1 bag of detergent, 1 bag of bleach, 1 sack of sugar, 1 sack of rice and 1 bag of noodles.

Cecilia invests all her money in her business so that she can offer more products to her customers.  Her husband is a teacher by profession and also helps serve in the business.

It was Manuela Ramos who gave Cecilia the opportunity to start her business and she is grateful to them for having faith in her dream of owning her own business.

loans.use: to buy milk, rice, sugar, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Gloria Esperanza

texts.es:
Gloria, se dedica al procesamiento y venta de productos lácteos, vive con su hijo de 19 años de edad, es madre soltera, aprendió el negocio por su madre, quien le enseño a elaborar la cuajada, queso, crema y requesón, compra la leche luego la prepara con la pastilla para iniciar el cuajo para el proceso, por las mañanas vende los productos, con los vecinos cercanos, también elabora pan y tamales, para venderlos de forma ambulante, esta ocupación la tiene desde hace 5 años.
Ella necesita un financiamiento para comprarse unos estantes para guardar el queso en el verano y leche para fabricar más, este préstamo le ayudara a  guardar en un lugar adecuado los quesos, uno de sus riesgos es la higiene del lugar, que son el mayor riesgo para dañarse los quesos.
Gloria cuenta con clientela para sus productos, esta es una ventaja que tiene, sueña con crecer en producción para ayudarle a su hijo quien padece de incapacidad física, por lo que quiere muchos cuidados.
texts.en:
Gloria processes and sells dairy products. She is a single mother who lives with her 19-year-old son. Gloria learned this trade from her mother, who taught her how to make curds, cheese, cream, and cottage cheese. She buys the milk and then prepares the enzymes that aid in the processing. Gloria sells her products in the morning to her neighbors who live nearby. She also prepares bread and tamales and sells these products as a street vendor. Gloria has been in business for five years.

She needs a loan to buy some shelves for storing her cheese during the summer and the milk needed for making more products. This loan will help her set aside an adequate place for storing cheeses. One of the risks that she must manage is maintaining a sanitary space. Otherwise, dirty conditions could contaminate the cheese.

Gloria has customers who buy her products, which is advantageous. She dreams of increasing her production so that she can support her son, who has a physical disability and requires constant care.

loans.use: to purchase shelving for storing cheese and milk.

loans.name: Rimah

texts.en:
Rimah is a young woman from Maythalon village near Jenin city in Palestine. She is married and a mother of two daughters and four sons. Rimah took out a loan of $1,000 to purchase plowing tools. Her husband is a farmer and needs to prepare his land but the tools he has are not usable.anymore. Rimah's husband grows seasonal vegetables and wants to start growing fruits and increase the variety of crops he sells to shops in Maythalon.

Rimah is a conservative woman.Therefore. her husband is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase plowing tools

loans.name: Arnelyn

texts.en:
Arnelyn is 21 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. She has a shop that sells generic medicines. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy additional stocks of generic medicines.

Arnelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2006. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of generic medicines

loans.name: Washington

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SANTO DOMINGO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Washington; el tiene 36 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de transporte, el es propietario de un carro que hace servicio de taxi, el socio también tiene un negocio de venta de comida que lo realiza su esposa, el negocio de servicio de taxi lo realiza desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 9:00 p.m, por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere mejorar el servicio de taxi y también mejorar el negocio de venta de comida. El  socio solicita el préstamo para el mantenimiento de su carro y también para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, azúcar, carne y verduras para el negocio de venta de comida. 
                                              
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
He is a member of the Santo Domingo Communal Bank, which is located in the district of Cusco, a part of the province and department of Cusco.

This is Mr. Washington, who is 36 years old and lives with his partner and 3 children. This member alternates between providing transportation services--he owns a car in which he provides taxi services--and he owns a food business that his wife runs. He works as a cab driver from 6:00 am until 9:00 pm. With these two businesses, he is able to help his children get ahead. This member wishes to improve both his taxi service and his food business. He is requesting a loan for car maintenance and to purchase cooking ingredients like rice, sugar, meat, and vegetables for his food business.

Mr. Washington is happy about the loan, and he commits to making his payments in a timely manner.

loans.use: to give his car maintenance and to purchase cooking products like rice, sugar, meat, and vegetables for his food business.

loans.name: Buena

texts.en:
Buena raises hogs for future sale. She has been doing it for three years. This serves as the source of her income which her family relies on to maintain their basic needs such as food and medicines. She has five children to provide for, especially their education. Buena earns about PHP 5,000 with each pig sale.

She is now requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy feed and vitamins for her hogs. She needs additional capital for maintaining her hogs in order for her to  offer them for sale at a higher cost when they are ready.

Buena wants to strengthen her business and construct a more convenient pig pen.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her hogs.

loans.name: Estrelita

texts.en:
Estrelita is a 49-year-old widow. Her husband died from cancer of the brain. She has five children to provide for. Despite the difficulty of pursuing their lives alone, she is working hard to grant their daily needs such as food.

Estrelita engages in piggery as her primary source of income. She is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy feed for her hogs. She hopes to earn a higher income so that she can save for emergencies. She doesn't want to experience again to loss the one she loves because of lack of finance.

loans.use: to buy feed for her hogs.

loans.name: Anna

texts.ru:
Анна замужем. У них с ее мужем Андреем трое детей. Живут в двух комнатной квартире в городе Ивано-Франковске. Вместе с мужем Анна ведет семейный бизнес.

Анна торгует на центральном продуктовом рынке. Ее торговая  точка находится на въезде в рынок. Анна торгует овощами и фруктами.  У нее большой ассортимент и низкие цены.  Анна целеустремленная и трудолюбивая. Этот бизнес является  главным доходом семьи. Цель Анны дать детям высшее образование.

Анна просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 10,000 гривен на закупку на закупку фруктов к сезону консервации и цитрусовых. Получив доход, она сможет переоформить автомобиль, который они недавно приобрели для бизнеса.
texts.en: Anna is married.  She and her husband Andrey have three children.  They live in a two-room apartment in the town of Ivano-Frankivsk.  Anna and her husband have their own business.
