Anna sells vegetables and fruits at the central produce market.  Her retail outlet is located at the market entrance.  She has a wide selection of products and low prices.  Anna is a goal-oriented and hard-working person.  This business is the main source of income for her family.  Anna's goal is to provide her children with a higher education.  Anna is requesting a loan in the sum of 10,000 hryvnia for the purchase of fruits for the pickling season.  Having received an income, she would be able to refinance a vehicle that they purchased for the business.

loans.use: to buy fruits for the pickling season

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 4 children.  Rowena has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. Rowena has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rowena hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena is 71 years old and married with 9 children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell.

She has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, noodles and other groceries. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell.

loans.name: Sokhim

texts.en: Sokhim, 34 years old, is a food seller, and she earns $5 per day. Her husband buys and sells recycled things and earns $5 per day. They have three children, two are studying and one is only three years old. Every month, she has to spend $40 on food, $18 on electricity, and $30 on school fees. She would like to request a loan of $900 to buy karaoke material to start a business. She wants to extend her business and buy more karaoke material when she makes a good income from it.

loans.use: To buy karaoke material for her new business

loans.name: Marie Gorette

texts.en:
Marie is 32 years old with four children between the ages of 3 and 12. Three are currently in school. She is married to a man who is a moto taxi driver.  

She has been running a store for 10 years where she sells different goods and recharges batteries.  

She would like to use the loan to buy more utensils to sell. She would like to use the profits of her business to create savings for her future and build a house for her family. She is looking forward to seeing her business prosper.

loans.use: To buy more utensils for resale.

loans.name: Constancia Belen

texts.es:
La señora Constancia tiene 42 años, vive con su cónyuge quien le ayuda en el negocio y su hija D. 17 años D. edad. 
La señora nos cuenta que tiene una despensa y que para poder empezar con su negocio junto a su pareja tuvieron que ir a trabajar en Asunción como empleados domésticos, y gracias al esfuerzo y el trabajo arduo, juntaron un capital con el cual montaron su negocio. Gracias al espíritu emprendedor pudieron ir creciendo hoy en día es uno D. los lugares más concurridos D. la ciudad gracias a la buena atención y a la amabilidad por parte D. los mismos.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. fideos, arroz, azúcar, bebidas y otros productos para abastecer su local. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que estas le dan.
texts.en:
Constancia is 42 years old. She lives with her spouse, who helps her in the business, and her 17-year-old daughter.
She reports that she owns a small grocery store and that, in order to get the business started, she and her spouse had to go to Asunción to work as housekeepers. Thanks to their efforts and hard work, they saved money which they used to set up their business. Thanks to their enterprising spirit, they have been able to keep growing. Nowadays it is one of the most popular stores in town, thanks to how attentive and friendly the owners are.
She requests the loan in order to purchase noodles, rice, sugar, beverages, etc., for stocking up her store. She thanks the Fundación and Kiva for the opportunity she is given.

loans.use: to purchase noodles, rice, sugar, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Rebelita

texts.en:
Rebelita is 49, married and has three school-age children. Due to financial difficulties, she helps her husband in managing their corn farming business for it is the main source of their income. Despite the hardships in farming, they are strong enough to face whatever challenges they encounter in life. 

They aim to increase their yields and income to be able to support the education of their children and satisfy their basic necessities. In this regard, Rebelita is asking for an additional capital of P25,000 to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and to pay labor cost required in corn planting. They believed that through patience and hard work, they will have a fruitful harvest. They hope that in the future they will improve their status of living and give their children a better life.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and pay labor cost required in corn planting.

loans.name: Oyunzul

texts.en:
Oyunzul is 44 years old and lives with her husband and son in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in the Dornod province of Mongolia. Her husband helps with her business, and her son is a student. 

Oyunzul started her grocery shop business in 1997 by renting a counter in a market. Her customers are increasing rapidly due to the many buildings being constructed in the area. Therefore, Oyunzul is requesting 500,000 MNT to buy supplies. She is a hardworking and diligent woman who says, "Now that my customers have increased, I believe it is my chance to expand my business."

loans.use: to buy more groceries for sale.

loans.name: Sinignessigui Group

texts.fr:
Les sept  membres du groupe SINIGNESSIGUI sont essentiellement des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans, 3 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles monogamiques à MAMASSONI, un des quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso. 
Elles sont à leur premier prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
MARIAM, la première assise à droite, fait le commerce de pagnes wax et bazin, il y’a environ  3 ans.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 8 pièces de pagnes wax et 2 pièces de bazin. Elle s’approvisionne chez les grossistes au grand marché de Sikasso ville.  Elle les revend en détail (de un à trois pagnes) de façon ambulante marché et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 17.500 FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The seven members of the SINIGNESSIGUI group are essentially married women with an average age of 42; an average of 3 children; and who, for the most part, live in monogamous families in MAMASSONI, one of the outlying districts of the city of Sikasso.

This is the group’s first loan with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution that will be used to meet the needs of their customers. 

MARIAM, the first woman seated on the right, has been selling pagnes and damask for about 3 years. With her loan, she is planning to buy 8 panges and 2 pieces of damask. 

She buys her supplies from wholesalers at the grand market of the city of Sikasso. She resells them at retail (from one to three pagnes) for cash, both on foot and out of her home, to a clientele of both men and women.

She plans on earning average monthly profits of 17,500 FCFA - some of which will be used to pay the loan and its interest, and the rest of which will go into savings. She would like to increase her earnings to better satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to buy pagnes and damask

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 

Gemma has a shop that sells seedlings of trees like gemilina (beech) and mahogany. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy fertilizers for the seedlings. Gemma has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her seedlings.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is married and has two daughters aged six months and three years. She describes herself as an ambitious woman. She runs a beauty salon and provides services of plaiting, blow-drying and applying chemicals. In addition, she sells cosmetics and hair oils. Her business challenge is the high prices of cosmetics. She will be using the loan of Kes 20,000 to purchase more beauty products. In the next five years, Catherine hopes to run a cosmetics retail shop.

loans.use: To buy more beauty products.

loans.name: Dinah's Group

texts.en:
Dinah's group is formed by 13 farmers in Matete District and is being represented by Dinah, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 27 years old, is married and has three children. Dinah has been a farmer for 15 years and is often referred to as a very friendly person.

Dinah isn’t new to One Acre Fund, she actually joined the program in 2013 and has since noticed her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year, Dinah will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Dinah's group will purchase a total of 13 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 7.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Badi Group

texts.es:
Sobre un campo verde, se destaca una máquina del ferrocarril y la vía, simbolizando el progreso en sus medios de comunicación, ya que la novia del sol fue importante centro ferrocarrilero; a sus lados hay un obrero y un campesino estrechándose la mano, que representan las fuerzas activas que dieron lugar a la fundación y factores importantes para el desarrollo de la vida del pueblo; el número 5 de la máquina, recuerda que ese número tenía el primer tren que llegó a la novia del sol, comunicándola por este medio con el resto de la nación, son los componentes del escudo además de estar a un costado del municipio las representaciones.
En una de las colonias se consolido el grupo llamado B, por ser este el apellido de sus fundadoras, el grupo lo integran.
Olgalivia - Refaccionaria
Juana, Antonia – Comida 
Oscar – Taller Mecánico
Henry -Eléctrico-Automotriz
Lucila – Comida Y Cosméticos 
Sofía –Pollo Asado
Doña Antonia tiene 40 años de edad, lamentablemente no estudio, está casada con el señor Julián con quien ha procreado 3 hijos todos mayores de edad, desde niña doña Toña como le conocen se ha dedicado a trabajar para poder ayudar a su familia, hace 20 años “por necesidad, para brindarle lo mejor a mis hijos “ comenta doña toña quien desde entonces se ha dado cita afuera de una de las terminales de autobuses con mayor prestigio, afuera en la banqueta coloca un burro(monten de madera) y sobre el coloca su canasta donde lleva la comida lista y poder satisfacer .
De lunes a domingo de 10:00 am a 5:00 pm  ofrece tacos de canasta, empanadas, chiles rellenos, tortas, mismas que prepara en casa por las mañanas, en promedio vende 200 piezas diarias y cuando es medio día y se le está acabando la comida acude a casa a preparar más para no dejar sin comer a sus clientes.
“me agrada mi negocio pues además de vender bastante bien, me alegra que los clientes elogien el sabor de mi comida y me prefieran a mi” expreso contenta doña Toña.
Las ganancias obtenidas le permitieron cumplir el propósito de sus decisión, de igual manera las ganancias las invierte en la compra de carne, tortillas, aceite, huevos, papel estraza, bolsas, además de pagar el piso(cuota por venta diaria) y cada tres meses hacienda.
El préstamo le será de utilidad pues lo invertirá en la compra de carne; aceite, pan, mayonesa, chiles, verdura, papel estraza bolsas y gas para continuar con más fuerza su actividad.
“Gracias a dios todos los días vendo todo lo que preparo, gracias a quienes hacen posible se nos otorguen los préstamos y con ellos impulsar el crecimiento de nuestras actividades, dios los bendiga”
*la fotografia fue tomada en el balcón pues estaba lloviendo, doña Toña viste blusa azul.

loans.use: Comprara; arne; aceite, pan, mayonesa, chiles, verdura, papel estraza bolsas y gas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: tO EXPAND HER FARMING BUSINESS

loans.name: Toyibah

texts.en: T. is 24 years old and married with one child aged 3. She sells fruit-flavored blended ice in front of her house. She usually earns a profit of $1.50 per day. Her husband, Sukron, is a fisherman whose income is unpredictable, ranging between $2 - $3 per day.  She very much needs to have this $50 loan to expand her business. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Fruit-flavored blended ice

loans.name: Adjo Georgette

texts.en:
Miss S. Adjo Georgette was born in 1979 in Lomé. She is single. She is a master hairdresser with a dozen apprentices. She supports her parents, brothers and sisters. After graduating first of her class, Georgette opened up a shop under a shed by the side of a road where she brilliantly practices her job. Despite the number of her apprentices, Miss S. is not anymore able to satisfy her customers because of lack of adequate equipment and the tightness of her shop. To establish her customer loyalty and to increase their number, she imperatively needs to open up another shop and to equip it by buying hairdryers, shampoos and others modern products. To do so requires financial means that she does not have. Therefore, she is soliciting a $1200 loan that she will pay back with her income which will triple with the acquisition of the projected equipment.

Translated from [French] by [Bijou Kuzimbu], Kiva Volunteer.

Mlle S. Adjo Georgette est née en 1979 à Lomé. Célibataire, elle est maîtresse coiffeuse ayant sous sa responsabilité une dizaine d’apprenties et à sa charge ses parents et ses jeunes frère et sœurs. Sortie première de sa promotion, Mlle S. a ouvert son atelier sous un hangar au bord de la route où elle exerce avec brio son métier. Très appréciée et sollicitée, Mlle S. malgré le nombre pléthorique de ses apprenties n’arrive plus à satisfaire toutes ses clientes faute de moyens matériels plus adapté et de l’exiguïté de l’atelier. Aujourd’hui pour fidéliser sa clientèle et en augmenter, elle a besoin impérativement d’ouvrir un autre atelier, l’équiper en achetant des séchoirs, des laves têtes et d’autres produits plus modernes. Cela nécessite des moyens financiers dont elle ne dispose pas, c’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite un crédit de $1200 qu’elle pourra rembourser à partir de ses recettes qui auront à tripler avec les aménagements et l’acquisition des matériels prévus.

loans.use:
Open a shop and equip it 
(Ouvrir un atelier et l'équiper)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her shoe shop

loans.name: Muhamed

texts.en: Muhamed is a forty seven year old carpenter.  He makes beds and school benches and other furniture that clients request. Married with five children, he used his previous loan to buy needed tools for his craft. The tools enabled him to improve the quality of production.  He is requesting a loan of $350 to buy timber and employ one carpenter to assist him.  Muhamed said, with the loan, he will be able to keep up with contracts and increase his profit.

loans.use: Purchase timber for increased production and hire an assistant carpenter.

loans.name: Rangel

texts.en: Rangel K. lives in the village in Medkovetz, near Vratza. He has a farm with eight cows near the house in which he and his wife live. He and his wife are unemployed; consequently, this farming business is their family's only source of income. Rangel needs $750 so that he can buy one more cow for his farm.

loans.use: Purchasing one more cow for his farm

loans.name: Malickkosim

texts.en: Malickkosim Z. lives in Mastchokh and he is married with two children. He has been a client of MicroInvest since 2004 and he recommends himself as a serious and executive client who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedures. He is engaged in commercial and trade service. Mr. Z. has a business in rice selling. He is the direct supplier which allows him to sell the rice by a price that is lower than the bazaar price. He is very polite which is why he has permanent clients who want to buy only his goods. Malickkosim Z. is very experienced in his business. But working in the trade sphere he meets hard competitors which is why he wants to widen his existing assortment. Now Mr. Z. requires a loan of 4100 STJ to develop his business and widen his assortment of goods  to increase the family's income that allows his children to continue their education.

loans.use: Malickkosim would like to develop his rice selling business so he can continue to send his children to school.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is a salon stylist; she does hair in different styles for people in her community. She is married with four children. She is 38 years old. She needs the loan of $450 to enable her buy weavon (hair-weaving product) and other hair accessories and drinks to sell. She learned the business for 2 years and started this one in 1995.

loans.use: To buy more hair accessories and drinks

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia Benítez de Silva is a 45 year old mother of four children and has been married to her husband Justo for 20 years. In order to provide income for her family, Celia has worked on the street as a newspaper vendor. She works on a very important avenue in the city where she lives. In order to increase her profits, she began working with Fundación Paraguaya to buy new goods.

Now Celia is making more income selling fruits along with her newspapers. With the initial loan from the Fundación, she was able to invest in fruits and newspapers toprovide to people who walk or drive along the busy avenues where she works. The loan she is asking for today will be used to invest more money into fresh local fruits including watermelon, plums, apples and bananas to sell.

loans.use: To buy more fruits including bananas, apples, watermelon, and plums.

loans.name: Wanyange Lake K D Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Miriam N.. She is currently in the business of selling raw food and is requesting a loan to purchase a bicycle to transport the food from the villages to her stall. Miriam is 31 years old and is married with a husband who is an egg supplier for work. She has 6 children ranging from ages 4 to 16 and her children go to school. Each week, Miriam makes approximately UGX 45000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children. Miriam has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 350000 in order to buy more raw food and the loan was paid back on time.

Miriam is joined in her small group by Ester N., Robina T. and Muselina M.. Ester N. has a business selling raw food and wants to rent bigger business premises. Robina T. is currently operating a grocery store business and wants a loan to purchase more groceries. Muselina M. operates a charcoal and scrap selling business and wants to buy more scrap to sell.

loans.use: To add to raw food business

loans.name: Lili

texts.es:
Mrs. Lili is a member of the Indo American Community Bank, located at Av. Amazon, Lt. F Block 20, Calleria District, Ucayali State. She is 43 years old, married, and has eight children. Her husband is a trader.

With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) of approximately $110, Lili started a business selling food. At present, she has a restaurant. She gets up at 6 am to go to the market and buy the ingredients for preparing the dishes that she sells from noon to 2 pm. With this loan, which will be repaid in 6 months, Lili plans to buy: 1 large sack of rice, 1 large sack of sugar, noodles, oil, etc.

Lili is very glad that she can support her children with their studies as well as contribute to the household expenses. She is very grateful for the support Manuela Ramos provides for her business.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Lili pertenece al Banco Comunal Indo América, ubicado en la Av. Amazonas, Mz F Lt 20, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 43 años y es madre de 8 hijos, su esposo es comerciante Lili con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decide invertir en un negocio de venta de comida. En la actualidad ella cuenta con un restaurante, se levanta a las 6 am para ir al mercado y comprar sus productos para preparar sus comidas que los vende desde el medio día hasta las 2 pm. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,300, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará: 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, fideos, aceite, etc. Lili esta muy feliz y satisfecha, por que puede apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios y también aporta a los gastos familiares y esta muy agradecida con el apoyo que le da Manuela Ramos para su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients for the preparation of restaurant food

loans.name: Pedro Joaquín

texts.es:
Mr. Gamez is a 48-year-old married father of 4 underage children. He lives in Unidad de Propósito, a neighborhood in the city of Managua.

Mr. Gamez has owned a snack bar, which he started with his own money, for 15 years. For a few months now, he has been having some difficulties running his business due to power outages in his neighborhood. Because of this problem, he has experienced drops in his sales.

He wants to use this loan to stock up on the products necessary to satisfy his customers’ needs. His future plans are to expand his business and sell other products, to prepare his children, and to live more comfortably.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Pedro tiene 48 años de edad, habita en Unidad de Propósito un barrio de la ciudad de Managua, es casado y tiene 4 hijos, de los cuales dos son menores de edad.

Don Pedro tiene un cafetín desde hace quince años, este negocio lo llevó a cabo con dinero propio. Desde hace algunos meses atrás debido a los cortes de luz en el lugar en el que habita ha tenido muchas dificultades, ya que ha tenido que cerrar temprano su negocio, es por eso que ha experimentado algunas bajas en sus ventas.

El dinero del préstamo lo quiere para invertir en capital de trabajo y abastecer de todos los productos necesarios para sastifacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Sus planes futuros son ampliar el negocio y vender otros artículos, preparar a sus hijos y vivir más cómodos.

loans.use: Purchase supplies needed to run a snack bar

loans.name: Tutiniso

texts.en:
Tutiniso B. has been an active client of the MicroInvest since 2003. The stability of her business and income helped her to repay her previous loan promptly. She started her business practically from scratch, and she now sells eggs in the central bazaar. She has many repeat customers because by working directly with suppliers she is able to offer highly competitive prices.

Now Mrs. B. is applying to KIVA for a business support loan of $350 US for 4 months to increase her inventory.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Ros

texts.en: Mr. Ros S., 36, is a motorcycle taxi driver while his wife is a housewife. They have three children and live in Chamkar Samrong Village, Battambang Province. Two of their children are bricklayers and their income can help to defray the family’s iving expenses. Because his motorcycle is old, Ros S. cannot attract many customers, so now he is asking for a loan to change his motorcycle. The loan will allow him to attract more customers and increase his income.

loans.use: To change his motorcycle

loans.name: Darcy Catherina

texts.es:
Darcy is a member of the Banco Comunal Buena Suerte community bank.

Darcy is married, is 37 years old and has 2 children. Darcy sells clothing, shoes, bedding and whatever her clients ask for. She carries out her sales on credit to factory workers, friends, and family. She collects her payments monthly or bi-weekly. She acquires her products in the city of Lima. Darcy also sells naturopathic products such as creams, oils, and other products for women in the area, selling to friends, family and companies.

Darcy requests a loan in the amount of 3000 soles. These funds will be invested in the purchase of slacks, shirts, jackets and polo shirts.

Darcy's dreams is to have a small exporting business for her naturopathic products, and to improve her businesses and consequently provide her children with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Darcy es socia del Banco Comunal Buena Suerte.

Darcy es casada, tiene 37 años y 2 hijos, Darcy vende ropa, calzados, edredones y todo cuanto le piden sus clientes, sus ventas son al crédito y ofrece a trabajadores de instituciones, amigos, familiares, los cobros lo realiza cada fin de mes o quincenal, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima. Además Darcy vende productos naturales como cremas, aceite, mates, entre otros productos que son producidos por mujeres organizadas de la zona, sus ventas lo realiza a amigos, familiares y en instituciones.

Darcy necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de pantalones, casacas, chompas, polos.

Los sueños de Darcy son tener una microempresa de exportación de productos naturales, mejorar sus negocios y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: Darcy requests a loan in the amount of 3000 soles.  These funds will be invested in the purchase of slacks, shirts, jackets, and polo shirts.

loans.name: Ana Jacinta

texts.es:
Ana, D. 40 años D. edad, socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen D. Asunción D. Carhuaz”, espera tener un restaurante más amplio donD. pueda atender a más clientes, ya que tiene L. ayuda D. su esposo como cocinero y el apoyo D. sus 5 hijos adolescentes.

DesD. hace 6 años, el restaurante “Las Delicias” sirve a diversos comensales en L. ciudad D. Carhuaz, departamento D. Ancash y es  atendido por los hijos D. Ana, quienes cumplen labores D. meseros.

Con el préstamo D. S/ 200, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará sacos D. arroz,  y D. azúcar, 1 caja D. aceite y con lo demás pagará L. academia preuniversitaria D. su segundo hijo.
texts.en:
Ana is 40 years old and is a member of the community bank “Virgen D. Asunción D. Carhuaz”. She hopes to have a bigger restaurant where she would be able to serve more clients. She already has a restaurant with the help of her spouse as a chef and the help of her five adolescent children. For the past 6 years, the restaurant “Las Delicias” has served diverse food in the city of Carhuaz, in the department of Ancash. It is attended by Ana’s children, who work as waiters. With this loan of S/ 200, which she would repay in 4 months, she would buy sacks of rice and sugar, 1 box of oil and with the rest she would pay for a college-prep academy for her second son.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, oil, etc.

loans.name: Abdujalil

texts.ru:
Абдучалил парень 1985 года рождения , не женат работает электриком на фабрике.В свободное время в выходные дни занимается уходом и откормом крупнорогатого скота. По мимо его ему в доме помогают его отец- пенсионер.
В момент мониторинга Абдучалил отсутствовал и мне пришлось сфотографировать его отца который занимался уходом за скотом. Абдучалил решил обратится в Микроинвест для расширения своего бизнеса животноводства.
texts.en:
Abdujalil is a guy who was born in 1985. Unmarried, he works as a factory electrician. In his free time on his days off, he cares for and feeds large-horned cattle. His retired father lives with him and helps out. Abdujalil was away at this time of the visit, so the author had to photograph his father, who (also) cares for the cattle. Abdujalil decided to apply to MicroInvest (for a loan) to expand his livestock business.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fattening of cattle

loans.name: Aniratu

texts.en:
Aniratu lives in Agege, Lagos state, Nigeria. She sells chickens and ducks in the market. Aniratu has been in this business for a long time. With her experience in this business she has been able to maintain a good communication with her customers, thereby retaining them.

Aniratu is 52 years old and married with 6 children. Aniratu is a LAPO client, and needs a loan to buy more ducks and chickens to sell. She is grateful to Kiva lenders and LAPO MICROFINANCE for their financial support.

loans.use: To buy more chickens and ducks to sell

loans.name: Ynes Altagracia  Mariano De Los Santos's Group
loans.use: To buy some crates of beers to add to her store.

loans.name: Mukaramakhon

texts.en:
Mukaramakhon describes herself as a enterprising girl with the goal to achieve successes in the future. She decided to start a sewing business to help her family with household expenses a year ago. She started out helping a woman who ran a tailoring shop. Being very nimble, she learned tailoring and soon began running her own business at the tailoring shop. It has gone very well since then, and she has been able to grow the business.

Mukaramakhon is requesting a loan of $600 USD to purchase materials so she can fulfill her customers' requests. The end of the year is fast approaching, and that is when demand is at its highest. She plans to repay the loan within 12 months. Mukaramakhon and her family are very grateful for your support in helping grow this business and move ahead.

More about Tajikistan

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and the birthplaces of the great Persian poet Rudaki and the most famous Islamic philosopher, Ibn Sina (Avicenna). The country is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Today it remains a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war that ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R. further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

About IMON International

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase materials for sewing national dresses

loans.name: Joaquin

texts.es: El señor Joaquín T. tiene una barbería en la capital de Guatemala ya tiene 8 años en este trabajo, mucha gente ya lo conoce en su colonia y conocen el trabajo que el desempeña, el es soltero y asiste a una iglesia cristiana donde ya lleva 10 años de asistir. El sueña con comprar una silla giratoria y tener un trabajador en su local para poder crecer como empresario y estar mejor económicamente  ya que el primer préstamo le ayudo bastante el espera en Dios que este préstamo también yo ayude mucho en su negocio.
texts.en:
Joaquin T. owns a barbershop in the capital of Guatemala and has been working as a barber for the past 8 years. Many people in his neighborhood already know him and the work that he carries out. He is single and attends a Christian church that he has attended for the past 10 years. He dreams of purchasing a revolving chair and having an employee in his shop so that he may be able to grow as a businessman; he also dreams of being in a better economic situation. Given that his first loan helped him greatly, he hopes to God that this loan will also help him a great deal in his business.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase furnishings and equipment for his barbershop.

loans.name: Emile

texts.fr: Emile K. est propriétaire d’un pressing à Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Il opère dans ce secteur depuis 6 ans et souhaite avec ce crédit acheter un nouvel appareil à laver pour rendre un service plus prompt à la clientèle. Ce faisant, il gagnera plus la confiance de sa clientèle et ceci va lui permettre d’accroître son chiffre d’affaires et par conséquent ses profits. Dans la vue il est assis à l’extrême gauche à coté de l’une de ses employés
texts.en:
Emile K. is the owner of a cleaner's in Lomé, the capital of Togo. He has been active in this sector for 6 years and hopes with this loan to buy a new washing machine so that he can provide prompter service to his clientele. In this way, he will gain the confidence of his clientele and this will allow him to increase his sales and thus his profits. In the photo he is seated on the far left, beside one of his employees.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying a new washing machine

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a clothing and bag seller in the Mwanjelwa neighborhood of Mbeya. She belongs to Makunguru group loan (Group code 2004).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $105. She works 12 hours a day at her business. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothing and bags for her business. She hopes that with this loan her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Grace is 42 years old, widowed, and has five children. She also cares for five additional dependents.

loans.use: To buy more clothing and bags for her business.

loans.name: Yaovi Éric

texts.fr: Monsieur S. yaovi éric a appris la couture, il a ouvert  son atelier de couture qu’il appelle « CHEZ ERIC LE ROI », il a commencé ce commerce depuis 1988 et il vend aussi des articles de mercerie, ce qui fait qu’il a une importante clientèle, actuellement son matériel de travail est vétuste, il a besoin d’un crédit pour renouveler son matériel de travail  ainsi avec ce nouveau crédit il achètera 01 machine à coudre, 01 sous compteur et des articles de mercerie. Il est marié et père de 02 enfants.
texts.en:
Mr. S. Yaovi Eric learned how to sew clothing. He opened a tailor’s shop he calls “CHEZ ERIC LE ROI”. He started this business in 1988, and he also sells supplies of the trade. As a result, he has a sizable number of customers. Right now, his equipment is antiquated. He needs a loan to renew his equipment. Thus, with this new loan, he will buy a sewing machine, a metering device, and tailoring supplies. He is married and the father of two children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a metering device and tailoring supplies

loans.name: Pascazia

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 38-year-old Pascalia F. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with four children between the ages of 1 and 9. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependents because their parents cannot take care of them. 

Pascalia has been running a clothes business since 2006. She works at the business for 9 to 12 hours per day, seven days a week. Pascalia currently earns about US $200 from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase stock in bulk. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Pascazia thanks you for your support!
	
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: Purchase additional stock of clothes in bulk.

loans.name: Suliat

texts.en:
Suliat is a fashion designer and she also sells school sandals. She is 38 years old and married to K. who is also a fashion designer. They have two children.

Suliat is requesting the loan of N140,000 to purchase more school sandals to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more school sandals to sell

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros sells snacks in the high school building just beside her house. She is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000 to purchase more goods and snacks to sell at her school vending business. She also sells ready-made food and vegetables to some of the other villagers. According to her, she is able to earn around PHP 3,000 a month and uses it to provide her family with necessities. Milagros hopes to become financially stable and she wished her family will always be healthy.

“Only those who are diligent will survive” shared Milagros; this has been her main principle in life. She is 60 years old and is married to a farmer, Antonio A.. They live in the peaceful village of San Lorenzo Ilagan, Isabela and they are blessed with five children; Elito, Edwin, Evelyn, Emelyn, and Marilyn. Milagros feels lucky to have her children who are very supportive and responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more goods

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris G. is 43 years old and a married mother with three kids. All the kids are currently in school. She says selling of lingerie, jewelry, and slippers, especially for women, is very profitable and therefore she has been selling ladies' lingerie, slippers, jewelry, and clothes in the local market for two years to help her husband take care of the family’s needs.

With the loan, Doris wants to buy bales of lingerie, slippers, clothes and jewelry to increase her inventory and sales for good income. She believes this loan would help her save some money to start paying part of the children's school fees and the utility bills. She is a member of the group called ‘Nkunimde’ which means victory.

loans.use: To buy bales of lingerie, jewelry, slippers etc.

loans.name: Sergio Alberto

texts.es:
El señor Sergio Alberto vive con su esposa y familia; el labora como supervisor en una empresa desde hace 8 años. 
Son una familia estable y unida hacia un mismo objetivo que es “lograr un mejor estilo de vida “. Ellos por el momento están solicitando este crédito para la colocación de protecciones en la puerta delantera y la puerta trasera de su hogar, para mayor protección de la familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Sergio Alberto lives with his wife and family. He has been working as a supervisor at an enterprise for 8 years. They are a stable and united family with the goal "to achieve a better life style". At the moment they are requesting this loan to place protections for the front and back doors of their home, in order to improve the security of the family.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Place protections for front and back doors.

loans.name: Nyame Asem Group

texts.en:
Kwasi is thirty-two years old. He is married and has four children. He is a petty trader. He runs a provisions store.

Kwasi is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Nyame Asem’ which literally means God’s Word. He is the only male in the group photograph. The members of this group are mostly petty traders, food vendors and/or farmers. They work to support their spouses to provide for their families.

They buy their raw materials or goods from other towns and sometimes from nearby communities and sell them at the local market square. Some of them trek to other towns to sell on their market days as well. The members have been in business for some time and have amassed a great deal of experience in their businesses. It is in light of this that they are requesting for a loan to procure more goods to expand their businesses.

The members of the group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan. It is their desire to give their children a good education.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Coumba Gédou

texts.fr: La dame Coumba Gédou S. est âgée de 53ans, mariée et mère de 10 enfants. Elle fait du commerce de produits cosmétiques. Les revenus générés lui permettent d’assurer à ses enfants une scolarité, une bonne santé et de meilleures conditions de vie.
texts.en:
Coumba Gedou S. is 53 years old, married and mother to 10 children. She is in the cosmetics business. The revenues generated allow her to ensure her children an education, good health and a better quality of life.

Translated from French by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Crane Group

texts.en:
Fredy R., age 35, is widower with three children ages 8, 4 and 2 years. He has a hardware business that he started 5 years ago. He works daily from 8am until 6pm. He is able to earn a monthly profit of around $228.
 
This will be R.’s 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He hopes to get a loan to increase his hardware stock.
	
R. will share this loan with his loan group, Crane Group, which has 17 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans. In the picture, R. is 2nd from left at the back.

loans.use: Increase his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Achat des pièces détachées de motos

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites G. is from the village of Malangka, Gingoog City, in the Philippines. She is twenty-four years-old and married with three young children. Marites owns and operates a mini-restaurant called a "carenderia". While not the only revenue generator, the main source of income for the business comes from serving a variety of different meals to local customers. Marites has run her business for over four years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP per month from it.

In 2009, Marites joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marites is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase food and drinks for the restaurant. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Marites from HSPFI. She plans to save the additional revenue generated from the business as a reserve for future emergencies.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase food and drink for a restaurant

location.town: Malangka, Barangay 25, Gingoog City, Misamis Orien

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Teresa es una mujer muy alegre de 33 años, vive con su pareja y padre de sus 8 hijos, en su casa. Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, también tiene algunos cultivos, pero aunque estos no le brindan muchas ganancia logra suplir sus necesidades diarias. Por ello, adicionalmente a su siembra plátanos y café, atiende su tienda desde las 5 de la tarde, donde recibe muy amablemente a sus clientes,  ya que gracias a ellos su negocio va creciendo poco a poco. Pero el anhelo de Teresa es trasladarse  a una  zona más poblada, donde sus ganancias se incrementen. Bajo esa mira, su esposo también trabaja arduamente como jornalero, ganando diariamente 18 soles y algunas veces usan ese dinero como capital de la tienda. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y en su crédito anterior nunca se retrasó en los pagos, por lo contrario, es muy puntual y asiste a todas las reuniones de su banco comunal. El dinero que ahora solicita lo piensa invertir en el incremento de mercadería de su tienda de comestibles.
texts.en:
Teresa is a very happy 33 year old woman. She lives with her life partner and father of their eight children in her house. For two years she has been selling groceries. She also has some crops. Even though these do not provide much income, she is able to provide the daily necessities. To do so, she has added banana and coffee plants. She works in her store from five in the afternoon. She very kindly welcomes her customers. Thanks to them, the business is growing little by little. But, Teresa’s wish is to move to a more populated area where her earnings will increase. Her husband also works arduously as a day laborer. He earns 18 soles daily, and sometimes they use this money as capital for the store. This is her second loan with MFP, and she was never late with her payments on her previous loan. To the contrary, she is very punctual and goes to all of her communal bank meetings. The money she is now asking for is to increase merchandise in her grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Mable's Group

texts.en:
K. Mable is the leader of her lending group in Ibanda. She is 56 years old and married with nine children, and she takes care of two more dependents. Mable is a business lady who has been selling hides and skins from Ibanda town for 12 years. 

Out of her transactions, Mable is able to make 400,000 UGX in profit a month, which helps to take care of her family with feeding, medical care, clothing and school fees. She has been successful because of her quality products that attract as many customers as possible -- even those from Kampala, which is about 300 kilometers away. 

She has a dream of expanding her business further by putting in more capital, hence increasing profit as well as having a happy family. Mable is a very hard-working lady and she needs a loan to help increase her business volume for more returns.

loans.use: Buying more hides and skins for her business expansion.

loans.name: 21 De Enero Group

texts.es: El grupo "21 D. Enero" esta representado por la señora Marianela y conformada por 12 socias D. las cuales un 50 % son profesionales que desarrollan actividades comerciales como la venta D. ropa juvenil, perfumes, joyas, una D. las socia tiene su salón D. belleza y el socio participante venD. productos varios al por mayor, es un buen vendedor porque cortantemente está en contacto con sus clientes para no perder su mercado D. venta, la presidenta venD. joyas D. plata y joyas bañadas en oro, es una buena vendedora ya que las joyas las venD. a crédito  o al contado; todas se conocen hace tiempo y tienen una estima muy especial entre ellas, tienen muchas expectativas para el futuro D. mejorar y seguir creciendo más cada día por el bien D. sus familias. En el ámbito comercial la competencia es alta, pero año tras año las socias luchan para tener un ingreso diario que sustente a su familia. El destino del financiamiento es para la adquisición D. mayor mercadería para ampliar sus tiendas y también para la compra D. puestos fijos. . A pesar D. ser su primer ciclo los socios ya cuenta con experiencia en grupos solidarios gracias a entidades financieras similares a la Fundación Agocapital con la cual se encuentran agradecidos por la confianza y el apoyo económico brindado.
texts.en:
The group "21 D. Enero" (January 21st) has twelve members and is represented by Sra. Marianela. Fifty percent of the members are merchants selling children clothes, perfumes and jewelry. One of the members has a beauty salon. Another member sells different wholesale products. He is in constant contact with his clients in order not to lose his market; he is a great salesperson. The group’s president sells silver and gold plated jewelry. She gives her clients the option to pay by cash or in installments; she is a great businesswoman. They have all known each other for a long time and have a special affection towards each other. For the sake of their families’ future, they have high expectations for the future growth of their businesses.
There is high competition in their businesses, but year after year the group members have worked hard to ensure they sell enough to support their families.
This loan will be used to buy merchandise to expand their businesses and to buy a retail space. Although this is their first loan, they have a lot of experience with other communal banks thanks to other financial institutions similar to Fundación AgroCapital. They are thankful for the trust and financial support that Fundacion AgroCapital has given them.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise to expand their businesses.

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Djiguissèmè sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne  d’âge de 37 ans et 4 enfants. Avec leur mari et enfants elles vivent  dans des grandes familles traditionnelles et  résident dans la ville de Dioïla, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali. 
Elles se sont connues par des liens de voisinage et de parentés. Elles exercent le commerce  d’articles divers pour aider leur mari. Ces femmes ont intégrés  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pérenniser leurs activités lucratives. 
Elles sont leur premier prêt de groupe avec l’institution. 
Avec ce prêt elles comptent acheter, une grande quantité de fruits et légumes et  beaucoup d’articles divers. Les articles divers sont achetés à Bamako et les fruits et légumes sont achetés sur place et dans les villages  environnants. Elles vendent  sur place à Dioïla à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.  
Elles envisagent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 49 900FCFA par personne. Les bénéfices sont d’une part réinvestis dans l’activité et d’autre part dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The members of the Djiguissèmè Group are married women, with an average age of 37 and 4 children. They live together with their husbands and their children in large traditional families in the city of Dioïla, District of Dioïla, in the region of Koulikoro, Republic of Mali. They met each other through family and neighborhood connections. To help their husbands, they have a retail business and sell various products. These women have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, hoping to improve their business. With this first loan, they intend to buy a considerable amount of fruits and vegetables, as well as several other products. They buy all these different items in Bamako, while fruits and vegetables come from their own neighborhood. Their customers are men and women of their hometown, Dioïla.

They aim to achieve an individual monthly profit of 49 900FCFA. Part of this profit will be invested in their business, the rest will be used to provide for the daily expenses of their families.

Translated from French by MONICA URBAN, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits, vegetables and other products

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.en:
Ignacio P. is from the village of Sta Rosa. He is 41 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Ignacio owns and operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing electrical repairs in the local community. Ignacio has been engaged in his business for over a year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.
Ignacio joined Kiva partner ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide his services. This loan will be his sixth from ASKI. Ignacio plans to use the additional revenue generated from his business to pay his children's tuition fees.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide his services

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en: Ernesto P. is from the city of San Luis, Tarlac. He is 42 years old. Ernesto is single. To make a living, Ernesto owns & operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing transportation services in the local community. Ernesto has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2009, Ernesto joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ernesto has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. Ernesto is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide his service. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Ernesto from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Socheat

texts.en:
Miss. Socheat Y., 29, is single and lives with her mother, sisters and brothers on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Socheat has been a silk weaver for five years, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to a middleman, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh market.

The house where Socheat lives is old and broken down, so she decided to build a new one. But, she doesn’t have money to pay to build it. Hence, she is asking for her first loan of US$1,000 for this purpose.

loans.use: To pay for house construction

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina D. is a 24-year-old mother of a two-year-old child and a wife of a 27-year-old construction worker. While she still has only one small child, she wants to invest in growing a business so that by the time her family has grown she will have the finances in place to support it. 

Aside from the food selling business which she had started through her previous loans from ASHI, Gina now wants another loan for an additional business which is pig fattening. 

With this kind of business, Gina can maximize her time at home while taking care of her two-year-old child. After four months of fattening her pig, she can sell it either alive or slaughter it and sell its pork per kilo in the neighborhood. The profit with this is not much but is fair enough. But once a large volume of pigs are fattened and sold at one time, the profit would be as much as double its capital and this is what Gina envisions.

loans.use: Piglets for a pig fattening business

loans.name: Aydin

texts.en:
Aydin J. is a 43-year-old trader who sells furniture in the small village of Agsu city. He is married and has four children who are the meaning of his life.

Aydin has ten years of experience in selling furniture. He wishes to save money to provide his children with an education. He needs to invest in his shop and purchase more furniture and for this purpose he applied for 1,600 AZN.

loans.use: To purchase more furniture to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her husband to use for commuting

loans.name: Carmen Patricia

texts.es:
Carmen Patricia D. G. se dedica tanto a la venta por catálogo de ropa masculina y femenina, de perfumes y de accesorios, como a la elaboración de bolsos, blusas, manteles y tejidos en hilo. Tiene 34 años y vive con sus dos hijos varones de 6 y 9 años en la Ciudadela 20 de Julio en Barranquilla, un barrio que presenta una combinación de zonas comerciales y residenciales; en este barrio encontramos centros comerciales, supermercados, el Estadio Metropolitano de fútbol, estaderos, tabernas y múltiples conjuntos residenciales de edificios y casas.
Carmen inició su negocio en el año 2000 cuando una vecina le enseñó a tejer y todavía trabajaba como impulsadora en almacenes de Barranquilla. El nacimiento de su hijo en el 2001 la obligó a dejar de laborar como empleada y a dedicarse a la crianza del bebé. La mayoría de sus clientes son vecinos, amigos, familiares y recomendados; aunque  hay bastante competencia, se sostiene por la calidad de su servicio  y los precios que ofrece; ella cada 21 días compra productos por catálogo y también  otras mercancías que no tienen los catálogos, pero siempre lo hace  sobre pedido. Ha tenido 3 préstamos anteriores con la Fundación que le ha permitido aumentar sus ingresos y educar a sus hijos. Con este crédito,  por valor de  $ 1.500.000 que ahora solicita, quiere invertirlo en la compra de mercancías por catálogo como ropa, perfumes, accesorios, hilos al por mayor y de contado y además, planifica comprar maniguetas de madera y piedras ornamentales. Carmen dice que su mayor desafío es la falta de capital de trabajo y la falta de una casa propia; más adelante, sueña con comprarla y expandir su negocio con los créditos que les otorga la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.
texts.en:
Carmen Patricia D. G. sells merchandise through catalogs such as men’s and women’s clothing, perfumes, and accessories. She also produces hand-knitted purses, blouses, tablecloths, and fabrics. Carmen is 34 years old and has two sons, ages 6 and 9. She lives in the July 20th neighborhood of Barranquilla, which is a mixture of business and residential areas. In this neighborhood, you will find shopping centers, supermarkets, the metropolitan soccer stadium, inns, taverns, and numerous residential buildings and houses.

Carmen started her business in 2000 when a neighbor taught her how to knit. She was still working as a salesperson at a department store in Barranquilla. The birth of her son in 2001 forced her to quit her job so that she could dedicate herself to taking care of her baby. Her customers consist of neighbors, friends, relatives, and people who have been recommended to her. Although there is significant competition, she maintains her clientele because of the quality of her service and the prices she offers. Every 21 days, she places orders for her catalog products and also purchases items that are not found in the catalogs but are frequently requested. She has had three previous loans with the Foundation that have enabled her to increase her income and educate her children.

With this loan of 1,500,000 COP that she requested, Carmen will invest in the purchase of catalog merchandise such as clothing, perfumes, accessories, as well as wholesale yarn for cash. She also plans to buy wooden utensils and ornaments made of stone. Carmen says her biggest challenges are the lack of operating capital and not having her own home. Sometime later, she dreams of buying a house and expanding her business with the loans provided by Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing, perfumes, accessories, yarn, wooden utensils, and stone ornaments

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es:
El señor Miguel Ángel SalI. O., es trabajador de la escuela Marcos Dessys  de Chinandega se desempeña como maestro de primaria es soltero sin hijos y aun está estudiando en la Universidad.

El señor Miguel Ángel SalI. O., solicito el crédito para pagar su matrícula  en la Universidad y para materiales  de estudio.
texts.en:
Miguel Ángel SalI. O. works at Marcos Dessys School in Chinadega. He is a primary school teacher. He is single without children. He is even taking university classes. Miguel Ángel SalI. O. is asking for a loan to pay for his university registration fees and study materials.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: University registration fees and study materials

loans.name: Dominic Kiguta

texts.en:
Dominic is 33 years old and married to Esther, who is a businesswoman. They are blessed with two children: a son aged four years and a daughter aged two years.

Dominic is a tailor by profession and he has been in the tailoring business for the past six years. He has applied for a loan to purchase fabric for making curtains, since there is high demand for them. He will also use his loan to restock different fabrics, so clients will have a larger selection. He also needs to add a sewing machine and create employment for someone else to help him. With the extra profit expected from the business, he intends to open a tailoring school to train others .
 
Dominic hopes to expand his clothing business and export his own clothes. He describes himself as a hard-working business man who is focused and ambitious.

loans.use: To purchase fabric for curtains and add another sewing machine

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio Cesar forma parte del banco comunal “VALLE SAGRADO”,  tiene  56 años, tiene dos hijas y es docente jubilado. Su principal actividad económica es hacer servicios de moto taxi. Ya son dos años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. Julio Cesar es una persona, responsable y emprendedor que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario ayudar a su familia. Julio Cesar requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento del moto taxi comprará repuestos y llantas. El socio es presidente de “La Asociación de Moto Taxi Valle Sagrado” que está conformado por 76 socios. 

El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente.
texts.en:
Julio Cesar is a member of the “VALLE SAGRADO” (“Sacred Valley”) communal bank. He is a retired teacher who is 56 years old and has two daughters. His main economic activity is providing a moto taxi service. He has made a living from this business for two years and it is going very well. Julio Cesar is a very responsible and enterprising man who spends every moment looking for opportunities to get ahead and makes an effort every day to help his family. Julio Cesar needs a loan so that he can do maintenance work on his moto taxi, and will use the money to purchase spare parts and tires. He is president of the “Valle Sagrado Moto Taxi Association”, an organization that has 76 members. Julio Cesar is grateful for the opportunity he is being given through this loan, and he agrees to complete all of his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance work on his moto taxi.

loans.name: Khalida's Group

texts.en:
Khalida, a resident of Borewala (famous for its shrines), Pakistan, is the wife of G. M. and the mother of two sons. The elder son works in a factory on monthly wage and the younger one operates a flower shop where he sells fresh flowers. 
A very caring lady, Khalida stays at home to cook food for her family. She cooks food on time and presents it to her family and manages the household chores efficiently. Her husband is involved in a construction supplies selling business. He specifically sells cement to customers because of the high demand from his customers. He has been doing this work for over twenty years.  
Khalida has successfully completed two loans to Asasah. With the loan profit she bought a color television and a bicycle for her son. Now she is applying for the third time to invest the capital in her husband’s business so that he can purchase the cement in bulk and complete the orders of his customers.

loans.use: To purchase cement to complete the customer's orders.

loans.name: Asinio

texts.es: Asinio tiene 29 años, es un joven muy trabajador y responsable, vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es sobresalir en la vida. Los largos días de trabajo que Asinio realiza en su chacra tanto de café, maíz y achiote, le han servido para obtener los ingresos económicos que necesita para mantenerse. Todas las mañanas sale en dirección a sus cultivos para cuidarlos y trabajarlos, ya que sabe que así obtendrá una cosecha de buena calidad. Lleva 11 años realizando esta actividad y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus tierras. Con el tiempo espera mejorar la calidad de sus productos, fertilizando mejor sus tierras. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, si quiere acceder a otro en el futuro. En su grupo comunal, es un socio muy querido, ya que es el más joven del grupo. Con los mil seiscientos nuevos soles que solicita, contratará peones, para que limpien y trabajen sus tierras.
texts.en:
Asinio is 29 years old. He is a very hard-working and responsible young man. He lives in his own house, and what he most desires is to be outstanding in life. The long days of work that Asinio puts in on his farm, where he grows coffee, corn, and achiote, have enabled him to obtain the economic income that he needs to support himself. Every morning he goes out to his crops to take care of them and work on them, since he knows that in this way he will obtain a good quality harvest. He has been doing this work for 11 years, and what he likes most about his work is harvesting his crops, and he considers fumigating his land to be the most difficult task. In time, he hopes to improve the quality of his products by fertilizing his lands better. This is his third loan with MFP, and he knows that he has to make all his payments on time if he wants to be granted another loan in the future. In his community bank, he is a very well-liked member, since he is the youngest in the group. With the 1600 PEN that he is applying for, he will hire workers to clean and work on his land.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: hire workers to help him clean and plow his fields

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Nenita N. is from the village of Pigsag an Cagayan de Oro City. She is 55 years old. Nenita is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Nenita runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Nenita has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month for these activities. In 2008, Nenita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nenita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Nenita is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Nenita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Lum

texts.en:
Born in 1956, Lum J. is married to A. John Awah and they have brought forth five children. A woman who does not like to depend on the husband for all the family needs, and finding it so difficult to accomplish this task, Lum J. joined GHAPE in 1998.

She also has been having marital problems which causes her to be sad all the time but she is appreciative of the fact that she is alive. Her desire is to give her children love and education. She states that she feels better each time she provides something small to her children.

Her inability to get investment capital which could consistently generate income for her to meet her children’s needs is what motivated her to obtain a loan from GHAPE.  With her loan she plans to buy a two-wheel motorcycle. She knows this business will succeed because she is located at a good business site and she is a good rider for the motorcycle.

She plans to use the profits generated to sponsor her children in school and to cater for the basic needs of her family. She plans to pay her loan in 24 months. The first installment repayment shall be done on the fourth month of loan disbursement.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works toward the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.

Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Purchase a two wheel motorcycle.

loans.name: Costa Brava Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Costa Brava se eligió este nombre para este grupo, por L. región D. L. costa D. Pinotepa Nacional, esta historia es acerca del señor Joniy D. L. C. Morales es uno D. los integrantes D. este grupo, el es casado, tiene 30 años es padre D. un niño D. 3 años y es carpintero.

El nos platica que se decidió por este oficio ya que lo aprendió desD. que era niño ya que su papá era carpintero y le heredo las herramientas para que el siguiera trabajando, dice que es un buen negocio ya que se obtienen muy buenos ingresos, el crédito que le otorgaron lo va a invertir en L. compra D. mas materiales para seguir trabajando como: madera, pegamento y pintura. 

Las ganancias que obtiene D. L. venta D. su negocio, le están beneficiando mucho a el y a su familia, ya que ahora están pudiendo tener un poco mas D. solvencia económica y ahora que ya su hijo va a entrar al preescolar y tienen que comprarle su material escolar también le esta ayudando D. mucho. 

Dice que con su negocio esta beneficiando mucho a las personas D. su comunidad ya que no hay muchas carpinterías en L. población y tienen que ir muy lejos para poder encargar lo que necesitan, pero ahora ya no lo que hacen, puesto que tuenen L. carpintería D. Don Joniy  muy cerca.

El propósito que el tiene es ver crecer a su hijo y apoyarlo para que siga estudiando, y pueda tener una carrera y una muy buena profesión, también desea tener una carpintería mas granD.  para apoyar a su mamá, ya que L. señora es viuda y él L. ayuda económicamente y para mejorar su nivel D. vida.

Platica que todos los integrantes D. su grupo, son muy confiables, responsables y trabajadores ya que tienen tiempo D. conocerse.

El señor Joniy da las gracias a FRAC y KIVA por que gracias a ellos ha podido lograr tener su propio negocio y asi cambiar su vida y L. D. su familia.

Los integrantes D. costa brava y las actividades a L. que se dedican son las siguientes:
Joniy D. L. C. Morales-carpintería
Clemencia Marroquín R.-antojitos
Albina D. L. R.-repostería
Nelida Cristina M. C.-repostería
Sixto Ricardo H. S.-carpintería
Gloria López C.-tienda D. ropa
Jacinto Raúl López T.-lavado D. autos
Florentino P.-pescadería
FabioL. Leonarda López Damián-antojitos
Valenta S. Nicolás-tienda D. ropa
texts.en:
The group is called Costa Brava after the region of the National Pinotepa coast. This is the story of Joniy D. L. C. Morales, one of the group members. He is married, 30 years old, the father of a three-year old boy and a carpenter. He explains that he chose this profession because he learned it as a child as his father was a carpenter and left him his tools so he'd be able to work. He says it is a good business that provides him with a good income. He is going to use the loan to invest in the purchase of materials to continue working, including wood, glue and paint. The earnings he is getting out of the business benefit him and his family very much. He is now financially more secure, which is going to help now that his son is starting preschool and they will have to buy school materials for him. He also says that his business is benefitting the community as there aren't many carpenters in the town and people used to have to go far to order what they need. That's no longer the case, as they now have Joiy's carpenter's worshop nearby. His main goal is to see his son grow up and support him through his studies so that he can have a career and a good profession. He would also like a larger workshop to support his mother, who is a widow and whom he helps financially, and to improve his standard of living. He mentions that all group members are very reliable and responsible workers now they have had the chance to know each other. Joniy would like to thank FRAC and KIVA because they have enabled him to own his own business and change his life and his family's. Costa Brava group members and their business activities are: Joniy D. L. C. Morales - carpentry M. Clemencia R. - snacks Albina D. L. R. - confectionery Nelida Cristina M. C. - confectionery Sixto Ricardo H. S. - carpentry Gloria L. C. - clothing store Jacinto Raul L. T. - car wash Florentino Pena -fishmongers FabioL. Leonarda L. D. -snacks Valenta S. N. - clothing store

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wood and paint

loans.name: Robert

texts.es: Robert, de 44 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y trabajador, vive solo en su casa propia y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. El trabajo que realiza Robert es el cultivo de Manzanilla, esta actividad le ha dado los ingresos necesarios para mantenerse, es por eso que todos los días trabaja arduamente en sus sembríos. Él ha visto por conveniente llevar sus productos hasta la ciudad de Tarma, ya que según manifiesta, es ahí donde mejores ganancias obtiene. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas de insectos que pueden amenazar su productividad, lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos, ya que el camino es muy largo y agotador. Con el tiempo, espera que sus cultivos mejoren y con su venta pueda mejorar sus ingresos económicos. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, se siente en la obligación de pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su grupo comunal, en donde es muy querido. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Robert, 44, is a very unassuming, hard working man. He lives alone in his own house and his greatest wish is to improve his quality of life. Robert is a chamomile grower. This activity has provided income sufficient for him to support himself. This is why he works hard every day on his crops. He has deemed it advisable to sell his products all the way in Tarma because, as he states, that is where profits are best. What he enjoys most about his work is caring that his crops are free from insect infestations that can affect yields. He has been in this line of work for 5 years and considers the most trying aspects of it having to transport his crops to market because the journey is long and exhausting. In time, he hopes his crops will improve so that their sales will improve his income. This is his 3rd loan with MFP and he feels obliged to repay on time because he doesn’t want to cause any problems for his fellow group members where he is well liked. He will use the requested 1000 new soles to buy more manure for his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more manure.

loans.name: Pantaleon Remigio

texts.es:
Pantaleon de 52 años, es mecánico de autos y vive en una zona periurbana en el Paraíso de Guayaquil.

Empezó desde pequeño como aprendiz de automóviles, cuando creció para poder mantener a su familia y por la falta de oportunidades el tuvo que trabajar desde como mecánico, ubico el taller en la parte delantera de su casa, pero por las lluvias se vuelve muy lodoso porque su casa esta ubicada en una loma. 
 
Con el préstamo quiere comprar filtros y herramientas para su negocio, en el futuro quiere vender aceites para carros y construir mejor su casa.
texts.en:
Pantaleon is 52 years old, a mechanic, and lives in a suburban area called Paraiso de Guayaquil. He began as a mechanic apprentice when he was young. When he grew up, he had to work as a mechanic in order to maintain his family and for the lack of opportunities. His workshop is in the front part his house but the rain has caused it to become very muddy, since it is located on a hill. With this loan, he would like to purchase filters and tools for his business. In the future, he wants to sell oil for cars and better construct his house.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Filters and tools.

loans.name: Heang

texts.en:
Mrs. Heang S. is a 26-year-old farmer who lives in Kompong Tom Province. She is married to Sal Soeun, age 28. This couple, who work together in the farming business, has given birth to a young child who attends school.
