loans.use: Wood and roofing materials to construct a kiosk; food for a restaurant business and fruit to sell

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
La señora Maria Cristina es socia del Banco Comunal “Flor de Canela”, ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia de Puno, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 60 años de edad, de estado civil soltera y es madre de 02 hijos, ella pudo estudiar solo la primaria completa.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 1 año, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para la preparación de comida.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional de S/. 600.00 Nuevos soles, el préstamo le servirá para poder comprar papa, arroz, carne, aceite, combustible, etc. Para poder preparar comida que vende en forma ambulatoria y también atiende pedidos.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando así ayudar a sus hijos y luego poner un restaurante.

A ella le gustan las reuniones y las facilidades en los pagos
texts.en:
Señora Maria Cristina is a member of the Flor de Canela (Cinnamon Flower) Community Bank in the district of Puno, Puno province, Puno department. She is 60 years old, single, has two children, and completed her primary education. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos organisation for one year. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to buy ingredients for making food. She now needs an additional loan of 600 soles to buy potatoes, rice, meat, oil, and fuel etc so that she can prepare food which she sells in the street. She also accepts orders. Maria Cristina wishes to continue working so that she can help her children and open a restaurant. She enjoys the meetings and the credit facilities associated with her bank.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy potatoes, rice, meat, oil, fuel etc

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es:
Ana es socia del Banco Comunal Sauces de Compañía.
Ana es conviviente, tiene 27 años y 2 hijos, Ana junto a su esposo se dedican a la fabricación de ladrillos artesanales, el quemado del ladrillo lo realizan en el horno de su suegro.
Ana necesita un préstamo de 300 soles dinero que será invertido en el pago de los peones.
Los sueños de Ana son mejorar su negocio y tener casa propia.
texts.en:
Ana is a member of the Communal Bank “Sauces de Compañía”. She is 27 years old, in a common law marriage, and has 2 children. Together with her husband, they operate a business making handmade bricks, which are baked in an oven owned by her father-in-law.

She needs a loan of 300 soles in order for her to pay her workers. Ana dreams of improving her business and owning her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay her workers

loans.name: Oeu

texts.en: Oeu S., 41, is married and resides with her husband (pictured) and three children in the Takeo province. To earn a living, she has been selling rice and palm sugar from her home. These activities are able to make her approximately US $2 of profit every day. Her husband is a construction worker and is able to earn US $7 per day. Due to the high transportation costs that her husband pays every day, Mrs. Oeu is asking for a loan from Kiva to purchase a motorbike. This will help reduce the transportation costs.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Jessica Carolina

texts.es:
la joven Jessica Carolina V. tiene 24 años de edad, es soltera y vive con sus hermanos en la casa de su madre, su mama radica en USA, viven solos, Jessica se graduo de la secundaria y se dedica al comercio desde hace 1 año, vende lociones y perfumes al credito en diferentes colonias y caserios de la Ciudad de San Lorenzo, Jessica sale todas las mañanas a vender su producto en bicicleta, ahorita necesita un credito para poder ir a la frontera con el Salvador para comprar mas mercaderia y asi tener mayor variedad de productos, tiene muchos clientes ya que vende barato y sus lociones huelen muy bien.
Jessica tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante, espera conseguirse un buen hombre para casarse con el y salir adelante los dos, en la mirada de ella se le nota un vacio ya que dice que extraña mucho a su madre.
texts.en:
The young woman, Jessica Carolina V., is 24 years old, single, and lives with her brothers in her mother's house. Her mother is settled in the USA, so they live alone. Jessica graduated from high school and has been working in business for a year, selling perfume and lotion on credit in different districts and neighborhoods in San Lorenzo City. Every morning, Jessica goes out on her bicycle to sell her products. She needs a loan right now to be able to go to the border of El Salvador to buy more merchandise to have a greater variety of products. She has a lot of clients because her prices are cheap and her lotions smell good. Jessica would very much like to prosper, and she hopes to meet a good man to marry so they can prosper together. She has an empty look in her eyes because, as she says, she misses her mother a lot.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: compra de lociones y perfumes

loans.name: Tseden-Ish

texts.en:
O. is 36 years old and lives with her husband and three children in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her oldest daughter, 11 years old, attends a local secondary school while the younger two children, 4 and 2 years old, stay at home. 

O. and her husband operate two businesses: the first, a used shoe retail business and the second, a restaurant. O. is mainly responsible for their restaurant, which they began in 2008 by purchasing an older restaurant in their town. Her husband is responsible for their shoe retail business, which they began in 2000 by renting a stall in the local market. Because of the success with their restaurant, they are planning on opening a second location in their town. 

O. is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug loan in order to purchase more used shoes and other goods to sell in their stall.

loans.use: To purchase more used shoes and other goods to sell in their stall

loans.name: Luis Rodolfo

texts.es:
Rodolfo se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche lo comercializa con los acopiadores mayoristas como ser Pil Andina y Delicia (Plantas Industrializadoras de Leche), es soltero y vive en la casa de sus Padres en la comunidad Irpa Chico Prov. Ingavi a hora y media de la Ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinara en la compra de una vaca lechera y así incrementar la producción de leche para poder tener mejores ingresos.

Es el primer crédito con IMPRO, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Rodolfo.
texts.en:
Rodolfo raises dairy cattle in order to produce milk to sell to wholesalers such as Pil Andina and Delicia (industrial milk plants). He is single and lives with his parents in the community of Irpa Chico, Ingavi Province, which 1½ hours away from the city of El Alto.

Rodolfo will use his loan to buy another dairy cow so that he can increase his milk production and generate better earnings. This is his first loan with IMPRO. His evaluation indicates he is qualified for approval of this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Oybarchin

texts.ru: Соатова Ойбарчин проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст 35 лет. Замужем, имеет 3 детей. Муж находится в России на заработках. Сама Ойбарчин более 14 лет занимается выращиванием овощей и пшеницы. Она выращивает, одну часть продает, а другую оставляет для своего употребления. Кредит просит дял покупки семян и удобрений, чтобы посеить новый урожай.
texts.en:
Oybarchin S. lives in the Shahrituz region. She is 35 years old. She is married and has three children. Her husband is now working in Russia. Oybarchin herself has been growing vegetables and wheat for more than fourteen years. She sells a part and keeps the other part for consumption. She is asking for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer to sow a new harvest.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en: Julieta E. is from the city Oroquieta, Misamis Occidental. She is 41 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. Julieta owns and operates a business planting and harvesting vegetables for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over six years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Julieta joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional young crops to raise. Julieta is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional young crops to raise. This loan will be her 5th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional young crops to raise and sell

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan C. is from the town of Quezon,San Isidro. She is 28 years old, married, and has one school-aged child.

Joan owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She earns approximately 1,500 PHP weekly.

In 2009, Joan joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first loan taken out from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 


About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Adham

texts.en:
Adham is 21 years old and single. He runs a grocery store where he sells sweets (candies), preserved food, juices, soft drinks and other products. The inventory he has for sale is of very good quality and selection. Adham is respectful and patient with all of his customers, and this attracts people and brings them back to his store to buy groceries again.
Adham is seeking to keep his business sustainable and has requested a loan of $2,000 USD to increase the inventory he has for sale. We believe this current loan will enhance the potential of his business and help Adham reach all of his aspirations.

loans.use: To increase his inventory

loans.name: Samer

texts.en:
Samer is a 33-year-old man who lives in Saida, Southern Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. Samer has owned a shoe shop since 2004. Samer requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase the new spring shoe collection. This is his second cycle, and he has always paid on time.
Samer is special in his work because he knows how to treat his client and offers good quality shoes. His clients are people from his region, but mainly his neighbors and friends. When he first started his business, he didn’t have enough cash to expand his stock; therefore, thanks to his previous loans, he was able to expand and diversify his merchandise. Samer decided on this business because he wanted to have independent work. In the future, he plans to keep on improving his business by always providing his clients with the best merchandise.

loans.use: To purchase the new spring shoe collection

loans.name: Miskiunu-Phiry Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Miskiuno está formado por mujeres y hombres trabajadores que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos, las socias viven la ciudad D. Phiry del distrito D. Ollantaytambo D. la provincia D. Urubamba del departamento del Cusco, urbe que se caracteriza por su clima caluroso, sus paisajes hermosos, su agricultura y su ganadería.

Florentina es socia del banco comunal Miskiuno, tiene 58 años D. edad, es casada y es madre D. cinco hijos pues dos depenD. D. ella todavía (Aled y Elvis) y su esposo trabaja como cocinero.  
Florentina se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza D. animales menores como cuyes, ella tiene actualmente 300 cuyes y los venD. a los restaurantes a costo D. 15 a 18 soles por cuy, le va bastante bien ya que sus cuyes son D. calidad en la zona y lleva dos años comercializando estos cuyes, Ya son dos años que la socia pertenece al banco comunal Miskiuno, el crédito que reciba va a mejorar el techo donD. viven los cuyes y va comprar comida para los cuyes. 

Los otros socios se dedican a la agricultura como por ejemplo: Susana, Yolanda, Eloy, Silveria y Pablo y los demás a diversas actividades como al servicio D. sastrería, a la venta D. comestibles,  artesanía, comida, verduras y pasto.

Los socios están preocupados por que las ventas han disminuido debido a la fuertes lluvias que cayeron por tres días en la ciudad del Cusco pues sus compradores trabajan directamente con el turismo, el turismo a decaído considerablemente. Otros D. los socios que tenían sus terrenos D. cultivo cerca a las orillas del rió vilcanota, el rio arraso sus productos dejando nada a su paso y dejando perdidas irrecuperables.  Los socia continuaran a pesar D. las adversidades del clima.

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago D. sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
The Miskiuno communal bank is composed of hardworking women and men who constantly look for opportunities to get ahead and who work everyday to be able to give their children a better future. The members live in the city of Phiry, in Ollantaytambo district, in Urubamba province, in the department of Cusco. The area is characterized by its warm climate, its beautiful views, and its agriculture and cattle herding. Florentina is a member of the Miskiuno communal bank. She is 58 years old, married, and the mother of five children, two of whom are still dependent on her (Aled y Elvis). Her husband works as a cook. Florentina works in agriculture and raises small animals, such as guinea pigs. She currently has 300 guinea pigs and she sells them to restaurants at a cost of 15.00 to 18.00 PEN per guinea pig. Things are going very well for her because her guinea pigs are known in the area for their quality. She has been selling them for two years. She has also belonged to the Miskiuno communal bank for two years. Her loan will be used to improve the roof where the guinea pigs live and also to buy feed for them. Some of the other members work in agriculture—for example, Susana, Yolanda, Eloy, Silveria and Pablo. The rest work in a variety of activities, such as tailoring, food sales, crafts, food, vegetables, and animal fodder. The members are worried because their sales have gone down due to the heavy rains that fell for three days in the city of Cusco. Their buyers work directly in the tourist traD. and tourism has fallen off considerably. Other members have their fields near the banks of the Vilcanota River; the river washed away their crops leaving nothing behind except unrecoverable losses. The members forge ahead despite the adversities of their climate. The members are grateful for the opportunity they have been given and they promise to make their loan payments within the established time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Florentina needs the loan to improve the roof on the structure where her guinea pigs live and to buy food for them

loans.name: Dok

texts.en:
Dok K., 51, is married and resides with her children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has three children. 

She sells roast chickens and cooked rice and earns approximately US$3 per day. By doing this she is able to cover her family expenses, particularly her children’s education. She has been runing this business since 1993. Her husband is a skillful carpenter, earning an income of US$1.50 per day. 

Their standard of living has been improved since K. has been working in her business, so she wants a loan to expand. K. is requesting a loan of US$1,200 to purchase salt and watermelons to resell. This is her first loan from CREDIT, partnered with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy salt and watermelon for resale

loans.name: Noel Eusebio

texts.es: El señor M. es padre soltero se dedica atender un negocio propio de un Bar Restaurante ubicado costado oeste de la cancha emir cabeza en león, este cliente con todo sus esfuerzo ayuda a su mama ala mantencion de todas sus necesidades, y con la ayuda de los créditos en ceprodel a logrado mejor su nivel de vida y  a mejorar la infraestructura del negocio.
texts.en:
Mr. M. is a single father who runs a restaurant/bar located on the western side of Emir Cabeza stadium in Leon. He also helps his mother with all of her personal needs. With the help of loans from Ceprodel, he has been able to improve the infrastructure for his business, and raise his standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Jim Muir, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials needed to improve his business' infrastructure

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 42 años, es casado y tiene dos hijos menores y uno mayor de edad. Vive en la hermosa selva cuzqueña, en la localidad de “Quimbiri”, donde tiene su casa propia.

Pedro es un agricultor de 25 años de experiencia en el cultivo de la hoja de coca y café, y tiene una historia llena de sacrificios y satisfacciones. Para la siembra y cosecha trabaja con su esposa, pero regularmente contrata a peones para agilizar su producción, la cual generalmente la vende en los centros de acopio de su localidad a un buen precio. Adicionalmente a esta actividad, su esposa tiene una tienda de bebidas, galletas y golosinas con la finalidad de ahorrar dinero para las temporadas cuando no se cosecha. En el futuro, Pedro piensa ampliar el negocio de su esposa, reacondicionando el local, adquiriendo nuevos equipos y muebles para brindar mejor atención a sus clientes.

Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, por consiguiente se compromete a cumplir con sus pagos a tiempo; además se siente bien de ser parte de banco comunal, ya que todos se solidarizan entre sí. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará más productos para la tienda de su esposa y lo que sobre será para el pago de sus peones.
texts.en:
Pedro, 42, is married and has 2 minor children and one grown child. He lives in the beautiful Cuzqueñan forest, in the town of “Quimbiri," where he has his own house. Pedro has 25 years of experience working in agriculture, growing coca leaves and coffee, and has a history full of sacrifices and satisfactions. At sowing and harvest times he works with his wife, but he regularly hires laborers to speed up his production. He usually sells his products in the collection center in his area for a good price. In addition to this activity, his wife has a store selling drinks, cookies and sweets in order to save money for the seasons when there is no harvest. In the future, Pedro is thinking of expanding his wife's business, refurbishing the premises and acquiring new equipment and furniture to provide better service to the customers. This is his 2nd loan with MFP, and he is committed to making his payments on time. In addition, he feels good to be part of a communal bank, where the members all support each other. With the money he now requests he will buy more products for his wife's store and will pay his workers.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase merchandise

loans.name: Nkenih

texts.en:
H. Nkenih is a married mother of eight currently living in Belo, Cameroon. H. is currently requesting her third loan from GHAPE. She has been with GHAPE since 2007 and has demonstrated a credit-worthy character exemplified by her repayments, consistent attendance of meetings, and support of her borrowing group. 

With this latest loan, H. is hoping to continue the business practices supported by her prior loans. She has requested 170,000 CFA to purchase one bag of rice, one bag of flour, two tins of oil, and two bags of corn. The rest will be used to purchase sugar, spices and maggi (flavoring cubes for soup, like boullion). She believes her business will succeed because of her prior success, ample client base, and increasing demand for her products. She hopes to use the profits from her business to pay for her children’s school fees, pay salaries to individuals who manage her farm, purchase seeds for her farm, and reinvest in her business. She will use this loan to manage current afflictions in her life, such as the theft of a significant amount of money, and to build a house for her and her children.

H.’s loan will be provided through the Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE), a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Rice, flour, oil, corn, sugar, fuel wood, maggi

loans.name: Georgina

texts.es: Georgina tiene 51 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en su casa propia. Hace mas D. tres años venD. cosméticos D. diversas marcas reconocidas en el mercado. DesD. entonces ofrece a su clientela, productos como: Shampoo, acondicionadores, cremas, labiales, rubores, rizador, entre otros, en donD. la gran mayoría tiene mucha demanda por amigas y vecinas D. su barrio, luego estaría realizando las respectivas cobranzas D. casa en casa hasta que terminen D. pagar sus cuotas. Georgina se siente contenta y satisfecha con al actividad que realiza, ya que el recibir sus ganancias, le permiten ser una fuente D. financiamiento para sus hijos. Es por ello que continuará esforzándose en la venta D. cosméticos siendo su anhelo aumentar su mercadería y sus ingresos. Este es su séptimo crédito con MFP, por tanto promete en ser responsable con sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra D. cosméticos al por mayor para tener mayor variedad D. productos en venta.
texts.en:
Georgina is 51 years old; she lives with her husband and 4 children in her own home. For more than three years she has been selling cosmetics of different brands that are recognized in the market. She offers her customers items like: shampoo, conditioners, creams, lipstick, blush, hair-curlers among other items. For the most part, she has great demand from her friends and neighbors and she collects the money from the items sold from her customers door to door until they pay their balance due. Georgina fells happy and satisfied with her work since when she receives her payments it allows her to be a source of income for her children. This is why she will continue to work wholeheartedly selling cosmetics with the hope of increasing her merchandize and income. This is her seventh loan with MFP (Kiva’s field partner) and promises to be responsible with her payments. With the loan she will buy cosmetics wholesale to have a greater variety of products for sale.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products.

loans.name: Ramona

texts.en:
Ms. Ramona I. M., 41 years old, is a native of the city of Carapeguá and has been married for 23 years to Mr. José María Lopez Galeano, who is a 46-year-old native.  They have 4 children, 2 of whom are school-aged while two are adults.

Ms. Ramona got married very young and together with her husband went to work abroad for many years, so that they could gather a little capital to construct their house.  Moreover, they also set up a small sewing shop.

Today, Ramona manufactures all types of clothes. It has been more than 10 years since she decided on this line of work and thanks to her efforts, two of her children are in college.

She wants to buy a sewing machine and this is the reason she has approached our institution to request a loan.

loans.use: A sewing machine, as well as fabrics, thread, and zippers

loans.name: Luz De Madre 5 Group

texts.en:
Ramona is the coordinator of her group, Luz de Madre (Light of the Mother), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti). Her group is located in Los Alcarrizos, a dusty industrial area north of the capital, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their three children.
Ramona is excited to be taking her second loan with Kiva partner, Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling hair products by purchasing more shampoo, rinse and conditioner to sell. She will use the profits to invest in inverters for her house (large batteries that charge when the power is on to counteract frequent blackouts). She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase shampoo, rinse and conditioner for resale

loans.name: Nov

texts.en:
Mrs. Nov C. is a widowed woman and the mother of six children, one of whom is now married and lives independently, while the remaining five are single and employed. To pursue a daily income, Nov C. makes and sells some food and cakes in her store next to her house. 

Nov C. has another skill in raising pigs and she wants to use this knowledge to earn extra income, but she doesn’t have capital. Thus, she has applied for a loan in order to purchase piglets to breed.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to breed.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter would like a loan to buy flour, sugar and salt for his retail shop which he has run for one year. He started by making daily sales of 10,000 shillings and now he makes at least 25,000 shillings.

Peter is a 24-year-old single man who lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He owns the house he lives in. His dream is to become financially stable and turn his retail shop into a wholesale shop in future.

loans.use: To buy more flour, sugar and salt for his shop

loans.name: Glory Be To God Group-Jinja

texts.en:
It is close to six years now since 37-year-old married G. Rose began her beauty salon business in Nukabenge-Jinja. She had to go through an apprentice training mill with her mother to learn how to braid and weave hair. 

She was previously involved in a dairy business that has since closed. By the time it closed, though, she had already got more than a broad hint of how to run a business, having studied how her mum managed her finances. Her minimal story, she says, exemplifies hard work. 

She is a happy-go-lucky married mother of two. With this loan she is anticipating that she will be in position to buy a modern hair dryer. She reckons that her weekly profits of $22 will also increase after she revamps her beauty salon.

loans.use: The purchase of a modern hair dryer for her beauty salon

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She is going to use the money to improve her home.  She will buy: stone, sand, cement and iron to build a room

loans.name: Mujeres De Exito (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Mujeres de Éxito está formado por 8 mujeres que viven en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es conocida por su rica cultura, la belleza de su centro histórico, su variada gastronomía y su gente hacen de esta una ciudad encantadora. Nuestras socias son mujeres que  luchan para mejorar la economía de sus  hogares y lo están logrando poco a poco con su sacrificio diario.

La Señora Raquel Esperanza B. vive por la ciudadela Jaime Roldós, es socia de la banca comunal hace 3años, los prestamos le han beneficiado tanto en su hogar como en su negocio, se dedica a la venta de ropa hace 7 años, cuenta con un puesto propio en el mercado de la feria libre  en la ciudad de Azogues, también vende su mercadería en su casa contando con una selecta clientela.
El  dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más ropa y así surtir e incrementar su negocio.

Doña Raquel tiene 40 años, es casada y tiene 9 hijos de 21, 20, 18, 16, 13, 10, 8, 4 años de edad y su último hijo  tiene apenas 10 meses de nacido. Sus cuatro primeros hijos trabajan y le ayudan con la economía de su hogar, su quinto hijo  estudia en un colegio de la ciudad y sus dos últimos hijos estudian en la escuela, su esposo trabaja como empleado privado. Su meta es  comprarse un vehiculo para facilitar su trabajo.

La Señora. María Narcisa D. vive por el sector de Mayancela en la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 44 años, es divorciada hace12 años y tiene 3 hijos de 26, 24 y 19 años de edad, todos sus hijos son casados y viven independientemente con sus familias, nuestra socia no tiene casa propia por lo que vive con una de sus hijas.
La Señora. María hace 6 años se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de ropa, vende todos los días recorriendo la ciudad, hace un año también se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de la marca Avon. Es socia hace 6 años de la banca comunal, pero por motivos de fuerza mayor ha tenido que salir por un tiempo y ahora se encuentra reingresando.  El dinero de su crédito lo va  a invertir en la compra de más ropa para tener surtida su mercadería, su meta es  llegar a tener un negocio más grande.
texts.en:
The communal bank Mujeres de Éxito (Successful Women) is made up of 8 women that live in the city of Cuenca, a city that is know for it rich culture, the beauty of its old town, its varied gastronomy and the people that make it a charming city. Our members are women that are working hard to improve their economic situations and little by little, with daily sacrifices, they are achieving this. Señora Raquel Esperanza B. lives in the Jaime Roldós residential area. She has been a member of the communal bank for 3 years. Her household, as well as her business, has benefited greatly from the loans. She has been selling clothing for a living for 7 years. She has a stall in the open market in the city of Azogues. She also sells her merchandise from her home to select customers. She will use the loan to buy more clothing in order to stock and increase her business. Doña Raquel is 40 years old. She is married and has 9 children, ages 21,20,18,16,13,10, 8, 4 and her last child is barely 10 months old. Her first four children work and help her with the household expenses. Her fifth child studies at an institute in the city and two of her younger children attend school. Her husband works as a private employee. Her goal is to buy herself a vehicle to make her job easier. Señora María Narcisa D. lives in the Mayancela sector in the city of Cuenca. She is 44 years old and has been divorced for 12 years. She has 3 children, ages 26,24 and 19. All of her children are married and live independently with their families. She doesn't have her own house so she lives with one of her daughters. Señora María has been selling all types of clothing for 6 years now. Everyday she travels around the city to sell her merchandise. A year ago she also started selling Avon cosmetics. She has been a member of the communal bank for 6 years, but because of circumstances she was compelled to leave for a time. She recently rejoined the group. She will use the loan to buy more clothing to stock more merchandise. Her goal is to have a much larger business.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more clothing such as pants, shirts, blouses, etc.

loans.name: Eun

texts.en: Mrs. S. is a garment laborer, while her husband (pictured) works in the construction field. This young couple were married two years ago, but they don’t yet have children. Mrs. S. owns a plot of farmland inherited from her parents on which she now hopes to cultivate crops to get additional income. As she lacks capital, Mrs. S. decided to look for assistance in order to plant rice during the approaching farming season.

loans.use: To plant rice.

loans.name: Evelyn Leonela

texts.es:
Evelyn, tiene un salón de belleza en una parte de su casa que construyo para su negocio. Vive en una zona periurbana llamada Perimetral rodeada del estero salado de Guayaquil. 

Comenzó a estudiar de muy joven peluquería poco a poco pudo armar su negocio ya que le gusto mucho esta actividad para poder mantener a sus dos hijos. Su mama le ayuda con el negocio en horarios rotativos. Para generar mas ingresos ella hace trabajos de estilista a domicilio. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar tintes y maquinas para su salón de belleza. En el futuro quiere tener una peluquería bien surtida para asi tener dinero para darles una mejor vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Evelyn has a beauty salon in a part of her house that she built for her business. She lives in an area on th eoutskirts of town called Perimetral. It is surrounded by the salt wedge of Guayaquil. She started to study hair styling when she was very young and little by little began to establish her business, since she really like this activity to be able to support her two children. Her mother helps her with the business on a rotating schedule. To generate more income, she does styling in people's home. With the loan, she wants to buy dyes and appliances for her beauty salon. In the future, she wants to have a well supplied hair salon to be able to have money to give a better life to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Dyes, appliances

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn P. is from the village of Sampagar, Damulog, Bukidnon. She is 30 years old. Arlyn is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she raises pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $200 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Arlyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Itojo Bakyara Tutungukye Group-Ntungamo

texts.en: Juliet M., a 43-year-old member of Itojo Bakyara Tutungukye group - Ntungamo, has been operating her retail shop for 20 years. She says constant diligence, determination and courage have greatly contributed to the success of her operations.  A happily married mother of nine children, Juliet established her shop using savings from her earlier business selling bananas, and now earns a weekly profit of shillings 80,000. She will use this loan to purchase more retail items such as sugar, bread, salt and plastics for resale.

loans.use: The purchase of more retail items such as sugar, bread, salt, etc. for resale

loans.name: Mrs. Mao Soem Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan is made up of ten people who live in Ta Sou village in Takeo province. All of the members will use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their family's lives. 

Mrs. Mao S., 55, is the village bank president and has been selected by the other members. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to grow both rice and vegetable to sell to support her family. Although she tries to work a lot, she earns little money. So to improve her family's lives, Mrs. Mao Some is seeking for a loan to add more money in purchasing a cow for breeding to start a new business. She is a widow with two children, one of whom is a laborer and the other is a farmer.

loans.use: To add more money to buy a cow

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy palm oil, rice and beans

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John M., aged 39 years, operates an auto spares shop at Kirinyanga Road in Nairobi city center. He is married to Sarah and together they have two children, Dan and Jane. He has been running this business for a period of 5 years and his monthly profit is Kshs 8000. 

He was introduced to KADET by other KADET clients. This loan of Kshs 40,000 is John’s first loan with KADET. With the loan, John plans to use Kshs 30000 to buy clutches and wheels and Kshs 10000 to buy motorcycle spare parts. If this loan boosts the business, John will increase his stocks to expand his business further.

John's dream for the future is to open another shop and a garage. He describes himself as hard-working.

loans.use: To buy clutches, tires, and motorcycles spare parts.

loans.name: Gardenias De Sumidero Group

texts.es: Esta foto fue tomada en la casa D. la señora Irma J., una integrante del grupo Gardenias D. Sumidero, que está ubicado en la comunidad D. Sumidero,en el Estado D. Veracruz, en México. Se ve al grupo D. señoras alrededor D. la ropa que venD. la señora Irma, en la foto. Ella se dedica a la venta D. ropa D. segunda mano, que inicio hace 24 años. Solicita el préstamo para comprar mas ropa D. invierno y tener bien surtido su negocio en esta temporada. Sus compañeras y clientes la conocen como una persona responsable y trabajadora. Al momento D. solicitar este préstamo se siente muy contenta ya que es una buena temporada para la venta D. ropa D. invierno y año nuevo. Tiene 47 años, estudio hasta  la secundaria, es casada y tiene en total 3 hijas. Quiere este crédito para surtir su negocio D. ropa con mercancia D. temporada y poder mejorar sus ventas. también espera en un futuro no muy lejano poder construir afuera D. su casa un local para poner su negocio D. venta D. ropa pero nueva, no D. segunda como la que venD. ahora y con esto mejorar su calidad D. vida y la D. su familia.
texts.en: This photo was taken in Irma J.'s house. She is an indispensable member of the Gardenias D. Sumidero group, which is located in the community of Sumidero, in the State of Veracruz, Mexico. Irma can be seen in the photo among the group of women surrounded by the clothing which she sells. She sells second-hand clothing, and has done so for 24 years. She is requesting the loan in order to buy more winter clothing and to diversify her business for this season. Her fellow group members and her customers know her as a hard-working and responsible person. At the time of asking for this loan, she is very happy since it is a good season for the sale of winter and new year's clothes. She is 47 years old, attended school through the 9th graD., is married and has 3 daughters. She wants this loan so she can supplement her clothing business with seasonal merchandise and improve her sales. She also hopes, in the not too distant future, to be able to move her business out of her house to a new location, and to sell new clothing, not second-hand clothes like she sells now, thereby improving her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: Invest in her clothing business

loans.name: Pay Back The Money Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Pay Back The Money” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are all women who run small businesses and who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, in order to seek a loan of 500,000 SLL for each in the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, and make more sales and profit. Ultimately, they hope to improve their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Jariatu S.. Jariatu was born in the eastern city of Kono 32 years ago. She is single and has three children, two of whom are attending primary school. Jariatu sells “gara lappers” (locally dyed cloths) and has been running this business for four years now. With her share of this loan, she will buy materials to make gara lappers--ink, caustic soda, powder, white cotton cloths, etc.--in order to produce a larger quantity of gara cloths for sale.

loans.use: To buy materials to make gara cloth

loans.name: Omungyenyi Tukwatanise Group, Ntungamo

texts.en: R. Juliet is the leader of Omungyenyi Tukwatanise group in Ntungamo. She is 46 years old and married with 6 children between the ages of 11 and 22. Juliet has a business of buying and selling cows; some of which, she gets milk and butter to sell. She has also been involved in buying and selling goats for 3 years. From her businesses, she makes 24,000 UGX per month from milk sales, and 300,000 UGX from selling cows monthly. Previously, Juliet was only selling milk from the few cows she had. But when she got the loan, she expanded. Juliet is hard-working and determined. Her dream is to be able to sell 20 cows at once. She needs a loan to be able to buy more cows for fattening and farm expansion.

loans.use: Buying more cows for fattening and farm expansion

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine G. is from the village of Abu, Baylao, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 47 years old. Josephine is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Josephine owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, beverages, snack foods & toothpaste in the local community. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Josephine joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like snack foods & beverages. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Josephine from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like snack foods & beverages

loans.name: Chum

texts.en:
Mrs. Chum, who is the wife of Mr. Sout, is a 34-year-old. She is a mother of three children who are students in local public school. She and her husband are farmers who own a 1-hectare plot of land where they can grow rice. They sell part of the rice yield and the other part is used to support their family. Her husband is also a farming laborer.

Mrs. Chum has some problems because her field has a lot of mice and they destroy her rice. So Mrs. Chum is applying for a loan to buy a battery, some supplies to kill those mice. With any remainder of the loan, she is going to buy fertilizer and gasoline. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy a battery, some supplies to kill field mice and other farming inputs

loans.name: Simeon

texts.en:
Simeon is 44 years old and  married, with one child who is four years old. He and his wife work hard for the development of their family. Simeon owns a business selling bananas. His business is well-known, as well as organized. He employs one person as  a helper. Simeon has three years experience in his business. The hours of his business are from 7am until 8pm every day. 

Simeon has requested his first loan from KIva lenders, via Vision Finance Company, in order to purchase a  large quantity of bananas. That will help him to satisfy his many customers. Simeon will able to earn more profits to be reinvested in his business and he will pay school fees for his child.

loans.use: To purchase a large of quantity of bananas.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice Y. is a divorced woman with five children, three of whom attend school while two are at home. She lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees, clothing and food for the family. 

For the past four years, she has operated a charcoal selling business. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is seasonality and the high cost of transportation. During rainy season the demand for charcoal is lower compared to the dry summer season. 

She dreams of accessing bigger loans and purchasing a plot of land in the future.

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for sale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for sale

loans.name: Jessa

texts.en:
Jessa L. is from the village of Malagana, Claveria, Misamis Oriental. She is 24 years old. Jessa is married and has one infant child. Jessa owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling canned goods, junk food, biscuits, shampoo, soap & beverages in the local community. Jessa has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2009, Jessa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. She has successfully repaid her last loan from HSPFI, which was for 10,000 PHP and was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital.

This loan will be her fifth from HSPFI. Jessa is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to to purchase additional canned goods & junk food. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods & junk food

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace currently sells bread. She is 32 years old, married, and has one child who does not go to school. Grace borrowed a loan to stock more bread to sell. She hopes to expand with extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: to stock more bread to sell.

loans.name: Nuevo Día Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Nuevo Día, inicia su ciclo número 11 con 10 socias, las cuales se dedican a la venta de artesanías, papa seca, cosméticos por catálogo, leña, cereales. 
Erica, es la presidenta para éste ciclo, tiene 30 años es madre soltera y tiene un hijo de 7 años. Erica se dedica a la venta de golosina y desayuno frente a la Universidad Alas Peruanas. Solicita un préstamo y lo invertirá en la implementación de su negocio. Antes trabajaba en una imprenta que está frente a la universidad y se dio cuenta que los estudiantes cuando salían no tenían donde tomar su desayuno y que se compraban gaseosas y galletas y decidió ella vender desayuno y golosinas está con éste negocio hace un año y le va bien. 
Su sueño es poder ahorrar para comprar maquinarias e implementar su imprenta.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Nuevo Dia" is on their 11th loan cycle. Its 10 members have businesses, including crafts sales, dried potato sales, cosmetics sales by catalogue, firewood sales, and cereal grain sales.

Erica is the president of the group for this loan cycle. She is 30 years old and she is a single mother of a 7-year old boy. Erica sells sweets and breakfast in front of the University of Alas Peruanas. She requests a loan to invest in the implementation of her business. Previously she worked at a printing company, located near the university. She noticed that students had nowhere to have their breakfast when they were on break, buying only soft drinks and cookies. So she decided to start selling breakfast and sweets. She has been in business for a year and it is going very well. 

Her dream is to save enough money to purchase printers to set up a print shop.

loans.use: to purchase disposable plates and utensils for her breakfast foods business.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret sells greens. She is 48 years old, married, with eight children. Margret requested a loan to stock more greens to sell. She hopes to expand her business with extra profits in the future.

loans.use: to stock more greens to sell.

loans.name: Abigail Esperanza

texts.es:
La señora Abigail Esmeralda es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora originaria de Pacayita, Diría. Ella es contadora del comedor génesis y junto a su esposo se dedica al comercio de ropa. Ellos se distribuyen el trabajo del negocio para seguir progresando y que su nivel de vida mejore.

Con el crédito comprará mercadería en pantalones, vestidos, cortinas…etc.
texts.en:
Abigail Esmeralda is a hard working, enterprising woman from Pacayita, Diría.  She is an Accountant at the Génesis Eatery and together with her husband sells clothes.  They share the work in the business to continue making progress and so that their standard of living improves.
She will use the loan to buy pants, dresses, curtains, etc.

loans.use: to buy pants, dresses, curtains, etc.

loans.name: Verónica Alexandra

texts.es:
En el sector conocido como la subidita al cielo en el barrio San Pablo de la ciudad de Portoviejo cada quince días se reúnen las socias  del Banco Comunal Subidita Al Cielo, esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada en esta ciudad.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Verónica, tiene 20 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de 3 años y seis meses. El marido es taxista. 

Es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y trabaja tres días a la semana en los momentos que está desocupada, hay días que trabaja hasta 4 horas, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana o cada quince días. Hace dos  años se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien,  lo que más vende son los perfumes tanto de hombre como de mujer ya que son de muy buena calidad.
	
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y bisutería. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son fáciles de hacer.
 
Su sueño es tener su casa propia pues donde vive es alquilado.
texts.en:
The members of the Communal Bank “Subidita al Cielo” meet every 15 days in an area with the same name in the city of Portoviejo. This marginal urban area is the most populated section of the city.

It is here that one can meet Sra. Verónica. She is 20 years old and in a common-law relationship. Verónica has a son who is 3½ years old. Her husband is a taxi driver.

This housewife utilized her own resources to sell merchandise produced by Yanbal (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women’s accessories). She sells door-to-door and works three days per week during her free time. There are days when she works up to four hours. Verónica offers her products on credit and collects payment either weekly or every 15 days. She has been in business for two years and has done very well. The products that she sells the most are men’s and women’s perfumes since these items are of high quality.

This loan will be used to buy perfumes, crèmes, cosmetics, and trinkets. She has been a member of the Communal Bank from the beginning and likes the fact that the process of obtaining a loan is easy. Her dream is to have a home of her own since she currently pays rent.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, crèmes, cosmetics, and trinkets.

loans.name: God Is Great Group

texts.en:
Mariama Siray is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Thirty-five-year-old Mariama Siray was born in one of the villages that make up Sanda.  Mariama is married and has 5 children – 4 in primary school and 1 in secondary school. 

Mariama has been in business for 6 years now.  She sells clothes for children.  Mariama has requested this loan in order to buy a large quantity of baby clothes to add to her current ones.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of baby clothes to add to her current ones

loans.name: Jalia

texts.en:
Jalia lives in Uganda.  She is married and has six children, four of whom are in school. Jalia has a business of selling second hand shoes. She has been in this business for five years, and she works seven days out of every week.  Jalia sells her products retail at the market. 

Jalia has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second hand shoes.The main business challenges for Jalia include the ever-increasing prices of shoes as well as seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start importing shoes herself and also to sell on a wholesale basis only.

Jalia lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include medication, school fees, and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second hand shoes

loans.name: Luis Eduardo

texts.es:
Luis, vive con su esposa y una hija, tienen casa propia, él se dedica a atender un car Wash, este negocio lo inicio hace 5 años, y ha logrado de sus ganancias mantener a su familia.
Él necesita el financiamiento para la compra de una máquina para lavar vehículos, pues quiere mejorar el servicio y atender a los clientes mejor, ya que tendrá mayor facilidad para agilizar el trabajo.
Mejorar el negocio es su objetivo, para obtener más ganancias y aumentar la clientela.
texts.en:
Luis lives with his wife and daughter. They have their own house. He works at a car wash. He started this business five years ago and his earnings take care of his family. 
He needs this loan to purchase a machine to wash the vehicles. He wants to improve his service and tend to his clients better. It will be easier to speed up his work.
Improving his business is his objective in order to earn more profit and increase his clientele.

loans.use: purchase a machine for washing vehicles.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a thirty-three-year-old married man with eight children and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been  operating a retail and bar shop for three years and he started the business with the savings he had got from selling tea. His hardships are debtors, inflation and high transport costs. His vision is a wholesale business plus an educated family.

Moses needs the loan facility to buy salt, sugar and beer to sell.

loans.use: To buy salt, sugar, and beer to sell.

loans.name: Mort

texts.en:
Mort, 53 years old, is a policeman and earns $10 per day. He is living with one son who is a goldsmith, with $3 per day for his income.  Every month, he has to spend $150 on food, $30 on electricity and $10 on other expenses.

He would like to request a loan of $750 to buy baby pigs and pig feed.  In the future, he hopes to be able to help his son to get more skill as a goldsmith so that he can do well and support himself and his family.

loans.use: To buy baby pigs and pig feed

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Emily is a business woman aged 30. She is married and blessed with one child. For the past two years, she has been managing a salon to earn a living. Her desire is to open a boutique in five years time so that she can get more income. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 Kenya shillings to buy a hair drier and make-up. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save part of her income.

loans.use: To buy a hair drier and make-up

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “TRES DE MAYO”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.
La socia Cornelia tiene 62 años de edad, y es soltera la socia tiene 5 hijos los cuales ya son todos ellos independientes, la socia trabaja en el mercado vendiendo verduras, menestras y papa, la socia suele comprar al por mayor por ejemplo choclo fresco y lo lleva  a vender junto a sus otros productos como verduras y menestras, la socia  también vende en ocasiones papa, ella desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de choclo al por mayor, papa, habas y otros productos.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y asi mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “TRES DE MAYO”. The bank is located in the district of Huanchac in the province of Cusco and in the department of Cusco.

The member Cornelia is 62 years old. She is single and has 5 children, all of whom are adults and independent. The member works in the market selling vegetables, beans and potatoes. The member tends to buy a product in bulk for example fresh corn and sells it alongside her other products such as vegetables and beans. The member also sells potatoes sometimes. She wants to invest the loan to purchase fresh corn in bulk, potatoes, beans and other products.

The member is grateful for the support given her and as such agrees to make the repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy fresh corn in bulk, potatoes, beans and other products.

loans.name: Khoem

texts.en:
Khoem, 49, is living in Kompong Speu Province, Cambodia. She lives with Lin, 51, and their four lovely children that they care for and provide a good education for. Khoem strives to provide the best for her family members. She works hard for them in her fields planted with rice, corn and potatoes. She’s been in this line of work for many years on land of her own. From this business activity, she can earn approximately $3USD per day. 

Due to the rainy season, Khoem would like to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other farming materials for supporting her farm. Due to lack of money, she wishes to request some funds through HKL partner with Kiva. This is her first loan with HKL partner, therefore she’s hoping for a small loan to reach her objectives. She is naturally predisposed to repay her loan punctually. She hopes that this loan will make her family meet happiness and prosperity all the time. 

In the future, she wishes to have a larger house.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other farming materials

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia is 62 years old. She is married. 

Cresencia raises hogs and sells them. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP)  to buy additional feeds for the hogs. 

Cresencia has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Cresencia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds for hogs that are intended for selling.

loans.name: Duterimbere/mgnz Group

texts.fr:
Jean fait partie du groupe Duterimbere/Muganza. Le nom du groupe signifie «Développer nous même». Il a 52 ans et il est marié avec 8 enfants de 10 à 30 ans, dont 8 scolarisés. Il a une autre personne en charge autre que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est de 4 ans de primaire.

Jean est cultivateur de riz. C’est son deuxième  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de faire les semences sélectionnée. Dans les prochaines années, Jean voudrait être le fournisseur du riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et soigner ses enfants.
texts.en:
Jean is a part of the group Duterimbere/Muganza. The name means something like "developing ourselves". He is 52 years old, married, and has 8 children between the ages of 10 and 30, 8 are in school. He also takes care of another person a part from his children. He has completed 4 years of schooling.

Jean is a rice farmer. It is his second round of financing with ACB. He is going to use the loan to purchase chemical fertilizer for his rice crops. 

His business growth strategy is to specially select the seeds he uses. In the next few years, Jean would like to become the main rice provider for his region. With the profits, he intends to educate and take care of his children.

loans.use: to purchase chemical fertilizer for his rice crops.

loans.name: Caren

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Caren works hard to support her family.

She has a sari-sari store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from fish farming.  Caren is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

Caren has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store

loans.name: Angelie

texts.en:
Angelie is 30 years old and married with three children. She is from Panta-on, Ozamis City. 

To make a living, Angelie owns and operates a banana production business. Angelie has been in her business for 5 years and she earn 4,000 PHP a month for her work. 

In 2011, Angelie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Angelie is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pesticides and cover costs paid for banana planting. This will be Angelie's first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase pesticides and cover costs paid for banana planting

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en:
Maria Fe is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children.

Maria Fe has a food shop that sells hard-boiled duck eggs, known as balot. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy stocks of duck eggs for making balot.

Maria Fe has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Maria Fe  hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy stocks of duck eggs for making balot.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 6 children.  Josephine has a barbecue shop that sells chicken & pork barbecue. She has had this business for 10 years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy raw ingredients for chicken barbecue.  Josephine has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Josephine hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for chicken barbecue

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a responsible father who owns and manages a restaurant in a rural community. He is 60 years old and has two adult aged children. Through his patience and sacrifices, he educates his two children and gives them a better life. Despite this, he aims to improve and continue the business in order to be able to earn and save more income to satisfy necessities and save for the future.

He wants to ask for an additional capital of P 50,000 to buy pork, fish, vegetables and seasoning to be cooked and sold in his restaurant. He believes that this loan will help him to work out his plan and is hoping that he will be successful in carrying them out.

loans.use: to buy pork, fish, vegetables and seasoning to be cooked and sold.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret, 43 years old, is married to a driver and they have four children ranging from 10 to 25 years. 

For the last five years, Margaret has been selling timber, poles, posts and firewood. She has two employees. Her business is located at a busy market.

She will use the loan of KES 20,000 to buy more timber. In the next five years, Margaret hopes to run several timber retail stores.

loans.use: To buy more timber.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is from Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 47 years old. Adelaida is married and has three children. 

To make a living, Adelaida is running a general store, selling a variety of food and home use products in the local community. Adelaida has been in her business for 10 years and earns 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Adelaida is requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. In 2010, Adelaida joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offerings

loans.name: Siguidia 2 Group

texts.fr:
Composé de femmes mariées, les membres du groupe SIGUIDIA 2, vivent dans des familles traditionnelles  avec en moyenne 32 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes Kèlèkèlè, dans le cercle de Kolondièba et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de mariage. Elles mènent toutes une activité hivernale. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs productions, les membres de groupe ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur 8 ème prêt.
Awa, la seule assise, compte  utiliser son prêt pour acheter des semences d’arachide et de mil, des engrais et des herbicides, des pioches et payer les frais de labour et sarclage des champs ayant une superficie de 1,5 hectare. 
Sa production qui sera destinée à la vente à une clientèle composée de consommateurs et de revendeurs, lui permettra d’obtenir un montant de 215.000FA. Le bénéfice ainsi obtenu permettra de rembourser le prêt, constituer les trousseaux des jeunes filles pour leur mariage  et prendre en charge certains besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
The members of the group "SIGUIDIA 2" are all married women living in traditional families and averaging 32 years of age and three children each. The women all live in Kèlèkèlè, in Cercle de Kolondièba, and they know one another through ties of community, kinship, and marriage. They all have the same rainy season work. With the goal of increasing their production, the group members joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their eighth loan. 

Awa, the only one sitting in the photo, intends to use her loan to buy peanut and millet seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, and picks and to cover the cost of plowing and weeding fields, which have an area of 1.5 hectares. 

The produce will be sold to a customer base composed of consumers and retailers. This will enable Awa to obtain the amount of 215,000 francs CFA. The profit thus obtained will enable her to repay the loan, establish hope chests for the girls' weddings, and to meet certain household needs.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, and farm equipment and to cover the cost of plowing

loans.name: Apostol Santiago Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “APOSTOL SANTIAGO” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Miriam es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de abarrotes, venta de verduras, venta de comida.
 
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Miriam es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un Asesor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su madre, quien trabajada hace varios años con este negocio, con el pasar del tiempo decide independizarse al conseguir un capital básico.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra pollos por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro y las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución
texts.en:
The community association "APOSTOL SANTIAGO" will begin the second cycle of Pro Mujer as part of the Central Focus of Patacamaya. It is made up of eight members and is led by a board of directors where Miriam is the president. The businesses that the members of the community association are in are varied. Among them are: the sale of groceries, vegetables, and meals.

The loan that they take out will benefit small micro-enterprises where Miriam is a member. She says that two years ago she joined Pro Mujer, joining by invitation of an assessor of the institution that was visiting her home. Today she has a business selling meals. She came to know this business by learning it from her mother, who worked for many years with this business. With the passing of time she decided to go independent and get some basic capital.

The loan that she will now take out is to increase capital (purchase chickens wholesale) that she will acquire from the wholesale vendors in the city of La Paz and later prepare and sell in her place of business. This form of work will allow her to generate resources to support her family, as she is married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the savings and training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy chickens wholesale.

loans.name: Remilda

texts.en: Remilda has always the enthusiasm of managing her sari-sari store (convenience store). She has a store that existed for eight years in Calamba and has yield good earnings doing this type of work. Recently, she applied a loan to restock her store, with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. This will ensure that the store has enough inventories for her immediate costumers. Remilda knew that she has to get things right to yield more income for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store, with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce

loans.name: Brenda Rene

texts.en:
Brenda is 34 years old and lives in the city of Escobedo, Neuvo Leon, with her son and husband. Eight years ago she started to sell cosmetics by catalogue, with the objective of helping her husband with the heavy house-hold expenses and with the school payments for their son. Without this business they would hardly cover the basic necessities. It is for this that Brenda has struggled for day after day to maintain what she has built with so much effort with the support of her loved ones.

But to be able to continue she requires a loan in the amount of $250, which will be used for the purchase of merchandise and in this manner be able to increase her sales. Don\'t leave Brenda alone now that she needs your support and generosity. The decision is in your hands, you only need to make your decision. Help her.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Brenda tiene 34 años de edad y vive en la localidad de Escobedo, Nuevo León, con su hijo y esposo. Hace ocho años que ella comenzó a vender cosméticos por catálogo, con el objetivo de ayudar a su esposo con los pesados gastos del hogar y con los pagos de la escuela de su hijo. Sin ésta actividad ellos difícilmente podrían cubrir las necesidades básicas. Es por eso que Brenda ha luchado día a día para mantener lo que con tanto esfuerzo y el apoyo de sus seres queridos ha construido.

Pero para poder continuar ella requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $250 DLLS, mismos que utilizará para comprar mercancía y de esta manera poder incrementar sus ventas. No dejes sola a Brenda hoy que necesita de tu apoyo y generosidad, la decisión en tus manos sólo hace falta que te decidas. Apóyala

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Tuyet

texts.en:
Mrs Tuyet’s husband died and she still helps support 3 children between 24 and 17. Ly, her first, stopped going to school. Her second and third are in grade 12 and 11. She doesn’t have any any land and only has a small hut.

Mrs Tuyet sells pudding and glutinous rice in the morning at a small market. Fortunately, she borrowed a loan of $62 from Mekong Plus and her income increased $3/person/month. Now she asks a loan of $75 for increasing her sales.

loans.use: sells pudding

loans.name: Phin

texts.en: Phin T. and her husband are 44 years old and live in Phnom Penh, Cambodia with their 5 children.  The couple works together, selling pickles at a local market.  They earn a combined $7/day in this venture, and their children work at a garment factory and a small nearby restaurant--contributing regularly to the family income.  Phin T. will use this loan to buy a trailer for her husband's motorbike.  With the trailer, they will be able to transport larger amounts of their product more cheaply.  In the future, Phin T. simply wants to sell more pickles, as she says, "there is a great demand for pickles and I want to satisfy my clients by making more pickles."

loans.use: To purchase a trailer to transport pickles to the market

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
I have a lingerie business in my house and I would like in invest in the purchase of more products in order to have higher sales. This is the only source of income that I have as I am a widow and have one daughter who helps me. I am asking for $1,000 dollars to buy more products for my business.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Rebecca Pendleton

Tengo un negocio de productos de lencería en mi vivienda y me gustaría invertir en la compra de más productos para tener mejores ventas, este es la única fuente de ingresos ya que soy viuda y tengo una hija que también me ayuda”. Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para comprar más productos para mi negocio.

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of more products

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana is widowed and has four children in school. She is a taco and hamburger street vendor. Ever since she became a widower the pension she received had been the only source of income for her family, but it was not enough. She had to look for another source of income, and she decided to dedicate herself to the sale of tacos and hamburgers seven years ago. She did this to be able to support her family, and to be able to get her children ahead by offering them an education and a better quality of life.

Juana is soliciting a loan of $200 in order to fix up her car for her tacos, which is her stand. She is offering to repay the loan within a 5 month period. With it she can continue to receive that income so that she can maintain her family. Thank you for the help.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva Volunteer.

Juana es viuda y tiene 4 hijos estudiantes, ella se dedica a la venta de tacos y hamburguesas ya que desde que enviudo es el único sostén de su familia y con la pensión que recibe no le alcanza, tuvo que buscar otra fuente de ingresos y decidió ponerse a vender tacos y hamburguesas desde hace siete años atrás para poder mantener a su familia y poder sacar adelante a sus hijos brindándoles educación y una mejor calidad de vida.

Juana esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de USD $ 200 para poder mejorar su carro para tacos que es su puesto de trabajo, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en un plazo de 5 meses, con ello poder seguir recibiendo esa entrada de dinero para que pueda mantener a su familia, te agradece apoyo que le brindas para salir adelante.

loans.use: Remodel

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase utensils and tools.

loans.name: Lorm

texts.en:
Mrs. C. Lorm, 46, is a widow with two children: one son and one daughter. Her son is married and living in a separate house. Her daughter (photographed with her) is also married and lives with her mother. Lorm has been a silk weaver for many yeas. It's a skill she learned from her neighbor. Her daughter is also a silk weaver, and her son-in-law is a security guard at a company in Phnom Penh.

Lorm is requesting her second loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $700. She will use this loan to purchase silk materials to continue with her silk production, and to buy a motorbike for her son-in-law to use to go to work.

loans.use: To buy silk materials and buy a motorbike

loans.name: Asooda

texts.en:
Ms. Asuda is a 36-year-old married woman with three children. She is a farmer and lives with her family in Saatli, situated in the central part of Azerbaijan.

She started her business in 1990, when she purchased one cow with money she had saved up. The work is hard but interesting and takes a lot of effort. Asuda purchases calves, breeds them and sells to the butcher, who works at the local big market. Currently, her income is not enough to cover all of Asuda’s family expenses. To increase her income, Asuda has to invest some money to increase her herd. This summer she is applying for a loan of $500 to buy four calves. She hopes eventually to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy calves

loans.name: Jaqueline

texts.en:
Jaqueline R. R. has a general store in Tarapotillo, San Martin.  Tarapotillo is a neighborhood outside the city of Tarapoto.
