In the store she sells fruits, vegetables, rice, oil, sodas, hygiene products and much more.  Clients are happy they can buy the majority of their goods from Jaqueline instead of walking all the way into Tarapoto.  
Jaqueline is 33 years old, married, and has one young child.  She started the store 8 years ago in the living room of her home.  She has recently built a room especially for the store with shelves and display cases.  She loves being able to work from home and care for her child.  One day Jaqueline dreams of sending her child to a University.
A member of the community bank Mujeres Decididas, Jaqueline is requesting a loan of s/1000 to repay over 6 months.  She will use the loan to restock her shelves with the goods the population of Tarapotillo love.

loans.use: She will use the loan to restock her shelves with the goods

loans.name: Budumbuli West G C Group

texts.en: The group leader of this small group is Aisha M..  She is currently in the business of selling new clothes and is requesting a loan to increase her purchases.  Aisha is 48 years old and is a widow.  She has 8 children ranging from ages 7 to 30 and some of her children go to school.  Each week, Aisha makes approximately UGX 50000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to cater for her household needs.  Aisha has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 250000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.  Aisha is joined in her small group by Eseza K. and Madinah M..  Eseza K. has a business running a restaurant and wants to add more equipment.  Madinah M. is currently operating a farming business and wants a loan to buy insecticides.

loans.use: To increase the stock of shoes

loans.name: Orch

texts.en: Mrs. Orch H. is a 65-year-old food seller in Romol Village in the Kampong Cham Province, where she earns approximately $4 per day. H. has seven children, two of whom are single and five of whom are married. Her daughter, Lon Leck, contributes approximately $3 per day to the family from her earnings as a beauty salon owner, while another child sells food with H.. H. now seeks a loan of $600 to purchase more chairs and desks/tables for her business as well as to finance the plowing required to plant potatoes. In addition, she would like to use the loan proceeds to buy beauty salon supplies for Lon Leck.

loans.use: To purchase additional chairs and tables for her business and to fund the plowing of her land so that potatoes can be planted.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary K. is very grateful to Kiva. With her previous loan from Kiva, she increased her stock and income. Mary extended her peanut-butter market base to the villages. She uses a small hand machine to grind the peanuts and packs them in small plastic bags. She sells the butter both in Magburaka town and the nearby villages. Mary is happy that, with the profit, she was able to meet her children's educational requirements and has saved some money through a rotating savings club for future needs. She is requesting a loan of Le.800,000 to further increase her stock for more income.

loans.use: To purchase more peanuts to increase her income

loans.name: Ros's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Ros U. (shown in picture from the left with his wife) was selected to be a group leader by members for a loan from Maxima. In the group there are two families including him. The entire group members are living along National road number two about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

1-Mr. Ros U. (age 51) and his wife were married in 1982.They have nine children, four sons and five daughters. One of their children was married and lives outside the family home. Of the other eight children, five have full time employment and the other three children are in school. Mr. Ros has been motor taxi driver for twenty five years. His wife, Mrs. KhoeU. Min stays at home to take care of the children. Now Mr. Ros is requesting a loan in the amount of $300 to repair his house.

2-Mr. Sokrith U., 25, (the second shown in the picture from the right with his wife) and his wife were married in 2005 and have two daughters. Sokrith has been driving a motor taxi for seven years, while his wife is a garment factory worker. Now Sokrith is requesting a loan in the amount of $300 to purchase a new motorcycle to replace the old one for driving as a motor taxi.

About the group loans

In the group, each member of the group receives an individual loan but is part of a group of individuals bound by a group guarantee. Under this arrangement, each member of the group supports one another and is responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group member if someone is delinquent or defaults.

loans.use: For repairing the house and purchasing a new motorcycle to replace the old one for driving as a motor taxi.

loans.name: Irene Dallo

texts.en:
Irene Dallo is a 38-year-old hard-working lady. She has been in business for the past seven years and has had several businesses in that time. She is currently running a depot that sells Coca-Cola products. She supplies over 30 crates of soda per day.

She is in need of a loan to help her expand her business.

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati is a 50 year old married woman with 4 children between ages 20 and 30. She owns cows and has been selling their milk since 2002. Every day, she works from 8 AM to 2 PM at her business where she can earn a monthly profit of about $175 from her sales.

Bahati now hopes for a loan to buy more animal feed so her cows will produce more milk.

loans.use: To buy more animal feed so she can get more milk from her cows

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en: Khaled, 27 years old and single, lives in a small village in the Bekaa Valley. He runs a nice clothing shop where he sells a variety of shirts, pants, and dresses for all types of clients. Khaled wants to earn additional income to provide a better livelihood for his family. He requests, for the first time, a loan of $US1,000 to purchase additional inventory. The timing for this loan is particularly important to him as there is a high demand for clothes for the "back to school" period and important holidays ahead. The loan will allow him to maintain an adequate amount of inventory on hand and will give him the flexibility to easily update his product selection if an item is selling well or not.

loans.use: Purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort Q. sells fish which she buys from the fishermen, then brings them home for processing and preserving, and then sends them to the market for sale at Elmina. Comfort has received no formal education. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a salt producer. Comfort has been selling fish since 1996. She is responsible for utility bills and other expenses. Her loan will be used to increase her capital to buy more fish to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to help her husband start putting up a house for the family.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: La señora Marina pertenece al Banco Comunal “Corazón D. Jesús”, ubicado en la Av. Universitaria Mz. A Lt. 21, distrito D. Yarinacocha, provincia D. Coronel Portillo, departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 42 años D. edad, es madre D. 2 hijos, uno mayor D. edad y uno que aún dependen D. ella, es casada y su esposo trabaja como patrón D. una lancha maderera. Con el primer préstamo que recibió D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 300 deciD. invertir en la costura. Tiene 2 años trabajando con el banco comunal.nnEn la actualidad cuenta con un pequeño taller D. costura en casa, confecciona diferentes prendas D. vestir para damas, caballeros y niños. nnCon este préstamo D. S/. 1,200, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 6 metros D. tela algodón, 5 metros D. dacrón, 7 metros D. policeda, 4 cajas D. botones, elástico, blondas, etc.nnMarina manifiesta que el banco comunal es una ayuda para su familia. Agradece a todas aquellas personas que le brindaron su apoyo.n
texts.en:
Marina belongs to the Communal Bank, "Heart of Jesus", located in the Yarinacocha district in the city of Coronel Portillo in the state of Ucayali. She is 42 years old. She is the mother of 2 sons- one of age and one that still depends on her. She is married, and her husband is the skipper of a lumber boat. With the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest in dressmaking. She has worked with the communal bank for two years. Currently, she has a small sewing workshop at home and makes different articles of clothing for women, men and children. With this loan, which she will repay within 4 months, she will buy 6 meters of cotton fabric, 5 meters of polyester, 7 meters of silk, and 4 boxes of buttons, elastic, lace, etc. Marina feels that the communal bank helps her family. She is grateful for everyone that has offered her support.

Translated from Spanish by Anne R., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy different types of fabrics (cotton, silk, etc.), buttons, elastics, lace, etc.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Margarita, socia del BC “DORADINAS EN ACCION”, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia del Dorado, distrito de San José de Sisa. Se dedica a la elaboración y venta de cecina y chorizo de cerdo, vende en su casa y de manera ambulatoria recorre la ciudad.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será cancelado en 04 meses, comprará  cerdos de diferentes tamaños para luego sacrificarlos y preparar sus productos para atender los pedidos que le hacen sus clientes porque no tiene mucha competencia en su localidad.

La señora Margarita tiene 36 años de edad, vive con 02 de sus 03 hijos y su esposo quien se dedica a la agricultura, está agradecida con el apoyo brindado porque le permite crecer en su negocio. Su meta es crecer en su negocio y ver profesionales a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ms. Margarita V., a member of the “Doradinas en Acción” (Dorado Women in Action) microfinance institute, lives in the San Martín region of the Dorado province, district of San José de Sisa. She makes and sells cecina (meat that has been cured and dried) and pork sausage. She sells her products both from her home and as a street vendor in the city.

With this 1,000.00 PEN loan, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will purchase different-sized pigs so that she can slaughter them and prepare her products, thus filling her customers’ orders since she does not have competition in her locality.

Ms. V. is 36 years old and lives with 2 of her 3 children and her husband, who works in agriculture. She is thankful for the support she has been given because it has allowed her business to grow. Her goal is to expand her business and watch her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase different-sized pigs

location.town: San José de Sisa - San Martin

loans.name: Nasreen Akhtar M. Ramzan Group

texts.en:
Nasreen akhtar baji is a 36 year old married lady who lives in a famous historical place named Yadgar in the city Lahore, Pakistan. She has lived in this place for the past 5 years. She completed her education to 8th standard but couldn’t study further. Her mother was a midwife, and now she works in the same profession. Her husband's name is M. R., and he has run a grocery shop in the community for the past 10 years. People are used to coming to him to buying groceries, and he has a good reputation in this business.

Nasreen baji is a mother of two kids: one son and one daughter. Her son reads in 3rd standard and her daughter reads in 5th standard. Nasreen baji successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan again to buy groceries to diversify her husband’s grocery shop into a grocery store. 

She is a group leader of a few more members of her locality. Shamshad baji wants a loan to change the body of her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy religious (Islamic) books for her bookshop. Shabnam baji wants a loan for her holy book (Quran-e-Pak) selling business. Farzana baji wants a loan to buy leather and nails for her shoe making business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery shop

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.en:
Fourteen people living in Srae Spey village in Kampong Cham province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mr. BunT. E., the 47-year-old village bank president, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate vegetables. His wife, Mrs. Pench Muoy Shea, helps him in the farminig. In this plantation, they face a problem because they do not have vegetable seed to grow on the field. Thus, Mr. BunT. E. decided to ask for a loan to buy vegetable seed for growing on the field. He is the father of five children, four of whom are enrolled in the local school while the other is too young to work or study. 

Nine members in this group loan have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy vegetable seed for growing on the field.

loans.name: Ruzibibi

texts.en:
R. Ruzibibi is a hard working woman and since 2004 has dedicated herself to selling a variety of vegetables in the central market of Kanibadam. She characterized herself as happy and humble. She started her business with her savings, which she had accumulated over a long period of time. She is the mother of 4 children that she would like to offer an education to them as they are minors. Her biggest dream is to prepare her children to have professions so they don't have to suffer like she did since childhood working hard labor. To realize this dream, Ruzibibi now requests $800 USD for the term of 6 months. With this loan she wants to buy more goods to increase her earnings. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road, the end of Alexander the Great's rule and for it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: Increasing the range of vegetables at her produce stand.

loans.name: Soam

texts.en: Soam C., 30, is married and lives in the Prey Veng province with her husband, pictured here. She sells drinking water at the Neak Leung ferry station and is able to make US$3 per day. Her husband is a taxi promoter who is paid to get customers for taxis. On average, he makes US$5 per day. Soam C. is asking for a loan to purchase a motorbike for her husband so he can operate it when he isn't working at the taxi station.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Qurbonali

texts.ru: Рахмонов КУрбонали проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст 52 года , женат и имеет семерых детей. Работает учитенлем в средней школе. Кроме того занимается земледелием. Имеет участок земли , который засеивает различного рода  сельхоз культурами.Планирует получить для того, чтобы закупить семена и удобрения. Это поможет ему получить качественный урожай. Полученный урожай сможет реализовать и получить прибыль. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Qurbonali R. lives in the city of Vadat. He is 52 years old, married, and the father of 7 children. He is a middle school teacher, but also a farmer. He plants a variety of crops on his piece of land. He decided to use a loan for purchasing seeds and fertilizer. That will help him raise a high quality product. The harvest will be sold to make a profit. The loan will be repaid over 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Seed and fertilizer purchase

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline A. is a 36-year-old mother of five children; the oldest is 17 and the youngest is 9 months. She is married to an occupational therapist. To supplement her husband’s income, she sells used clothes downtown, though she lives in Yolanda slum. She was born in Kisumu and loves it here. She says the loans help her a lot because they allow her to purchase clothes in bulk. She is asking for 20,000 KSH and would like to thank Kiva lenders in advance for their lending.

Caroline recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya. As a CHW she will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illness. Her work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin-enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

loans.use: adding to her clothing stock

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Mrs. Rufina M. is a 44-year-old member from Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is married to a farmer and has five children studying in elementary and secondary schools. Abject poverty is inevitable to them. Therefore, she commenced to buy and sell root crops and vegetables to their neighbors, relatives and friends.

Rufina was hooked on the idea of putting up a little "sari-sari" (variety) store. She thought that their daily needs could be supplied by the income from the store. Not having enough capital to start a sari-sari store she joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in October 2006 to access loan credit for additional capital. All these loans were repaid in a timely manner. She is a member in good standing.

The loans from Paglaum MPC helped the couple send their children to school. She said it's no longer a losing battle facing everyday hardships, having her husband by her side to lend a hand. And she is truly thankful to Paglaum MPC for keeping them company in all their financial needs.

In the future, the couple wishes to operate a bigger sari-sari store with a bakeshop in it. Heart’s desire is to send their children to college and witness them successful in the future.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.ru:
Нурматов Шухрат- мужчина 40 лет. Женат имеет 4-х детей. Шухрат имеет 10 летный  стаж в сфере животноводства. Ему помогает жена Гуландом и сын Мурод. 
Так как весной сезон закупа скота, Шухрат хочет на полученный займ купить овец и перепродать  по выгодной ему цене. Он работает сварщикам и дополнительно подрабатывает на жизнь. Откорм и продажа домашнего скота является основным видом деятельности Шухрата.
texts.en:
N. Shuhrat is a 40 year old man. He is married and has 4 children. Shuhrat has 10 years of livestock experience. His wife, Gulandom, and son, Murod, help him. Because spring is the season to purchase livestock, Shuhrat would like to use the loan to purchase sheep and to resell them at a profitable price. He works as a welder and earns additional income to support his lifestyle. The fattening and sale of livestock is Shuhrat’s main business.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sheep

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina G. is a 37-year-old local restaurant operator who currently lives with her parent. She is single and has two children attending school. Christina has been in food provision for a year now. She understands customer ethics and is particularly aware of the importance of maintaining product quality and offering excellent service.

She prepares and sells local foods like fufu, banku, and other local dishes. Fufu is prepared from pounded cassava and plantain, and is taken with all kinds of soup. Banku is prepared from milled maize grainsm and it is taken with hot pepper or soup. With her tasty meals, Christina has attracted lots of customers in the area where she serves her food. As a result, it has become necessary to employ additional hands to assist her in food-delivery service.

She tells us that the prices of raw materials have gone up significantly and she needs the support of a loan to enable her to meet her production expenditure. With this loan, she wants to purchase more raw ingredients, such as bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish, and vegetables as well as firewood to prepare her meals. She would be grateful for such assistance.

She belongs to the village bank called "Emmanuel."

loans.use: To buy materials like maize, cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood.

loans.name: Taras

texts.en:
Taras is married with three kids. His family lives in Stryi. Taras runs a carpentry business. He manufactures and sells doors and flooring. He always offers reasonable prices and friendly customer service, which helped him gain a good reputation in town. Taras has a good discount system for all his wholesale buyers. He has been in this business for six years. He currently has 37,000 Grivnyas in inventory. 

Taras is requesting a 6,500 Grivnya loan to purchase raw materials and increase the assorted merchandise he offers for sale. His business can boast very stable financial standing even in this time of economic volatility. Taras is dreaming about buying a facility for his business to save on rent expenses. We hope financial assistance will help his business grow and develop and make his dream come true one day.

loans.use: To diversify his assorted merchandise for sale

loans.name: Nkakrankakra Group

texts.en:
Salim is twenty-nine years old. He is single but cares for two younger siblings who are currently in primary school. He is a carpenter by profession. Salim is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Nkakra-nkakra’ which literally means gradual by gradual. He is the young man standing in the group photograph. The members of this group are mostly traders, food vendors and or farmers. They work to help their spouses in providing for their families.

They buy their raw materials, wares or goods from other towns and sometimes from nearby communities and sell at the local market square. Some of them trek to other towns to sell on their market days as well. The members have been in business for some time and have amassed a great deal of experience in their businesses. It is in light of this that they are requesting a loan to procure more goods to expand their businesses.

The members of the group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan. It is their desire to give their children a good education.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
LINA S. is 38 years old, married with 2 school-age children, and a resident of Brgy. Canjusa, Pulupandan, Negros Occidental.

Lina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1997 because she did not want her family to be wholly dependent on her husband's income, which was really not enough to support their needs especially with two growing kids. 

So Lina ventured into seafood processing and sales. In the picture, Lina is shown posing in front of beds of krill being prepared for Ginamos production. Lina just paid off her previous loan of PHP 29,500.00. For this 16th loan cycle she needs to borrow PHP 15,000 to sustain her expanding business. 

Having her own business has given her the confidence and the independence she wants in her married life. She realizes that earning her own income to help her husband support their children has made their family unit even stronger.
 
What is Ginamos?

Ginamos is a generic Hiligaynon (the local dialect in Western Visayas) term for anything that is salted and aged to ferment - in Tagalog it is known as Bagoong. Ginamos can also refer to fermented salted fish, mussels, oysters, etc. but in general, the term Ginamos refers to mashed salted fermented krill - all the others must be qualified - e.g. Ginamos na isda (fermented salted fish) or Ginamos na Tahong (fermented salted mussels).

Ginamos is prepared by mashing sea salt and krill together until the salt is well mixed into the finely ground krill, then it is kept in containers to age until ready. Ginamos in Negros Island is usually moist but firm and sold by the block or smaller bricks. Vendors usually pre-cut the blocks into different sizes to offer the buyers a selection. People usually buy Ginamos either as a flavor enhancer to dishes like Pinakbet (a vegetable stew) or as a dish by itself. When cooked as a dish, it is usually mixed with vinegar and sauteed with lots of garlic and sometimes with fried pork rind, and is served with rice as a meal or with green mangoes as an appetizer.


 
About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: ADDITIONAL CAPITAL TO EXPAND HER BUSINESS OPERATIONS

loans.name: Gumercinda

texts.es:
La señora Gumercinda  es socia del Banco Comunal “Señor de la Justicia”, ubicado en la cuidad de Puno, provincia de Puno, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 72 años de edad, está casada y es madre de 03 hijos, todos ya casados.  Ella estudió educación primaria solo hasta 4to grado, vive en el Barrio Independencia.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 2 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para se negocio de pensión familiar (renta habitaciones).

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, con este monto ella comprará víveres tales como arroz, aceite, papa, carne, fideos, leche, etc. para la preparación de alimentos.  Ella tiene como clientes a sus mismos inquilinos que en su mayoría son estudiantes.

Su deseo es  continuar trabajando.

A ella le gustan las facilidades en los préstamos y los ahorros
texts.en:
Sra. Gumercinda is a member of the Communal Bank “Señor de la Justicia” (Lord of Justice), located in the city of Puno, Puno Province, Department of Puno. She is 72 years old, married, and the mother of 3 children (all are married). Sra. Gumercinda has a 4th grade education. She lives in the neighborhood of Independencia. She has been working with Manuela Ramos for the past 2 years. Her first loan of 500 soles was used as capital for her boarding house (rooms for rent). She is requesting another loan in the amount of 500 soles to buy food items such as rice, oil, potatoes, meat, noodles, milk, etc., for preparing meals. The majority of her tenants are students. Sra. Gumercinda hopes to continue working. She enjoys the simplicity of her loans and having the ability to save.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, oil, potatoes, meat, noodles, milk, etc.

loans.name: Paula Argentina

texts.es: La señora Paula Argentina A., tiene la edad de 38 años, habita en el barrio Los Martínez, ubicado en el municipio de La Concepción;  junto a su esposo el cual trabaja y le apoya con los gastos del hogar, ellos tiene tres hijos uno de ellos independiente y los otros estudiantes de secundaria, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida, doña Paula desde hace 26 años se dedica a venta y compra de frutas y verduras el cual se vende mucho la dificultad es cuando la alza de precios aumenta y las ventas bajan por que no la quieren comprar. Los planes hacia un futuro en su negocio es poder expandirse. Con el préstamo va a comprar frutas y verduras para dar un mejor servicio cada día a sus clientes. Da las gracias Afodenic por la oportunidad de estos séptimos ciclos el cual ha logrado invertir en su negocio.

loans.use: Comprar frutas y verduras

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean manages a general store business in the rural community of Bantay Solana, Cagayan. She is 34 years old and is married to Samson A.. They are blessed with two children – Jinkie, 13, and Mikee, 12 – who are both studying. The couple consider their children as their treasure in life so they are taking very good care of them.

Jean wanted to apply for additional capital from Kiva lenders to further improve her store. She is applying for the amount of 5,000 PHP, which will be of great help.

loans.use: As additional capital

loans.name: Doracy

texts.en:
When Doracy moved to the U.S., she had to close the lingerie store she had already set up in her home country, Brazil. Once she moved, she tried selling door-to-door the goods she had imported, but she found it to be very challenging - much more difficult than it was when she had her own store. Doracy saved every single penny in order to finally open her current storefront space here in the U.S. in 2006.

Not knowing English, or being able to access capital from a bank, Doracy overcame many obstacles to build her dream here in the U.S. Fortunately, she has been able to learn some English in order to communicate with her clients and also plans to move to a bigger and better location later this year.

This is Doracy’s third loan with ACCION USA, and she says that every one of her experiences has helped expand her business by allowing her to purchase more inventory, which she can find at better prices with cash rather than credit. She says that ACCION USA has made it possible for her to dream big, and she hopes to open a second store in a mall and be successful enough to buy her own house eventually.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Frisca

texts.en:
Frisca E. is from the town of Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 41 years old. Frisca is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Frisca owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting rice for sale. 
In 2006, Frisca joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Frisca has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000 PHP from PMPC. Frisca is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Frisca from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Llany

texts.es: La señora Llany, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Trabajadoras”,  Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Divorciada, tiene 46 años y 03 hijos,  que estudian y aun depende de ella. Anteriormente, Llany se dedicaba a brindar pensión y al servicio de Motokar y su amor y cariño a sus hijos, le  motivaron a buscar alternativas de generar fuentes de ingresos y gracias a su cualidad de ser una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora, le ayudaron a iniciarse en la venta de chupetes, nos cuenta que le esta yendo muy bien y poco a poco ha ido ganando clientes. En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo por que ven que el producto que ella ofrece tiene muy buena acogida y sobretodo son atendidos con amabilidad que es lo que a ella le caracteriza. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, comprará ingredientes para la preparación de su producto como azúcar en kilos,  cajas de leche y frutas que a diario necesita para la preparación de los chupetes, a diario cuenta con sus productos surtidos, para así poder captar una mayor clientela. Llany, se siente con mucha fortaleza para continuar trabajando, y perseverando día a día y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Sra. Llany is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Trabajadoras” (The Workers), which is in the District of Juanjui, Mariscal Cáceres Province, Department of San Martín. She is 46 years old, divorced, and has 3 dependent children attending school.

Llany previously operated a boarding house and provided motorcycle transport services. Her love of children motivated her to seek alternative sources of income. Thanks to her hard work and entrepreneurial spirit, she decided to sell lollipops. She says business is doing very well and that she is steadily gaining more customers. Llany continues to manage her business to this day. Her products are well received and she treats all of her customers with kindness.

With this loan of 1000 soles, Llany will buy ingredients used in making her product such as sugar by the kilo, cartons of milk, and fruit. She prepares a wide assortment of lollipops each day so that she can attract a larger clientele. Llany feels strong enough to continue working and persevering day after day. She thanks Manuela Ramos for helping women like her and providing them with opportunities to develop in the communities where they operate.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for making lollipops

loans.name: Rabih

texts.en:
Rabih is a 30-year-old man who lives in Saida, Southern Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Rabih has been selling chickens since 2002. Rabih prices his chickens depending on their weights. Rabih requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase chickens for his work. This is the first time that Rabih has requested a loan from Al Majmoua.

Rabih is special in his work because he sells "bio" chickens. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. Rabih decided on doing this business because before he used to work as a car mechanic and he didn’t find a lot of work, so he decided on changing his work in order to improve his financial situation. He plans to keep on improving his work.

loans.use: To purchase chickens for his work

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary R. is 35 years old and is married. Her husband is a car driver. She has 2 children and her children go to school.

Mary is currently in the business of selling maize flour, beans, soghum, etc in the market.

She is requesting a loan to buy more bags of beans and maize flour to sell.

With the extra profits from her loan she hopes to be able to open up a hotel.

About BRAC

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more bags of beans and maize flour to sell.

loans.name: Roquelito

texts.en:
Roquelito M. is from the village of San M.. He is 30 years old. Roquelito is married and has 2 infant children. To make a living, Roquelito provides a transportation service in the local community. Roquelito has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Roquelito joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Roquelito is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Pamella A.

texts.en: Pamella A. O. runs a cereal business specializing in rice. She buys the rice once each week from farmers in Ahero, a neighboring district. She is 40 years old and married, and the mother of 5 children. Her future plan is to buy a dairy cattle and venture into the milk business. She would like a loan of Kshs. 40,000 to expand her rice business into new markets.

loans.use: To expand her cereal business

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion S., 52, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Armando S., a retired businessman, she makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that they can have a better life. Both of them have been managing their own variety store for a year.

Salvacion S. has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT), a Kiva partner, for more than four years. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow several times in CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to buy added stock for her store. Her business lets her earn a profit of 6,250 Philippine pesos per month.  

Now, with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 10,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by allowing her to buy assorted canned goods, snacks, beverages and toiletries for her store.

She dreams that her store will continue to grow and become a mini grocery someday so that she can help with the schooling of her grandchildren. 


* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: Buying assorted canned goods, snacks, beverages and toiletries for her store

loans.name: Ramil

texts.en:
Ramil A. is a 39-year-old man who sells vegetables in the central market in Agsu city. Ramil started his small convenience store when he was unemployed more than fifteen years ago. His biggest dream is to have a general store where he can sell other items besides vegetables and fruit.

With the loan, Ramil expects to keep growing his business little by little and, with the earnings, he'll keep improving his quality of life and economic situation along with his business until he achieves his goal.

Ramil’s wish is that one day he will build his own family together with his prosperous businesses.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables and fruit to sell

loans.name: Kavumbi Karisa

texts.en:
Kavumbi Karisa is a 51-year-old lady who is married to Gabriel, and together they have two children: Patricia and Joseph. 

Kavumbi was introduced to Kadet by her sisters, who were at one time clients with Kadet. She operates her business in Malindi's new market which is in town. Her customers are mainly from within the households of Malindi town and hotels in the town where she supplies her goods. She sells fruits and vegetables to them and she gets a monthly profit of Kshs 16,000 and also does some farming on the side.

With the extra income from this loan, Kavumbi hopes to complete her rental houses. She is a down to earth woman with a mind to succeed and she dreams of owning a series of businesses in Malindi town.

loans.use: To purchase cabbages, bananas and watermelons worth Kshs 40000 and repairing the business premises with Kshs 20000

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
La Señora Patricia R. tiene ya más de tres años dedicándose a la venta y elaboración de alimentos. 
Le están ofreciendo un carrito para la venta de tacos a muy buen precio, pero ella no cuenta con el dinero necesario, es por eso que esta solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar el carrito que le están ofreciendo y así poder vender en otro lugar y darle empleo a otra persona. 
Doña Patricia es madre soltera y tiene bajo su responsabilidad a dos hijos de mediana edad y quienes les quiere dar los estudios necesarios para su futuro.
texts.en:
Miss Patricia R. has been working for more than three years in producing and selling food. She is being offered a cart at a very low price with which she can sell tacos, but she does not have the necessary money. It’s for this reason that she is asking for a loan, in order to buy the cart that she is being offered and therefore be able to sell in other places and employ another person. Miss Patricia is a single mother and has under her responsibility two school-aged children whom she wants to provide with the necessary studies for their future.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase another cart and equip it

loans.name: Nueva Jerusalen Group

texts.es: Doña Juana B., es casada de 42 años de edad, se dedica a vender “utensilios de cocina” en la plaza del mercado municipal de Totonicapán, con la necesidad de ampliar su negocio, decide crear un grupo con sus vecinas del cantón, logrando reunir diez señoras responsables y que se dedican a diversas actividades, el Banco Comunal de denomina “NUEVA JERUSALEN”, se acercan a las oficinas de ASDIR solicitando un préstamo grupal, para poder mejorar la rentabilidad de sus actividades económicas y condiciones de vida, la ubicación del grupo es en el Cantón Chotacaj, del municipio y departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala.
texts.en:
Juana B., 42, is married and sells "kitchen utensils" in Totonicapán's municipal market's plaza. With the aim in mind to increase her business, she organized a group of ten, responsible neighbors into a group; each woman in the group is involved in a different commercial activity. The communal bank they formed is called: "NUEVA JERUSALEN" (New Jerusalem) and they came by ASDIR's offices to request a group loan designed to increse the profitability of their businesses and improve their living conditions. The group is located in Chotocaj, Totonicapán, Guatemala.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 32-year-old single man living in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon. He owns a car-cleaning garage. He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase a water pump machine for his work. This is the first time that he has requested a loan and is confident that this loan will improve his work. He is special in his work because he does clean work and knows how to take care of cars. For the future, he plans to keep on improving his work.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump machine for his work.

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Poverty has made Elenita O. a tough and determined woman. She has been through a lot of challenges in life even before she had her own family. Even then, she has able to surmount those hurdles and has able to make her life happy with her loving and supportive husband and her four treasured children who inspire her. They made themselves contended with the things they can afford. However, they are dreaming of a better life in the future. 

Four of Elenita’s children were not able to graduate or even reach a secondary level of education. They now range are from 14 to 21 years old and are working as a hired laborers. Despite that, Elenita O. is hoping that her youngest child, who is ten years old, will graduate from college because of the proceeds from her hog-raising business. 

Elenita is requesting a loan from ASHI to finance her plan of expanding her hog-raising business. She wished to raise many hogs and sell them in a larger volume to have more gains. Making her business stable would be a great help to the family because her husband's earnings as a hired laborer are sporadic and just small.

loans.use: To purchase piglets for a hog-raising business.

loans.name: Eriberto Antonio

texts.es:
Don Heriberto es un hombre trabajador, desde su juventud ayudaba a sus padres a trabajar,  tiene la edad de 57 años y labora para el ejército de Nicaragua como mecánico. Vive junto a su esposa sus hijos son independiente, con los financiamiento ha logrado hacer las mejoras de su casa lo que para el es una sastifaccion el bienestar familiar.
 Con el crédito mejorara la parte de atrás de su casa que aun la tiene parte forrada con zinc viejo ya que no logro terminarla por falta de dinero. Lo que espera cerrarla para mejor seguridad. Me beneficia en el solar que mi vecina tiene un muro lo que a futuro cerrara el otro lado de su terreno para reguardar su propiedad.
texts.en:
Heriberto is a hard worker. He’s been helping his parents since he was a child. He is now 57 years old and works as a mechanic for the Nicaraguan army. He lives with his wife. His children are fully grown. He has been able to make improvements to his home through the loans he has obtained, which makes him happy because it helps provide for the well being of his family. He will use the money from this loan to improve the rear portion of his home, which is formed in part with old zinc sheet metal. He was not able to complete it due to lack of funds. He wants to close it off in order to make it more secure. He benefits from his neighbor’s wall and in the future he will close off the rest of his property.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building materials

loans.name: La Cosecha 2 Group

texts.en:
Ana is the coordinator of her group, La Cosecha (The Harvest), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti). Her group is located in Los Alcarrizos, a dusty industrial area north of the city, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their two children.
Ana is excited to be taking her third loan with Kiva partner, Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business running a beauty salon by purchasing more beauty products. She will use the profits to save towards expanding her salon. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase beauty products for her salon

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene su tienda de abarrotes de barrio, en la zona de Rio Seco de la Ciudad de El Alto, es su principal fuente de ingreso con lo que cubre la manutención de su dos hijos que depende de ella, vive en su casa propia  ubicado en la zona Las Viviendas de la misma ciudad.
 
El crédito lo destinará para la compra de mercadería para la tienda y generar mayores ingresos económicos.
 
Es el cuarto crédito con IMPRO, el buen comportamiento de pago le permite acceder a otro préstamo solicitado por Rosa.
texts.en:
Rosa has her neighborhood grocery store in the Rio Seco area of the city of El Alto. It is her main source of income that allows her to support her two children who depend on her. She lives in her own home located in the Las Viviendas area of the same city. She will use the funds to buy merchandise for the store in order to generate higher income. This is her 4th loan with IMPRO. Her good repayment history qualifies Rosa for another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items like bread, beverages and candy for her grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Rusell

texts.en:
Rusell G. is from the village of Southwestern Pob. Calamba Misamis Occidental. She is 35 years old. Rusell is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Rusell owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling meat like pork and beef in the local community. Rusell has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 25000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Rusell joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rusell has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Rusell is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Rusell from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Morn's Group

texts.en:
Morn S., 58, is the leader of this group loan having been selected by its five members who all live in Kaoh Chamroeun village in Kandal province. Each member of this group will use their portion of the loan to support their different businesses.

Morn and her husband are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice for a living.  They work very hard to support their family.  She wants a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide to cultivate rice.  They have a child who is a seamstress in a garment factory.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and pesticide to cultivate rice.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
From the village of Poblacion, Mahinog, Camiguin Province, Lina A. is 54 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Lina owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Engaged in her business for over five years, she earns approximately 4500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Lina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting her first loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell, Lina plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her store.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anacleta

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen del Carmen de Yuncaypata”; El banco está ubicado en la comunidad de Yuncaypata, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Anacleta; ella tiene 43 años de edad y es casada  y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el  negocio de venta de productos secos, la socia junto con otras socias venden productos secos en el mercado de Huancaro sección granos secos, ellas se juntan y venden desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia quiere tener un local para vender los productos secos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar  productos secos al por mayor como quinua, trigo y moraya. 


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the community bank "Virgen del Carmen de Yuncaypata". The bank is located in the community of Yuncaypata and is in the province of Cusco and Cusco department. The member is Anacleta. She is 43 years old, married, and has three children. She alternates her daily activities with the business of selling dried foods. Along with other members of the bank, she sells dried goods at the Huancaro market in the dried grains section. They meet and start selling their goods at 6:00am and work until 5:00pm. She wants to have a store where she can sell dried goods. She is requesting a loan to buy dried goods such as quinoa, wheat, and dried potatoes. She is grateful to everyone who is part of this dream through this loan, and promises to make her repayments according to the established timetable.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy dried goods such as quinoa, wheat, and dried potatoes.

loans.name: Odgerel

texts.en: Odgerel B. is 39 years old and lives with her husband and nine year-old daughter in an apartment in Arhangai province of Mongolia.  Her daughter attends primary school.  Odgerel makes furniture and wood items in her home.  She started this business in 2006 by purchasing necessary tools and equipment with a working capital of 350,000 MNT.  Since then, she has made quality furnishings and wood items for the people of her town.  In the 4 years of owning her business, Odgerel has not only gained experience and knowledge in making quality furniture products, but she has also gained a wide customer base. She is requesting a 600,000 MNT loan to buy more timber and paint for her carpentry business.

loans.use: To buy more timber

loans.name: Creciendo Juntos Group

texts.es: Thalia tiene 18 años y vive en la zona C de Huaycán, está soltera y se desempeña de profesora, es la presidenta del nuevo grupo “Creciendo Juntos” el cual se conforma de vecinas-amigas, Thalia invertirá en bisutería este ultimo préstamo para apoyar a su familia y ahorrar para sacar su especialización en educación, ella empezó su trabajo como auxiliar de educación  y le gusto tanto que decidió quedarse y ser profesora, espera terminar su carrera y seguir apoyando a su familia y pagar sus estudios por lo que espera que Edaprospo siga apoyando a ella en sus metas y a todo su grupo.
texts.en: Thalia is 18 years old and lives in the C zone of Huaycán.  Thalia is single and works as a teacher, she is the president of the new group, “Creciendo Juntos” (Growing Together) which is made up of neighbors-friends. Thalia will buy costume jewelry this loan will be used to help her family and to save to get her specialization in education, she began her work as an educational assistant and she liked it so much that she decided to become a teacher. Thalia hopes to finish her degree and to keep helping her family and to pay for her education which is why he hopes that Edaprospo (Kiva’s field partner) will keep helping her in her goals as well as the rest of the group.

loans.use: To buy products.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The Kiva borrower is a 42-year-old single from Lebanon. He lives with his mother and one brother. He has been working as an experienced home painter almost fifteen years. Over the years, thanks to his business income, he has been able to cooperate with his brother to pay the expenses of the family. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. for a new big project he is planning to take charge of. He wants to be prepared for this new project with all the painting supplies needed to accomplish it successfully and build a good business reputation in order to take more projects in the future.

loans.use: To purchase painting supplies

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou C. is 43 years old, married and has seven school-aged children. She is from the village of Tumpagon, a part of Cagayan de Oro City, Misamis Oriental province on the Mindanao islands. Marilou runs a tailoring business providing general alterations and sewing curtains, pillow cases, etc. for local community members. Marilou has been in business for over five years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Marilou joined HSPFI to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to invest in expanding her business. Marilou is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional fabric and materials. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business.

About HSPFI:

Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation, Inc., or HSPFI, is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabric and materials

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia N. lives in the Kawaala neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has six children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her three sisters). 

Olivia has a charcoal-selling business. She has been in this business for seven years and she works seven days out of every week. Olivia sells her products from home on a retail basis. 

Olivia has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. She also generates additional income through selling second-hand bags.

The main business challenges for Olivia include the rainy season and the ever-increasing prices of bags of charcoal. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling on wholesale basis only and also to build more rental rooms. Olivia lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John K., age 32, operates a well-stocked general shop at Kingstone Estate. He is married to Zepha Kemunto and together they have three children, Teresa aged 11 years in class 5, Robert aged 8 years in class 2 and Irene aged 3 years. He was introduced to KADET by other KADET clients.

John has been running this business for 10 years and his monthly profit is Kshs 45000. This loan of Kshs 81000 is his second loan with KADET. With the loan he will buy a motorbike to start a motorcycle transport business. If the loan boosts his income, John will buy another motorcycle and employ someone to operate it. 

John’s dream is to buy a piece of land and build a house to live in with his family. He also plans to educate his children to university level. He describes himself as polite, hardworking and honest.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle and start a transport business

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.en: Bernardina belongs to the “Solidaridad Cachimayo” cooperative bank, which is located in the Cachimayo district of the province of Chinceros. She is 54 years old and married with six children — three girls and three boys. She is requesting the loan to invest in her food sale business. She sells "salchipapa" (a mixture of French fries and hotdogs covered in mustard, ketchup, and mayo) and other food items in the street in Cachimayo from 4pm to 9pm. She is very happy with the loan granted, and commits to making her payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: Invest in food sale business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a larger quantity of cheese to increase her sales

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 28-year-old single man living on his own. He is from Lebanon. He has been playing music for more than ten years with a local band. In 2005, he decided to start playing music alone, dealing with multiple cafés and restaurants. This competent man was able to build up a good number of customers who adore listening to his music. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to renew his musical instruments so he can play his music well and please his customers with his talented playing.

loans.use: renew his musical instruments

loans.name: Lynden

texts.en:
Lynden E. is from the village of Misom, Baliangao. She is 46 years old, married and has 1 school-aged child. Lynden owns and operates a mini-gasoline store. She has been engaged in her business for 20 years and earns a monthly net income of 3,500 PHP. Lynden is also engaged in rice production as an additional source of income.

In 2001, Lynden joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lynden has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used to invest in expanding the business. Lynden is requesting a new loan of 14,500 PHP which will be used to redeem her pawned coconut land. This will be the 19th loan taken out by Lynden from PMPC.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To redeem her pawned parcel of coconut land

loans.name: Hem

texts.en:
Mr. Hem was born in 1951. He and his wife, Mrs. Nem, are farmers who own a 4-hectare plot of land where they grow rice on some parts to sell, and on other parts to feed their family.  He is also a pig breeder.  

In the rice field, Mr. Hem has problems because his field has infertile soil, a lot of insect, and it is far away from an irrigation system. So to improve rice production, Mr. Hem is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer, gasoline, and pesticide. 

Mr. Hem is a father of six children – one is a security guard, one is a chef, and the others are attending a local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, gasoline, and pesticide

loans.name: Nueva Vida  1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Patria is one of the members of the "Nueva vida" 1 y 2 *New Life* group, a group in which the majority are Haitian immigrants who live in the city of La Romana, where the economy depends on the sugar industry and on luxury tourism. It is becoming one of the most exclusive destinations in the Dominican Republic. There is a scarcity of potable water and of electricity, and there is a population of people from the Dominican Republic and Haitian immigrants. Their principle activity is new clothing sales.

Patria is a single mom with three children. Her most difficult challenge has been to work for her children, in a different country with a different culture. She really enjoys working, and she doesn´t know what is to be lazy at home. Unless she is sick, she needs to be doing something, selling or doing household activities.

Patria is very excited to receive her first loan from Esperanza International. She has had her business for about 10 years, when she began selling miscellaneous products. She is planning to invest her loan in the purchase of new clothes, especially spring and summer clothing. Easter is close and the weather is very warm; people are waiting to go to the beach and use light clothing. She plans to use her earnings to reinvest in her business and to provide all they need as a family. Thank you so much for supporting this group.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Adono

texts.fr:
Madame Adono exerce comme activité génératrice de revenus la vente des condiments. En effet elle s’approvisionne en petit poisson au port de pèche et Baguida qu’elle revient fris dans l’huile pour la vente, et au grand marché de Lomé  pour divers autres condiments. Elle revend ensuite à la devanture de sa maison dans un hagar.. Elle est très accueillante et attire de plus en plus de clients.   Elle espère accroître sa marge bénéficiaire et demande un prêt pour acheter  5 tas de  petits poissons, 4 paniers de tomate, 3 paniers de gombo et 2 paniers de piment vert.
Elle a 42 ans et est mariée à un transitaire de profession. Elle est résidente à Baguida et a 3 enfants en charge.
texts.en:
Ms. Adono has a revenue-generating business selling condiments. Basically, she stocks up on small fish at the fishing port and she brings them back fried in oil for resale in Baguida. She also stocks up at the main market of Lomé for a variety of condiments. She then makes her sales in a shed in front of her house. She is very accommodating and attracts more and more customers. 

She hopes to increase her profit margin and is asking for a loan for buying: 5 piles of small fish, 4 baskets of tomatoes, 3 baskets of okra, and 2 baskets of green chili peppers. 

She is 42 years old and married to a shipping agent. She is a resident of Baguida and has three children to support.

loans.use: achat de petit poissons, tomate, gombo et  piment vert

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia A. is from the village of Banigan, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 32 years old. Cecilia is married and has one school-aged child. 

To make a living, Cecilia is starting a business venture. She will be operating a specialized retail store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She is just starting this business.

In 2009, Cecilia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Cecilia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from PMPC. 

Cecilia is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used to purchase variety of products such as can goods, shampoo, toothpaste etc. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Cecilia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase variety of products such as can goods, shampoo,toothpaste for her retail store

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret currently sells soft drinks. She is 28 years old, married, and has five children, all of whom go to school. Margret borrowed a loan to stock more soft drinks to sell. She hopes to expand in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: María Juana

texts.es:
María Juana P. C. tiene 48 años, es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos que son solteros en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 9 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO DE MUJERES CARBON CHINIPAMBA se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad carbón Chinipamba, sector cuatro esquinas Cantón Guaranda a una distancia de 20 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa, la mayor parte de los socios se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio por lo que produce arroz, cebada, habas quinua, papas y animales de cómo: vacas lecheras y animales de corral.

María se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra papas, cebada, habas y habas, tiene cuatro cuadras y media, tiene casa propia y esposo se dedica también a la agricultura tienen tres cabezas de ganado. Las compras las realiza en el mercado de Guaranda y las vende en el mercado mayorista de la misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos y alimentación de los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar más terreno para seguir sembrando.

Le gusta visitar a la familia, fiestas del 15 de agosto que es la fiesta de María Auxiliadora, el carnaval, la navidad, finados año viejo y semana santa.
texts.en:
María Juana P. C. is 48 years old, married, and lives with her husband and children, who are single, in the Guaranda canton, Bolívar province. She has 9 children.  

The members of the women's group CARBON CHINIPAMBA community bank is found in the Carbón Chinipamba community, in the Cuatro Esquinas area. Cantón Guaranda is 20 minutes from the cooperative office. Most of the members work in agriculture, cattle and trade. Rice, barley, beans. quinoa, potatoes are prodcued as well as milking cows and penned animals.  

María works in farming. She plants potatoes, barley, and beans. She has four and a half lots. She has her own house and her husband is also a farmer. They have three heads of cattle. She makes her purchases in the Guaranda market and sells her product in the wholesale market of the same city.  

She is asking for a loan to buy materials and fees for the animals. The support of the loan will help her financially to meet her needs and face challenges such as pests and weather variation. Her dream is to buy more land to continue planting.  

She likes to visit family during the August 15 festival of María Auxiliadora, as well as during carnival, Christmas, New Year's, and Holy Week.

loans.use: to buy materials and animal feed.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary sells fish.  She is 40 years-old and married with five children and four of them go to school.  Mary borrowed a loan to stock more fish to sell.  She hopes to expand her business in the future with the extra profit generated.

loans.use: to stock more fish to sell.

loans.name: Antonietta

texts.en:
Antonietta is 43 years old and married. she has seven children and four are in school, Antonietta works very hard to provide for them.

Antonietta runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks for her store.

Antonietta has been in this business for 27 years and sells a variety of items such as soap, shampoo, drinks and other groceries. 

In the future, Antonietta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Pochita

texts.es: Pochita de 32 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo José de 47 años y sus 4 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. En su propia casa Pochita tiene un puesto de comida donde vende sus deliciosos platillos, el aroma que sale de sus ricos potajes es suficiente para atraer a los clientes, su puesto es muy concurrido y por lo general vende mucho durante toda la mañana. Tiene 3 años en este negocio, el cual le ha dado el dinero necesario para alimentar a sus hijos y pagar sus estudios, pero siente que más adelante va a tener más gastos y el dinero le va a faltar, por eso desea poner un restaurante, donde pueda vender con más comodidad sus sabrosos platos y así mejorar su ingresos económicos. A ella le gusta conversar con sus clientes, disfruta mucho haciéndolo, pero le es muy difícil atender a todas las personas que recurren a su puesto, pero igual no decae en su afán de salir adelante y esta dispuesta a trabajar mucho para lograrlo. Este será su décimo segundo crédito con MFP y por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más ingredientes para preparar la comida que vende.
texts.en:
Pochita is 32 years old.  She is a very kind and hard-working woman who lives in her own home together with her husband, 47 year-old José, and her four beloved children, who she would like to provide with a better quality of life.

Pochita has a food stall in her own home where she sells delicious meals.  The aroma that wafts from her delicious soups is enough to attract customers.  Her stall is very popular and she generally sells a lot throughout the whole morning.  Pochita has been in this business for three years and it has made her the money she needs to feed her children and pay for their education.  However, she feels that she will have more expenses in the future and will not have enough money to cover them.  For this reason, she would like to set up a restaurant where she can sell her delicious dishes more comfortably and also improve her income.  

Pochita enjoys chatting with her customers and enjoys her work but it is very difficult to serve all the people who come to her business.  However, she does not flag in her eagerness to get ahead in life and she is prepared to work very hard in order to achieve this.

This will be Pochita's twelfth loan from MFP and she hopes to receive the support of each and every one of you.  Pochita will use the 2,000 Peruvian soles she has requested to buy more ingredients with which to prepare the food that she sells.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making food

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase pigs, sheep and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Ghada

texts.en:
Ghada is a 30-year-old woman who is married and has two sons and three daughters. Ghada lives in Gaza City in Gaza Strip, Palestine. Ghada's husband is a carpenter who makes home and office furniture in his workshop. He wants to expand his carpentry business by preparing a space to exhibit the furniture he makes. This became possible when Ghada took out a loan from Kiva partner, FATEN, to cover the expenses of preparing the space by painting it and changing the tiles.
Ghada is a religious woman, as are most of Gaza Strip's inhabitants, therefore her husband is photographed instead.

loans.use: to pay for preparing a space to exhibit furniture in her husband's workshop

loans.name: Regina

texts.es: Regina vive en la ciudad D. Cartagena y a sus 25 años D. edad, es toda una empresaria D. la microempresa; ella se dedica a la comercialización D. productos variados como cremas,  perfumes y ropa en general; negocio que inició desD. hace 4 años, cuando entró a la Universidad y requirió tener ingresos suficientes para sus gastos, que en su totalidad estaban a cargo D. su madre; así fue como inició construyendo un  mercado doméstico en este establecimiento y vendió a sus compañeros D. estudios  con excelentes resultado. A ella le ha ido tan bien, que se siente entusiasmada para continuar su crecimiento como persona y como empresaria. Esta es la razón por la cual acuD. a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Maro Santo Domingo, con la cual comprará ropa y perfumería en general, así  ganará descuentos, aumentará su capital D. trabajo y continuará fortaleciendo su sueño D. tener un almacén bien posicionado  y generando más ingresos y en el futuro muchos empleos.
texts.en:
Regina, 25, lives in the city of Cartagena.  She’s quite the entrepreneur in her micro business.  She sells various products like creams, perfumes and clothes in general, a business she started four years ago when she entered university and needed to earn income to cover expenses which her mother had to cover in their entirety.  This is how she started building a domestic market at the university selling to her classmates and obtaining excellent results.  

She’s done so well, in fact, that she feels excited about continuing to grow both as a person and as a businesswoman.  This is why she’s calling on her Kiva loan, the first loan she’s gotten from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that she’ll use to buy clothes and perfumery in general.  She will earn discounts this way and will increase her working capital continuing to strengthen her dream of having a well-placed store in the future that generates more income and lots of jobs.

loans.use: to buy clothing and perfumery in general.
