loans.name: Kunthy

texts.en:
Kunthy is a weaver and she also assists her husband in their farming business. They live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have four children - three sons and one daughter.   

Kunthy is asking for a loan of $500 to make repairs and stair rails for her house.

loans.use: To make repairs and stair rails for her house

loans.name: Ramie

texts.en:
Ramie is 32 years old and married. He has two children aged 7 and 10.

Ramie is a farmer working in Banga, South Cotabato. He grows rice and coconuts to sell. Ramie works hard to provide for his family and send his children to school. He plans to use his loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. Ramie hopes for his business to grow.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Azucena

texts.en:
Azucena is 51 years old and married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.
Azucena sells ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 19,500 PHP through Kiva partner, NWTF, to buy pants, blouses, slippers etc. to sell on her stall.
Azucena has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, slippers etc. for resale.

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es: Ana Patricia tiene su negocio que es la venta de celulares y accesorios. Tiene más de 10 años en esta actividad. Inicio con su ex esposo quien le enseño todo acerca de este negocio, pues ella con ciertos ahorros decidió emprender esta actividad Ana deposita diariamente mucho entusiasmo y alegría en lo que realiza es por medio de este trabajo que les ha brindado a sus 3 hijos de 4, 8 y 10 años respectivamente las comodidades necesarias. Ella solicita este crédito con el fin de comprar repuestos de teclados, protectores, auriculares, fundas de silicón, cargadores, memorias entre otras cosas.
texts.en:
Ana Patricia has a business selling cell phones and accessories.  She has been in this line of work for more than ten years.  She started with her ex-husband who taught her everything about the business.  She decided to start the business with some savings that she had.

Every day, Ana puts a lot of enthusiasm and cheerfulness into what she does.  Through this work, she has been able to provide her three children aged 4, 8 and 10 with the comforts they need.  She is requesting this loan to buy keyboards, protectors, headphones, silicon cases, chargers, memory cards, etc.

loans.use: to buy parts such as keyboards, protectors, headphones, silicon cases, chargers, memory cards, etc.

loans.name: Nuruipa's Group

texts.en:
Nuruipa, the leader of this group, is 50 years old, married to a tractor driver, and the mother of a son who is employed and a daughter who is studying at university.

In order to earn money to meet the family's daily needs, Nuruipa takes orders and sews Kyrgyz national blankets and pillows. As well, the couple cultivates agricultural products. This year they are growing potatoes and wheat, but Nuruipa needs financial help to collect the harvest. With money received from the loan she will purchase fuel and hire labor.

In the future she plans to continue supporting her daughter's education and purchase home furniture to improve the family's living conditions.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year.

To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fuel and hire labor to collect the harvest.

loans.name: Jonabel

texts.en:
Jonabel is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Jonabel has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 17,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Jonabel has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Jonabel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Esperance

texts.en: Esperance is 31 years old and has four children between the ages of 6 and 11. All of her children are in school. She is married to a man who works at a gas station. Esperance sells vegetables such as tomatoes, carrots, onions, and eggplants in a store she has run for four years. She would like a loan to increase her inventory of vegetables. She will use the profits to reinvest in her business. She would love to see her business grow every day.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Gemma is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. Gemma has a shop that sells used clothing or ukay-ukay. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy stocks of used clothing. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Gemma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of used clothing.

loans.name: Azra's Group

texts.en:
Azra is married and has four sons. All of them left their education without completion and started working as masons.

Her husband is a fruit seller. He sells fresh quality seasonal fruits to his clients at low rates. He is very fair in his customer dealings and makes good sales everyday. He gets up early in the morning and goes to the fruit market so he can purchase the quality fruits for selling. He is very dedicated to his work and he never compromises on quality and services. 

Azra is also very caring in nature. She not only manages her household responsibilities efficiently but also gives the required time to her sewing works. Her quality sewing helps her encourage her clients to take on her services. She utilizes her income in paying off the utility expenses.

She is requesting for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for further expansion of her husband’s fruit selling business. With the loan investment, he will buy fresh quality seasonal fruits for selling to his clients to obtain higher profits. He has been operating his business for many years and Azra is confident that an investment will help him improve his business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fresh seasonal fruits for a fruit selling business.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Imelda has a shop that sells canned goods, noodles, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 8,000 Philippine pesos to buy canned goods, detergent, and beverages.

Imelda has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, detergent, and beverages

loans.name: Chiru

texts.en:
Chiru is a divorced woman with five children. One of her children attends school, and the others have graduated from school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fess.

For the past ten years, she has operated a business selling maize from home to her neighbours and passers-by. In addition she also owns rental houses, which serve as another source of income. She dreams of establishing more rental houses in the future.

With the 20,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase iron sheets and cement to renovate her rental houses. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase iron sheets and cement to renovate her rental houses.

loans.name: Guillermo Felix

texts.es:
Guillermo Felix  tiene 49 años de edad, él vive en Ica, Perú. Ica se encuentra ubicado en el Desierto de Sechura cerca de cuatro horas al sur de Lima, la capital del país, y es aclamado por los peruanos como "La Tierra del Sol". Es conocida en el Perú por sus frecuentes terremotos (un 8,0 en 2007 y 6.9 en 2011), su producción de uvas, espárragos y aceitunas, y tal vez sobre todo, como la fuente de la bebida tradicional del Perú nacional, el Pisco. En este clima cálido y árido se encuentra la casa y empresa del cliente.  En su tiempo libre disfruta Arreglar Motos;  como bien se sabe el Perú se caracteriza por tener las comidas más deliciosas del mundo y uno de los platos que a Guillermo le gusta mucho es el “Seco de Cabrito”. Guillermo estudió hasta quinto año de secundaria debido a problemas  económicos de sus padres, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar 0 Mecánica Automotriz.

Guillermo trabaja como conductor de mototaxi pero tanta son las ganas de salir adelante de Guillermo que también con mucho esfuerzo trabaja  en su Taller de reparación de mototaxi, se dedica a ambos trabajos alrededor de 11 horas diarias, ya que el nos dice que sin sacrificio no hay crecimiento, sus amigos lo animaron ya que tiene mucha habilidad para la reparación de estos vehículos y porque también sabe manejar y es muy prudente al hacerlo. En un día Guillermo puede atender alrededor de 50 clientes y esto le permite ganar hasta  S/. 30 diarios y en un buen día puede ganar  hasta S/.60  lo que le ayuda en algunos gastos adicionales para su hogar o para  invertir en el negocio, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es cumplido en la entrega de sus trabajos , es honrado, responsable y sobre todo muy honesto y es por eso que sus clientes siempre lo buscan y lo recomiendan a otras personas. Guillermo está muy agradecido hacia  los prestatarios Kiva ya que con este apoyo el podrá remodelar su taller de mecánica y remodelar su casa.

Esta mejora podrá ayudarle a tener un mejor ambiente para realizar su trabajo y con ello tendrá una mejor calidad de vida ya que tendrá mejores ingresos y así en algunos meses le gustaría tener un taller más grande lo que lo ayudará a cumplir su gran sueño: "Tener su casa propia."
texts.en:
Guillermo Félix, 49, lives in Ica, Perú.  Ica is located in the Sechura Desert almost four hours south of Lima, the national capital, and is acclaimed by Peruvians as “The Land of the Sun.”  It’s noted in Peru for its frequent earthquakes (an 8.0 in 2007 and a 6.9 in 2011), its grape, asparagus and olive production and, above all, as the source of Peru’s traditional, national beverage: Pisco.

In this hot, arid weather we find our client’s home and business.  In his spare time he enjoys repairing motorcycles.  As he well knows, Peru is known for having the most delicious food in the world and one of Guillermo’s favorite dishes is “Seco de Cabrito.”  Guillermo studied up to eleventh grade due to his parent’s economic problems; he would have liked to study Auto Mechanics.

Guillermo works as a mototaxi driver but his drive to get ahead is so strong that he also works very hard in his motorcycle repair shop.  He spends about 11 hours daily at both jobs and tells us that without sacrifice, there is no growth.  His friends encouraged him because he’s very skilled in vehicle repair and because he knows how to drive and is a very prudent driver.

In a typical day, Guillermo can tend to 50 customers which produces a 30-sol daily profit for him and on a good day he might earn up to 60 soles which helps him cover some additional household expenses or to invest in the business.  He believes that he does well in his business because he finishes his jobs on time, he’s honest and responsible but, above all, very honest and this is why his customers seek him out and recommend him to others.

Guillermo is very grateful to Kiva lenders because he’ll be able to use the loan to remodel his workshop and his house.  This improvement will help him have a better environment in which to carry out his work and this will create a better quality of life since his income will improve and in a few months he’d like to have a larger workshop that will help him reach his great dream: “To have his own house.”

loans.use: to remodel his shop and his house.

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam is 48 years old and married with 12 children. She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Meriam has been raising livestock for seven years and also earns additional income by buying and selling charcoal and bananas.

Meriam is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her business. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase feed and vitamins for her business

loans.name: Jose Ines

texts.es: José Inés es un microempresario de éxito que tiene su taller de carpintería desde hace 10 años, tiene 35 años de edad, soltero y con cuatro hijos menores, inicia su negocio fabricando pocos muebles como camas matrimoniales  por falta de capital, poco a poco con sus utilidades se fue capitalizando comprando materia prima como la madera lo que fue haciendo muebles en escalas y comercializarlos en los diferentes mercados del país, actualmente cuenta con dos trabajadores. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima como pega, madera cedro real, clavos de dos pulgadas, selladores, lijas, bisagra, tornillos, caladoras etc.
texts.en:
José Inés is a succesful small business owner who has been running a carpentry shop for ten years.  He is 35, single and has four minor children.  He started his business with a small amount of capital making only a few pieces of furniture such as double beds.  Little by little, he earned more money and began buying wood to make more furniture and sell it in different markets throughout the country.  He now employs two people.

He plans to use the loan to buy raw materials such as glue, cedar wood, two-inch nails, sealants, sandpaper, hinges, screws, etc.

loans.use: To buy raw materials such as glue, cedar wood, two-inch nails, sealants, sandpaper, hinges, screws, etc.

loans.name: Mbodze

texts.en:
Mbodze, aged 35 years, is married and has been blessed with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past one year, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of stiff competition in her business. Mbodze dreams of expanding her business to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 35,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase retail shop items of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil. Mbodze joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase retail shop items of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Kanuma Group

texts.fr:
Pierre fait partie du groupe Kanuma  et  habite à  Bubanza. Il a 65 ans  et est marié  à Diane, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 8 enfants âgés de 20 à 26 ans dont 2 étudient.
Il a sous sa charge ses 3 neveux.

Il fait le commerce de viande de chèvre  depuis  43  ans. 

Il est à son deuxième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de chèvres  pour  vendre une grande quantité de  viande  pour gagner plus.

Dans les  prochaines années, il  voudrait  construire  une belle maison et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Pierre is part of the Kanuma group and lives in Bubanza. He is 65 years old and is married to Diane, a farmer. Together, they have eight children between 20 and 26 years old. Two of their children go to school. He also has his three nephews under his supervision.

He has been selling goat meat for 43  years. This is his second loan with Turame. With the Kiva loan he receives, he will grow his capital and buy a lot of goats. That will help him sell a lot of meat and earn more money. 

In the next few years, he would like to build a nice home and see his children go to school.

loans.use: buy a lot of goats so that he can sell a lot of meat and earn more money.

loans.name: Gbenonkpo Group

texts.fr: GBENONKPO est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Ramatou (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 34 ans. Ramatou  est veuve, mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à sa charge. Ramatou vit seule avec ses enfants, les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Ramatou. Pour cette raison, Ramatou vend des céréales dans sa région depuis trois ans. De façon secondaire Ramatou vend aussi divers produits ; ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Ramatou s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Ramatou sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe GBENONKPO, un crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des céréales et divers produits.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Here is Gloria, a resident of Payatas, Quezon City, Philippines. Recently, she had a loan worth PHP 28,000 which she had used for her sari-sari store business within their vicinity. But now, she's into another business. She's currently dealing with selling beds in their area. Actually, she sustains all her needs through her business while ably helping her family at the same time. This is why, she would like to give her gratitude to those who lent her assistance previously. 

To improve sales, Gloria would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional beds to sell. With PHP 28,000, she can certainly make her livelihood improve and eventually grow with the grace of God. For now, it is her desire to have people like you who will assist her in her prospect. 

In the future, Gloria hopes to give her family a more favorable kind of living and simultaneously drive her inventory into progress. She wants to own eventually her own store. With trust and perseverance, she does everything to earn for her kids' education and future securities. 

She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase additional beds to sell.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en: Nida is 57 years old and lives in Poblacion, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has two adult children. Nida earns her living from dried-fish vending business. She's been in the business for 2 years and earns approximately PHP 1,500 each month doing this type of business activity. She also receives support from her husband who is a fisherman. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional stocks about 50 kilos of variety of dried fish for retail. Nida has been a member of PMPC for almost 11 years. In the future, Nida hopes to establish a stall at the market to display her dried fish for retail.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing additional stocks about 50 kilos of variety of dried fish

loans.name: María Guadalupe

texts.en:
Maria Guadalupe has since some time ago started to make and sell hamburgers in her home, which is located in city of Escobedo, in the province of Nuevo Leon. She is married and has four children, all of whom are currently in school. The unconditional support from her husband is what has made possible for Maria Guadalupe to keep going after 5 years of running her project, that she then started to be able to provide her children with a better quality of life and an education as a base for their future well-being.

She now needs a loan in the amount of $250 to be able to keep up her business, this amount she plans on repaying in a term of 3 to 6 months, and will be used towards the purchase of ingredients and utensils she needs to make the foods she sells. Help Maria Guadalupe and her family. They need you, don’t hesitate any longer. .

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

María Guadalupe hace tiempo que comenzó a elaborar y vender hamburguesas en sus domicilio, mismo que se encuentra en la localidad de Escobedo, en el estado de Nuevo León. Ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos, todo se encuentran estudiando actualmente. El apoyo incondicional para con su esposo, es lo que ha hecho posible que María Guadalupe después de 5 años continúe con el proyecto que en ese entonces inició para poder brindarles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y la educación que será la base de su bienestar futuro.

Ella ahora necesita de un crédito por la cantidad de $250 DLLS para así poder seguir con su negocio, esta cantidad la planea regresar en un plazo de 3 a 6 meses, y la destinará para la compra de insumos e utensilios que requiere para la elaboración de los alimentos que vende. Apoya a María Guadalupe y su familia, ellos te necesitan, no lo dudes más.

loans.use: purchase merchanise

loans.name: Agustín

texts.en:
Mr. Agustín is originally from San Luís Potosí. He is 50 years old, and just over 20 years ago he moved to Monterrey along with his family, with the goal of getting ahead and improving the quality of life of his children and wife. For 17 years he has worked selling fruit, vegetables, and legumes. Each morning he travels to Cadereyta, the source of the products he uses to supply other vendors in San Nicolás de los Garza. Mr. Agustín is a very hardworking person with a lot of desire to succeed, and in addition to his commercial work, he also cultivates and sells his own cilantro, beets, spinach, and parsley on a hectare of land which he has on a ranch.

Mr. Agustín has put all his strength into making his business grow, and little by little he has seen the results of considerable gowth in his sales. At present he needs a loan of $550.00 which he will use to invest in more merchandise, alowing him to raise his sales level and generate more income for his family.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Meas

texts.en: Mr. Meas C. sells rice and Khmer food in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.  He lives with his wife and 5 children--1 of whom works at a private school in the city.  He will use this loan to purchase food and other equipment for his restaurant.  He hopes to grow his business, and eventually start a getaway resort in the provinces if he earns enough money.

loans.use: To purchase food, utensils and other equipment for restaurant

loans.name: Vasiliy

texts.en:
Vasiliy is a taxi driver who provides transportation services throughout Ukraine. He is married with two grown sons. His business has been the only source of income for his family. Vasiliy understands his role as head and provider for his family and is ready to work 24/7 to provide for the needs of his loved ones. He has been faithfully working in this business for seven years. 

Currently, Vasiliy’s daily income is about $40-50. An economical diesel engine in his car helps him reduce his operating costs and add to his bottom line. The fifteen loans that Vasiliy has received from Nadiya Ukraine have helped to promote stability and growth in his business.  

Vasiliy is asking for a loan of $1,000 to help purchase a newer, more comfortable car for long distance trips around the Ukraine. Vasiliy decided to become self-employed when the auto company he had worked for went bankrupt. He understands the effort and commitment it takes to be a private entrepreneur, and is willing to work hard in his business to be able to support his family which is the first priority in his life.

loans.use: Purchase new vehicle

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: Mrs. Heng C., 19, lives with her husband, one little child, and one of her parents in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is a housewife and has to take care of her baby, while her husband, 20, provides income for his household by buying and selling recyclable products in his community. He typically makes around $3.60 each day. This couple hopes to use this loan to purchase a motorcycle to transport their recyclable items further, more easily, faster and more effectively.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to transport their recyclable items further, more easily, faster and more effectively.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more tables and chairs

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga owns a successful clothing and shoe sales business located at the Victoria market in Nicopol, Ukraine. She has been selling in the market for about seven years. Her business has benefited from a good sales location and constant demand for her products. Olga tries to offer good prices to her customers while still making a profit. A normal monthly income from her business is around $600. Olga is married and has two kids, and her business is a good source of income for her family.

Olga has requested a loan of $1200 to increase her product inventory. This is a busy time of the year for many market vendors as people purchase new winter clothing and get ready for the upcoming New Year and Christmas holidays. By purchasing additional inventory, Olga will be better prepared to meet increased demand and earn a good income.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand her business

loans.name: Begilia

texts.es:
Begilia is an enterprising businesswoman. Her initiative and will to work are carrying her on the road to success in her business of clothing textiles. She currently lives with her two sons and husband in the small home of her elderly parents. With great creativity she has adapted her small factory and installed 10 sewing machines. With this small factory she has been able to offer employment to 9 other workers, who with persistence and agility sew about 180 sweaters and vests every day. Doña Begilia would like to save enough to build a house and offer a proper and secure dwelling to her little sprouts, in addition to giving comfort and well-being to her workers. With this proposal in mind she has thought to acquire a large quantity of raw material (wool) to continue growing with her beautiful labor. "With your generous support this exemplary mother's plans can take shape."

Translated from Spanish by Mark Holmes, Kiva Volunteer

Begilia, es una mujer emprendedora y empresaria, su iniciativa y su voluntad para el trabajo la están llevando por el camino del éxito en su negocio de tejidos de prendas de vestir. Ella actualmente vive junto a sus 2 hijos y esposo en el pequeño domicilio de sus ancianos padres, con gran creatividad ha adecuado su tallercito y a instalado en el 10 máquinas de tejer, con esta pequeña fábrica ha podido ofrecer empleo a otros 9 trabajadores, quienes con su empeño y agilidad diariamente tejen alrededor de 180 chompas y chalecos.El deseo de doña Begilia es ahorrar lo suficiente para construir su casita y así ofrecerles una morada propia y segura a sus pequeños retoños, además de brindarles comodidad y bienestar a sus trabajadores, con este propósito en mente tiene pensado adquirir una gran cantidad de materia prima ( lana) para seguir creciendo ampliamente con su bella labor.“Con tu generoso aporte esta ejemplar madre podrá cristalizar sus planes”

loans.use: Purchase of a large quantity of raw material

loans.name: Maximina's Group

texts.es:
Elizabeth, Mercedes and Maximina have belonged to the Workers Communal Bank for 8, 3, and 14 years respectively.

Elizabeth is 28 years old and has 1 daughter of 8 years. Elizabeth sells fruits in the Nery Garcia market. She buys the fruit wholesale from the province of San Miguel.

On the other hand, Mercedes is married, is 33 years old and has 3 children. Mercedes has a grocery store in her house. In addition, Mercedes has a bakery where she makes typical loaves of bread such as "chapla" that she distributes to all the stores of her area.

Maximina is married, is 60 years old and has 6 children. Maximina has a restaurant in her house, an activity that she started 4 years ago.

Elizabeth, Mercedes and Maximina need loans of 600 soles, 1400 soles, and 600 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of oranges, flour, firewood, rice, milk, meat and cheese.

The dreams of Elizabeth, Mercedes and Maximina are to improve their business, that their children study and become professionals, and to initiate new business.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Elizabeth, Mercedes y Maximina pertenecen al Banco Comunal Obreras hace 8, 3, 14 años respectivamente.

Elizabeth es conviviente, tiene 28 años y 1 hija D. 8 años, Elizabeth venD. frutas en el mercado Nery García, la fruta lo compra al por mayor D. la provincia D. San Miguel.

Por otro lado Mercedes es casada, tiene 33 años y 3 hijos, Mercedes tiene una tienda D. abarrotes en su casa. Además Mercedes tiene su panadería donD. elabora panes típicos como la “chapla” y lo reparte a todas las tiendas D. su zona.

Mientras que Maximina es casada, tiene 60 años y 6 hijos, Maximina tiene un restaurante en su casa, actividad que realiza hace 4 años.

Elizabeth, Mercedes y Maximina necesitan préstamos D. 600 soles, 1400 soles, 600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. naranja, harina, leña, arroz, leche, carne y queso.

Los sueños D. Elizabeth, Mercedes y Maximina son mejorar su negocio, que sus hijos estudien y sean profesionales, iniciar nuevos negocios.

loans.use: To buy oranges, flour, firewood, rice, milk, meat and cheese.

loans.name: Abdul Samat

texts.en: Abdul Samat lives in district 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is uneducated. He is a butcher, a business he started five years ago with the help of his father. Now he wants to expand his business so he wants to take out an individual loan to enlarge his shop and expand his stock to make a good income and support his family. He is happy that he can further his business. He would like to thank those who help poor people around this country.

loans.use: To expand his shop

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia is a very hard-working and enterprising woman who has dedicated her life to work for the well-being of her 4 kids, who are now good men. The whole family wishes to improve their work space and offer better services to the community, and it is for precisely this reason that they would like a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Alicia, es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora que ha dedicado su vida al trabajo con el deseo de procurarles bienestar a sus 4 pequeños que ahora ya se han convertido en hombres de bien. La familia en pleno desea mejorar su espacio de trabajo y ofrecer más y mejores servicios a su comunidad, y precisamente a esta razón atiende su petición de un préstamo.

loans.use: An injection of capital to reboot her small workshop/Inyección de capital para reflotar su pequeño taller.
